Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here you will be sorry”
Reviews.Author: Ramona I
Reviews.Content: I can't say more what a total disappointment this hotel was our first night in NY and seeing the lobby should have been a warning. The hallways are narrow and dirty. The room for 4 people is nothing what we were told about when making the reservation. The room was very small and unclean there was no space for 4 people and luggage. We were also told that this hotel was recently renovated I don't think so. We complained to staff and we were given another room which was bigger but the smell of mildew was enough that we all felt sick. A fan sat outside the room so I guess they had a water issue but of course failed to inform us. We didn't stay the night, we left for another hotel which was lovely and clean. When we phoned Best Western customer service to complain they said there is nothing they can do because this hotel is independent, well guess what I won't stay at another Best Western again

Reviews.Title: “I love the room and breakfast is excellent.”
Reviews.Author: MojiOkubule
Reviews.Content: It is very clean, full service provided and the breakfast is excellent . I love the view of my room in New York. The staff were nice and friendly and the trip to the airport was smooth and the surrounding attraction was excellent. i had a great time when i stayed there.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: ShoreProud
Reviews.Content: We spent two nights here to celebrate our anniversary. This is a great location. Right out the door to Times Square. Walk to Rockafella Plaza, Radio City, The Apple Store, FAO Schwarz Toy Store and Central Park. The M&M Store and The Hersey Store are a must. If you are a Fox News Fan the News Corp. Buildiing is a short walk almost across from Radio City. We took the subway to Ground Zero to see the 911 Memorial which we hightly recommend. The hotel was clean and had a nice bathroom with good shower pressure. We thought the breakfast buffet was a little expensive at $15, atleast for us, so we ate breakfast at McDonalds. The only problem we had was the parking. We had trouble finding the hotel's parking garage. Once we finally found it we were told our vehicle was too big (we drive a Yukon) and had to go to the other garage, which was even farther away and more difficult for us to find. With all the fast pace traffic in NY you really nead to know where you are going to be ready to turn. We went by it a couple of times before we were able to get into the right lane to turn into the building. But it finally worked out and we had a great time. We recommend this hotel when visiting NY. It is a great price and location.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing to write home about”
Reviews.Author: Greg Y
Reviews.Content: Though the staff was friendly and the lobby looked to have had a decent face-lift, the hotel is clearly very old and the room itself was incredibly small (even by NYC standards) and uncomfortable. The greatest disappointment was that the double occupancy/single bed room only had an uncomfortable full-sized bed (vs a queen or king most other places)--and two grown adults shouldn't be subjected to such close quarters (no matter how in love they are). We would have gladly paid $50 more a night for a bigger, more comfortable bed. Bathroom was also clearly dated, but reasonably clean. Location is central.

Reviews.Title: “Better Somewhere Else”
Reviews.Author: Gretchen S
Reviews.Content: When I read the website for this hotel, they stated that they recently remodeled, so I gave them the benefit of a doubt on past reviews I had read and went ahead amd booked 3 nights this past weekend. I chose this hotel for the location and the fact that they had a junior suite that could accomodate three adults. We found that this place hasn't been remodeled in a very long time. Honestly, the lobby and hallways look like you have entered a brothel.These spaces are decorated in purple plush and leather. The lobby offers beer, wine and cocktails for $5 to the public. I did not feel unsafe there, but it was not a lobby I would be comfortable relaxing in. Our room was not decorated in purple, but in a Presidents theme with Mount Rushmore over the pull out bed and a lighted bust of George Washington in the other room. I awoke to pictures of Gerald Ford and John Kennedy for three days. The room was clean, and the maid service excellent. When you book a room in Times Square you expect noise, energy and action. What no one else has mentioned here is that this hotel is in the same block as a NY Fire Station and sirens are wailing all the time. We paid $888.00 for our three night stay. I come to NYC frequently and I know I could have done better.

Reviews.Title: “Well”
Reviews.Author: dclee1968
Reviews.Content: Just got back from new York and this hotel looks better in the photos, rooms are tiny very hot decor is very dark best thing about this hotel is what every one else is said, is the location. If you are goin to new York dont wait for your change they don't bring it back . We tip all the time but we don't like it when they expect it from taxi drivers bar staff hotel staff even had to pay the staff at the hotel to put are bags in a closet why we went out for the last few hours till the taxi picked us up, and strap urselfs in the drivers are mad all from Africa and Pakistan

Reviews.Title: “Small Room But Fantastic Location”
Reviews.Author: EJPWales1
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed in this hotel for four nights. Our room was clean but small and the deco was a bit worn, however for the price and location this was to be expected. This was not too much of a problem though as we barely spent any time there due to the sightseeing and nightlife. The fantasic location of this hotel outwieghed the hotels flaws. From the hotel it is only a very short walk to Times Square with other attractions - Central Park, Rockafella Centre, Fifth Ave, Grand Central Station, Madison Sq Gardens, Empire State within walking distance. I would recommend the Grayline tours (red hop on/hop off buses) these buses stop either end of the hotel street and are good value - they are especially good if you have not visited New York before. The Location of this hotel is particularly good if you are looking to watch some shows as all broadway shows are a very short walk.

Reviews.Title: “great location.”
Reviews.Author: littlepatsy
Reviews.Content: this hotel was in a fantastic location. we could see the corner of times square from our window Just steps away. hotel very good clean well furnished. Free breakfast which in new york is great fresh hot and cold buffet. good choice.. very helpful reception. so central to everything. Rooms slightly bigger than average for new york with usa president themes.

Reviews.Title: “Great location,, "tired" building !”
Reviews.Author: jth1776
Reviews.Content: This is one of the best hotel locations in NYC, especially for the Times Square/ Theater district. However, the building looks "tired" inside & out! Our room WAS CLEAN, but worn. Paint was "chipping" in the corners, the fixtures were "cracked" & worn in the bathroom, The room, as well as the entire building is in desperate need of an update (renovations). Also, unlike most other Best Westerns, there was NO complementary breakfast. They wanted $14.95 for a "continental" breakfast of juice, toast, fruit, or cereal.

Reviews.Title: “they are liars”
Reviews.Author: wonho k
Reviews.Content: i reserved this hotel just because free parking(shown Priceline.com) so i made a reservation ,suit room, 3days but when i check in, they said they can't serve free parking but discount! and they are all rude and unkind to me and didn't tell me parking location and internet is too slow ,so finally gave up access to internet location...this is the only good merit for this hotel...

Reviews.Title: “Cozy room; Average Service”
Reviews.Author: inthebiz131
Reviews.Content: My first impression of this propery was very good based on the photos. The hotel looks very boutique which I would not have expected from a Best Western property. I got a terrific rate and the location is fantastic if you are going to be Broadway show hopping, which we were. Upon check in, I was sent to a room that had HAIR in the shower. Being that I'm in the hospitality industry, and I didn't want to be ungrateful for my great rate, I just asked to be moved to another room. I was moved to a corner room where there was more hair in this bathroom than the last. I was kind of disappointed, but nevertheless, asked to be moved again. This time I was going to be moved to a courtyard room that smelled of smoke, so I opted to go back to the corner room and have housekeeping come up and clean the bathroom. The security man who was on duty was very nice and assisted me as well as a member of the housekeeping staff. The rooms are teeny, tiny but overall for the 4 nights I was there, I had a very cozy stay with my daughter. The Pros: Great Location, trendy lobby, nice housekeeping staff and bellstaff (or door staff) not really sure what their function was, in-room digital safe was convenient, great shower pressure. Cons: Front desk staff is NOT friendly or welcoming, unresponsive to guest concerns, seemed overwhelmed by the amount of check ins, blamed other members for issues, for example: DO NOT STAY IN A CORNER ROOM if you NEED internet access! Internet DOES NOT work! I was told, "Yeah, that's because you are in a corner room why your internet does not work because of the metal". Really? I didn't get any apology. Advise guests of this. I heard from other guests that internet was generally slow except in lobby which is why, I imagine, lobby was always packed with people on their laptops. Hallways are too hot, A/C unit in room is extremely loud, elevators are too small and take forever. Upon my check out, the agent did not smile or thank me for staying-she seemed annoyed that she had to walk to her bank to refund my deposit. All in all- the room was adequate enough for my trip but the service is not so great. iCARE was not in effect at this property and training is desperately needed.

Reviews.Title: “Great location to Times Square”
Reviews.Author: David K
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed the location to Times Square. We had value for money. Staff were not that interested which didn't worry us . Room was a little small & quite warm but clean enough. There was no fridge which was unexpected. Would return again for the location.

Reviews.Title: “terrible hotel”
Reviews.Author: serdar t
Reviews.Content: Me and my 3 friends stayed at this terrible hotel for 3 days. The receptionists were so impolite.They were speaking to us like they were hating us. The doormen were very bad.They didn't helped us at all. They were just looking to our face and never helped us to carry our bags even I was giving tips to them for assistance. The room we stayed was so tiny, two people coludn't walk at the same time. The bathroom and toilet were so destroyed that they were oxidated. I will never advise this hotel to any of my friends.Don't stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel but beware of the HUSTLER”
Reviews.Author: Marco D
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel location is perfect, our room is clean and the workers are also nice. my only negative feedback is there's this person between the doors of the hotel wearing a cap and a jacket with an airport taxi logo who keep on asking me if i want to go to the airport , I told him the bellman is calling me a taxi , he still insist that its the same price 65 bucks to jfk. When I ask him how come its to expensive he told me he works for the hotel and that's how much they charge. When i ask the bellman if he ( the guy with a gray van with airport taxi sign ) works for the hotel he told me no. The bellman got me a cab for 55 bucks including tolls. How can the hotel let HUSTLERS do that to the guest just like they do at the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Crazy Decor and Small Room”
Reviews.Author: Kathlyne
Reviews.Content: The room worked for me because I was only spending one night. I didn't spend any time in the room other than sleeping really. The room and bathroom were tiny. The decor is very strange. Both of the lamps in the room were broken and there was mold/mildew in the shower. The walls (which had insane wall paper) were covered in dust. The bed was made very oddly--the top sheet only seemed to cover half the bed. And the comforter was lumpy. On the upside the place has a great location. I wouldn't want to stay here for more than one night. Luckily we got a room at the back of the hotel, so noise from the street wasn't really a problem. Our window looked out onto the central skylight, which was filthy and covered with trash. It was fine just to have a bed to sleep in, but I wouldn't want to have to stay here any longer than that.

Reviews.Title: “Very good location”
Reviews.Author: JavierKQ
Reviews.Content: As NY hotels, it has an small room with the minimum needed. It has an modern style in the room and in the lobby. In 5 days I always found a lot of disorder and a mess of towels outside the rooms.

Reviews.Title: “be realistic about what you'll be getting and you won't be disappointed”
Reviews.Author: travelgirl13318
Reviews.Content: I researched lots of hotels before finally booking at the best western plus president at times square. There are lots of pros and also a few cons about the hotel. But overall I don't regret my stay there and I think if you are realistic you won't either. There are lots of hotels in Manhattan that charge significantly more. Pros: 1. Location. If it's your first time in Manhattan and you want to be in the middle of all the touristy stuff OR if you're going for the theatre, you really are supremely well located. A minute walk and you're in either location. The benefit of having a hotel in the heart of the city is that you can use it as a base and return to freshen up or drop off stuff if the need occurs. 2. Subway lines: You are a couple of minutes from several subway lines. Very convenient. 3. Restaurants: kind of expensive, but a reality of any downtown city resto, you can choose from an enormous amount of restaurants 4. Staff: I saw a lot of complaints on the site about the staff, but my experience was ok overall. It's a busy hotel. The staff were courteous and helpful. 5. Rooms: It's a hotel room in NYC. Really how much time do you want to stay there? My room was clean. Bed/sheets were clean. Floor and toilet as well. I felt comfortable walking barefoot. A couple smaller things weren't cleaned well: There's nothing like reaching for the TV remote control and having a hand full of dust. I guess previous occupants didn't really use it too much, but little details like that stick out. If you can live with little imperfections you'll be fine. 6. Price: It really is decent value for Times Square. 7. Did I mention location? Negatives: 1. Small towels. 2. Internet. Sometimes I was able to connect, sometimes I wasn't. It was 50/50. That was annoying. It's better in the lobby though. 3. Cheesy decor. No seriously. It's beyond words. 4. Had booked a queen bed but it looked more like a small double bed. Sofa bed is also small. 5. Noise. I was on the 8th floor and you definitely heard stuff from time to time from the street. It wasn't a big deal for me cause I'm a city girl but it's something you may have to deal with especially on the lower levels. Overall, this is definitely not a five star hotel. But I got what I was expecting to get. In the end I am a satisfied customer.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Location”
Reviews.Author: Gujjarwalprince
Reviews.Content: Best thing about the hotel was its excellent Location . One is at stones throw away from anything you want . All types of stores shops eatingplaces ,theates,times ssquare,tube,. But Lots of noise at night of fast moving Vehicles and revellers enjoying on roads that disturb your sleep.No good resturents in the hotel but that doesn't bother you because you can find all types of food joints at walking distance. Staff is good and courteosand prompt.Overall okay for short stay in the area of action in Newyork.

Reviews.Title: “service does not comes with a smile”
Reviews.Author: Charles W
Reviews.Content: locatin is the only positive thing about ths hotel . Deco is kitchy and cheap , elevators are always slow and packed , bathrooms realy small even when staying in a larger room , actually rooms are not that nice and not in a very clean and good condition. Cleaning lady leaves her trolly in the hall between the rooms 24/7 and most disturbing are the bad windows as no noise reduction so as a result i have had many near sleeples nights in this hotel. It would be nice if some of the people working in this hoel would be reminded that we are the customers and they should atleast try to be nice . I will not be back any time soon .

Reviews.Title: “Only reason you should stay here....location.”
Reviews.Author: carloso76
Reviews.Content: Staff is rude and extremely unprofessional, rooms are as small as they can be. Quality of the mattress and linen is way below any standard, bathrooms are a joke starting from the size and layout ending with the hair dryer, which has not been upgraded or even replaced since the 70's. This hotel hardly has any views (which is not unusual) but most of the views are looking directly at a big wall. Front desk staff seemed upset that I interrupted their conversation on who would go to lunch when I tried to check in. We had to move rooms several times due to heater not working in our room. Stay away from this place.

Reviews.Title: “Great location. That's it.”
Reviews.Author: WANDERLUSTKRS
Reviews.Content: Rooms too hot, mice in the first room I was in. Staff gave me wrong info about my room multiple times. Was told I had to move twice and then was told I didn't have to move at all.

Reviews.Title: “The Staff = Excellent Stay”
Reviews.Author: Violet T
Reviews.Content: Here's what made this hotel excellent: THE STAFF--and I mean everyone from the front desk to housekeeping to management. Check in was great--fast and very polite. Ditto for check out. We were also able to store our luggage so we could enjoy the day unencumbered. A late night party in an adjacent room was immediately addressed. And the manager, Jay Wm Dean, could not have been more accommodating. We had two rooms and they were immaculate. One of the rooms was a bit roomier than the other, but even though ours was small it met our needs. This hotel is bedbug free, which isn't just important; in a big city it's rare! The location is incredible: steps to Times Square. And the cost was half of what you'd expect in NYC for the location. We would stay there again in a New York minute!

Reviews.Title: “NYC - 48 hours”
Reviews.Author: Jenylyn
Reviews.Content: Great location, since it's right in Times Square. Extensive renovations to it recently and it's quite nice. Unfortunately, didn't quite meet follow through. My friends who came in a day earlier didn't have pillows in their room and were told to wait until tomorrow to see if they could get pillows. I mean really? My friend and I were staying in the Jefferson Suite which was quite nice. There was a sitting area with a couch/pull-out. Bathroom is a little on the small side, but enough for its purpose. The floor of the tub was peeling, ceiling had stains or just a really bad paint job, and the granite counter at the sink was majorly cracked (which I thought could be rather dangerous if it decided to give one day). Hallways smelled like cigarette smoke. Free wi-fi in the hotel which was nice, but shotty connection at times. Overall, I wouldn't really recommend this hotel if you will be in NYC for any longer than a couple of days. I'm sure you could get better for the same price or just a little bit more.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing location...”
Reviews.Author: sb1508
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights. The location is awesome, literally a 2 minute walk to Times Square. It's a safe place to stay at (we are two females). The hotel is gorgeous, the decor and vibe is great. Free wifi was a great touch as well. The rooms were really quite hot, which considering it was freezing outside was a bit strange, so we used the fan a lot, only downside of that was that the fan was SO loud. But we managed with it. The ensuite was great, had everything you needed and extra toiletries etc. There was a safe in the room which was really great to keep everything protected. Our room only got serviced once, not sure why this is, but we were not too bothered. Only downside was the size of the bed. When I booked it said a full size bed, but it was nowhere near big enough for two adults, so beware of this when booking and if you can opt for a bigger sized bed if available - we managed though as it was just a base for our NYC adventures so we were often so tired we just slept through.

Reviews.Title: “THE BEST HOLIDAY EVER IN THE WORLD!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Rachel O
Reviews.Content: the best western hotel is a good hotel cause when i was away me and my family were just a couple of minutes from a good place for macys parade. the hotel is good the staff are nice and the staff at reception are very helpful and it would be good if they had a food bit were u got food. the room i was in u could see a little of time square and u dont get a good sleep but apart from that thats it. AND A BIG THANKS TO THE BAG PERSON HE WAS SO HELPFUL TO LOAD OF PEOPLE THANKS YOUR THE BEST...

Reviews.Title: “First time I walk in to a room and there are no towels”
Reviews.Author: jmfinn
Reviews.Content: I called the front desk and they said they would send some up. Hour later no towels. I had to go the front desk where there is only one person working during the high check in time and there is a line of people waiting to get rooms Oh it gets better. You can't control the heat in the room only the AC. So it is 43 degrees out side and I am sweating with the AC on. Oh when you walk in to the room don't turn around because you can't. The room is to small for a chair or a desk. I can stand in the middle of the room and almost touch both walls.

Reviews.Title: “good location to nyc lovers”
Reviews.Author: Benarb
Reviews.Content: Comfort nice hotel in the heart of nyc. Little beat crowded. Noisy aircondition system.

Reviews.Title: “Really love this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Fanney S
Reviews.Content: We visited NYC from 22nd - 26th of feb. The location of the hotel is perfect. The rooms were really nice, modern and CLEAN. All the bad reviews on Tripadvisor make no sence because the hotel is outstanding and I will for sure stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location....”
Reviews.Author: AsylumGal
Reviews.Content: Great place as home base for midtown exploration! We booked a smoking room only to find they had gone smokeless since we made the reservation, the girl at the desk was very nice and substituted a room with a balcony! SCORE! We could see times square from the balcony. THAT was great! On the minus side, the doorman was extremely snotty, the room was less than well cleaned, not enough hot water for me and low water pressure. Still we had a blast, it's a fun part of town to poke around in.

Reviews.Title: “Great service, early check-in when needed, and wonderful location”
Reviews.Author: TorontoSharon088
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I went to New York for a short vacation. Since I had some business to do in midtown Manhattan, I searched all the hotels close by and Best Western President Hotel popped into my eyes due to the location in Time Square. Before the trip I went to tripadvisor and read some negative reviews and made me very anxious, However the reality is totally out of my expectation. We arrived early Sunday morning, got early check-in around noon, and even got upgraded! The room is clean and servicable, the restaurant Saigon48 we tried has homey noodle soup. Only the water temperature in the washroom and the room temperature need to be more stable and not so hot. I'll definitely recommend stay there. Love the location in the center of Time Square, Broadway, Rochfeller center and St. Patrick Cathedral closeby plus many good bagel restaurants and Roxy bakery with walking distance... ,

Reviews.Title: “best hotel in NYC”
Reviews.Author: Nolan m
Reviews.Content: From the minute you walk in to the minute you live you feel at home and there is nothing more you can ask for out of a hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Nice Hotel Staff”
Reviews.Author: sunburywolfe
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel like we have done many times before. The room was small but when I'm in New york City, I don't plan on spending too much time in the hotel room. Nothing to complain about as others did, the hotel staff were very nice to us.

Reviews.Title: “Not my 1st choice again”
Reviews.Author: FloW1983
Reviews.Content: First of all hotel is in a great location in regards to Time Square. WIFI is not great, is so slow it's ridiculous. The best thing about this hotel was the bar and the staff who work it Great service and really friendly & will cater to what you want in a drink & also brilliant on thier recommendations for something different to try other. Room size was adaquate. The street the hotel is on is quite noisy but then what do you expect so near to Time Square.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Convenient, and Great Value”
Reviews.Author: Ken R
Reviews.Content: This hotel is immaculate! Right in "Times Square", and a better value than I was expecting! I could see the M&M building and electronic billboard from my room, I could walk everywhere. The hotel was a better value than I expected, and yes, I shopped around before i booked. Every member of the staff was available, and willing to help us find our way around the city, and respond to our requests. The room itself was more than adaquate, and I'll go back to this hotel on my next stay. Thanks BW Ken R

Reviews.Title: “Good location, but not the cleanest”
Reviews.Author: Harmony_F_12
Reviews.Content: Great location, but if you plan on spending any time in your room (even if it's just in the evening before bed) I would not recommend staying at this hotel. The wifi was horrible. Checking email or researching local attractions was next to impossible. Several of our bathroom towels were stained. The bed did not have fitted sheets, leaving us exposed to the mattress. Also, the sheets and blanket had a rubbery quality to them. The bathtub has jets, but unfortunately they didn't work. The television did not have any movie channels or the option for Pay-Per-View. The front desk staff was snotty, as well as the breakfast staff. And the vending machine closest to our floor was broken. The maintenance man who fixed our television was nice though and the room was quiet.

Reviews.Title: “only for one night”
Reviews.Author: pearlan
Reviews.Content: I stayed there for one night only.I booked a single room.The hotel is in a great location but there are many problems to be fixed.The price was very good, I have to admit but the room was tiny the bed was queen but I doubt it.The heat was not working and I spend the night trying to warm up somehow.Some of the furniture were destroyed and the bathroom was really small as well.If you want to spend 5-6 nights try a different hotel.If you want to stay for 1 it's ok because its cheap and in a good location.

Reviews.Title: “NEW YORK VISIT”
Reviews.Author: doc038
Reviews.Content: My room was fine. The President's location is great and the staff as alwayscouldn't be nicer

Reviews.Title: “Total lack of customer service”
Reviews.Author: Honest O
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in December 2011 and wrote the following complaint letter... Dear Sirs My partner and I stayed in the Best Western President Hotel, Times Square, New York under the above reservation number on 5th December 2011. I don’t know where to start… from start to finish the whole stay was just a disaster. For a hotel trading under the Best Western name I would never have imagined to have the problems we experienced. We booked a King Deluxe room and upon checking into our room I noticed that the room was poorly cleaned. As my partner and I began to unpack our belongings I noticed the bed did not appear to have been cleaned properly, upon pulling back the covers it appeared they had not been cleaned at all and had several stains on. Not the best start to our stay!! I called down to the receptionist and advised her of this, to which she offered me an additional room, the only other room available which was not a King Deluxe room or if it was as the receptionist had instructed it had half of the amenities missing! Upon viewing this room it also seemed unclean and terribly small. We opted to stay in our first room, room 918 and asked that someone come up to our room and replace the bed sheets while we were out. When we returned to the room the sheets had indeed been cleaned however in the meantime the bottom of the air conditioning vent had fell down, exposing all of the wiring and being as it was so dusty and decrepit had deposited a lot of dust onto the floor. Not only is this very hazardous and totally unacceptable it was very unsightly. Had we had our children with us this could have jeopardised their safety. All in all it was an awful stay. The room considering it was advertised as a King Deluxe room in a newly refurbished hotel was not what we received. The room itself was run down with marks all over the wall and unsightly stains on the skirting boards. Upon check out it was the same lady who check us in, who I had spoken to about the bed linen being unclean, who had offered us the alternative bedroom, I also informed her of the air conditioning unit to which she just thanked me for letting her know and she made a note of it. We were not even asked if everything was ok with our stay which is I believe a Best Western standard policy. I have stayed in many Best Western hotels all around the world and am actually booked to stay in one in Paris in January although I have to admit I am now very apprehensive about this booking after staying in the Best Western President Hotel! Look forward to hearing from you. The hotel manager contacted myself and my partner to offer us an upgrade... when we would never wish to stay inn that hotel again. I advised him that we lived in the UK and would not be likely to returning to NYC, my last two emails have been ignored... Do not stay here unless you want filthy, broken facilities and a total lack of customer care!!!

Reviews.Title: “The hotel stinks…..of bad management.”
Reviews.Author: KGee82
Reviews.Content: We stayed here with a group of friends whilst in NYC. We were all allocated rooms that varied in size and faulty and equipment! Having stayed in NY before in different hotels I completely expected the rooms to be small and this wouldn't have been a problem had the rooms been clean, the staff friendly/professional and everything in working order. There was also no where to store our suitcases once we'd unpacked as the room was so small so they were out which made the room even smaller (which I didn't think was possible!) The hotel decor is really funky but totally let down by the standard of cleanliness not only in the rooms but in the communal areas. I feel no matter how much you pay or the star rating of the hotel it should, at the very least, be clean. Everyone in our party seemed to have issues with the temp in the rooms - they were so hot!! The heating/cooling system is so old and in most cases didn't work so we left our window open the whole time. The staff on reception seem to only want to provide the bare minimum of customer service, don't expect any empathy when approaching them with an issue - it's frustrating to say the least. I think with better management this hotel could be transformed into a little gem as the location is amazing and yes it's a bit noisy week mornings but its New York, you'd expect noise like that in any big city and its hardly unbearable.

Reviews.Title: “Good value with a clean offering”
Reviews.Author: Satya_V
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for two nights in January 2012 in room 215. The room was small but very clean and had great interior decoration. I have stayed in New York in other hotels and I was very pleased with this. I made the booking through travelocity and got a good deal on this place. There are great restaurants and guests get 10% discount on both the restaurants in the hotel premises. The property is well located with Times Square just around the corner.

Reviews.Title: “very dirty and noisy !!!!!”
Reviews.Author: anna_maraki
Reviews.Content: First night was TERRIBLE ! Tiny room, NO space for a crib and really really noisy . The worst however IS THAT IT IS SO DIRTY !!!! Changed to a room on the 11th floor to an even smaller room just because they said it would be quieter . Well, this room is so small there is no space for our 3 pieces of luggage , the baby crib cannot fit so baby has to sleep in bed wi th us , the noise is exactly the same and there seems to be something wrong with the heat. It is 2 degrees outside but i have the windows open to even he temperature. They said they did not know but when we got in thare already was a fan from the previous guests ... So.... Of course the knew there was a problem . WHAT A WASTE OF MONEY....

Reviews.Title: “Good value and cute, but read on”
Reviews.Author: mitchd123
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for two nights in Jan 2012 Pros: 1) The location is perfect for tourists. 2) This is a boutique hotel. It's very artsy and well decorated, and somewhat gaudy. When I first walked in, I thought I had inadvertently entered a trendy restaurant because of the decor. I was turning to leave and a doorman approached me to ask if I was looking for the BW. I expected he would send me somewhere else, but to my surprise he told me I was in the right place. There's a beautiful fish tank behind the check-in desk. Staff were all very polite, but reserved. 3) The value was good, but please read the cons as well. Through my company, the hotel was half the price of others in the area. The room was nicely decorated and clean. 4) Internet speed was good, 10M down 4M up during the afternoon. Cons: 1) The biggest problem was the heat. It was HOT in the middle of January. I can't imagine this place in the summer. I walked in and one window was slightly opened, and the room was 85F. I turned the AC on high and set the temperature to 40F. The room would not go below 78 with the windows closed and the air on. The entire floor was warm, not just my room. The room did have a portable fan. Before going to dinner, I opened all three windows, and put the fan in one. I hoped a pigeon didn't fly in because there are no screens. Returning I was pleased to find the room temp had dropped to 63. I dropped the AC from high to low, and closed the windows to try to sleep. Around 2am I woke up sweating because it was back up to 80F again. I opened the windows to breath, but even on the 14th floor, that lets all the noise of NY city in. There must be a boiler room below on the 13 floor, because even when I turned on the cold water, it came out hot. After running for a few minutes it will get cold...but it comes out hot, not warm. 2) The building itself is very old. There are 2 very old and narrow elevators, and 1 updated elevator. If there were ever a fire, I would not expect to get out alive with small elevators and staircase. On several trips in and out there were bags of rubbish in the hall, and several paint cans on a cart. I wouldn't call it unsafe, because it's probably "grandfathered" up to code, but it's not nearly as safe as a new hotel in my opinion. 3) The room keys are sensitive and stop working. During my two days there, my key stopped working, and I saw several other guests having the same problem. 4) There were no face cloths or hand towels in the room. I left a note for the cleaning staff, and returned to find the note was gone, but no face cloths or hand towels. I then asked at the front desk, and some were quickly sent up. 5) The room was tiny. Similar to staying on a boat. You have to plan ahead to move around. You won't fit in the room with two large suitcases. Summary: Overall good value for the price and great location. Probably the perfect place to stay after the ball drop on New Years eve, and I promise you'll warm up quickly. I would never consider staying here in the summer. The location and decor were great, but when I travel on business, I don't want to even think about the room, or temperature, or keys, etc. There are so many places to stay in the city.

Reviews.Title: “Bad attitude service, bad maintence”
Reviews.Author: veronica d
Reviews.Content: For this price in manhattan, don't expect it to be anything good. The hotel looks nice from outside, the lobby, and the interior. A closer look shows everything cheap. We stayed in the suite, and our heater doesn't work, in freaking freezing cold new york winter. We called the front desk around 9pm, and was told will send someone up. 15 minutes passed after 2 more calls, finally he said the "someone" is having lunch!? and will be up in 15 more minutes. We have jetlag and need to sleep, so asked him to bring up some blankets. The next day, we asked the front desk, and she said will ask someone to take a look, when we got back, still not working, and room is cold in freaking ny winter. Also, the sheet and blankets are dirty as someone stepped on it and never got washed in years. Not recommend to stay here unless you're on a shoe string.

Reviews.Title: “A great stay”
Reviews.Author: brian k
Reviews.Content: I'll keep this short and sweet. I rented this place for pretty cheap and the staff were really nice. They even upgraded me from the smallest room to a King deluxe because the room was vacant. The room was really nice and I would definately stay here if you want a location near Time Sq

Reviews.Title: “A great time in New York”
Reviews.Author: NickIbizaHire
Reviews.Content: We had a great time in New York and this was partly down to the hotel. From the moment we arrived we were impressed with hotel, the staff were always friendly and any question we had the reception staff were more than happy to assist. The decor was great, the bed was one of the best ive ever slept in.Ok the room size is not massive but hey we were in Times Square! The bathroom was plenty big enough for a 5 night stay and what impressed us the most was we even had a balcony. Would highly recommend and definitely go back next time we are in New York

Reviews.Title: “Not your average Best Western”
Reviews.Author: AmityL
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for work and because I had a friend visiting NYC. The lobby is along the lines of the Mondrian and Delano in Miami! The rooms are tiny (size or rooms at the Hudson for example) - barely any space to walk around the bed, but they are decorated funky. They have character. Wall paper on the ceiling for example. Not a King bed though. Hotel seems like maybe it was recently renovated? The lobby had a lot of tables and good space for business meetings. I thought it was a cool little hotel and was pleasantly surprised because the fact that it was a Best Western scared me a little beforehand. But I guess the Best Western PLUS level of hotels are different! I'd recommend it. It's right off of Times Square, but the street it was on was quiet and there are a few cute restaurants on the block like Pigalle and an Irish pub/saloon.

Reviews.Title: “Just avoid that heater noise”
Reviews.Author: mctheworldcitizen
Reviews.Content: Be careful with booking via booking.com. They are giving the small rooms which have window to a little hole full with all of the heaters. That sound is incredibly terrible. I had a long journey from Honduras to NY but couldn't find a luxury to sleep. My solution was listening high volume music. Room was clean, small but efficient. i stayed alone and its quite enough. If you select your room away from that heater yard, hotels location is perfect! Also the bar in the entrance was cool. You are just a minutes walk away from everything in NY. (-) noise pollution free wifi is not working regularly small rooms (+) location bar ipad docks in the rooms price per location

Reviews.Title: “Frustrating experience”
Reviews.Author: epercy
Reviews.Content: I really wanted to like this place. The plus is that the room was very clean and comfortable. It was incredibly small, but as it was just me, I didn't care. However, there were many minuses. I arrived at the hotel exhausted after traveling for 32 hours with no sleep. I inquired as to whether or not I might be able to check in early as I was so desperate for sleep, and the woman behind the counter was so rude! She simply said "we are booked", without even looking at me. I told her I had a reservation, and she told me I could check back at noon and see if there was a room available. Fair enough. I walked around times square for an hour, and returned around 11, to check. She said I could wait in the lobby and she would come get me when something became available. An hour later, I asked someone else at the front desk if a room was available, and he replied "yes, no problem." The first woman I spoke with wouldn't even make eye contact with me! I understand if a room is not available early, but don't lie to me and tell me you will come tell me when it is, then blow me off! I did not appreciate that one bit. I went in to go to sleep, only to be awoken an hour later by a fire alarm going off! I jumped out of bed, and headed to the stairs, only to hear over the loudspeaker that we shouldn't worry, and that they were just doing a routine check of the elevators. Why would they not warn me of this?!? Why would they not tell their guests not to be concerned when the fire alarm goes off!! I was so exhausted, and that was so inconsiderate. All in the first hour!. I was there for two days, and did not have any other large problems, until the last morning before checking out. I was still in bed, and had the do not disturb sign on my door (I double checked after to be sure), and the housekeeper just walked right in! No knocking, just let herself in, despite the sign on the door! So rude! I clearly had not checked out yet! I was happy with the room, so unhappy with the treatment by the staff.

Reviews.Title: “Poshe, boutique hotel, in a great area!”
Reviews.Author: JessOnTheRoad
Reviews.Content: Not like most Best Westerns, this property has a ton of personality! From the veleur embossed wallpaper in the halls, to illuminated busts in the guest rooms, stepping into this hotel makes you feel far from ordinary. The rooms are small, but most are in the city, and the best are very comfy. Where breakfasts are usually complimentary in other BWs, this one offers it at an additional charge, but if you want something quick, there are a few places around the corner that are more reasonable priced. Here, you are steps away from Times Sq, Hell's Kitchen, and Central Park. You do have to get through the hustle-bustle of Times Sq. to get to the 42nd street station, but the convenience is worth it. Also, try the sushi restaurant next door for very reasonably priced lunch specials.

Reviews.Title: “Not so "Best Western*”
Reviews.Author: selwood2005
Reviews.Content: We booked a Delux Queen Room from 30th Dec 2011 to 5th Jan 2012, The hotel was in a very good area and the staff were very helpful but the room was a bit on the small side to say the least. It was minus 11 deg on our last 2 nights there and our heating wasn't working. A maintenance man came to fix it, but we only had heat for 5 mins. so we called them again, no one came and as it was 11 pm we went to bed, having had to sleep in thermals. The next day we spoke to reception and they changed and upgraded our room, which was very nice. One thing I will say is that if you are lucky enouigh to have a jacuzzi in your room....check it out BEFORE getting in it as unlike my husband he didn't. The whole thing filled with BROWN sludge and gunk and bits of hair. The receptionist was " Very Sorry" but did not offer to reduce our bill by even a small amount...That would have been a Nice Gesture...don't you think ?

Reviews.Title: “Pictures are misleading!”
Reviews.Author: Tom R
Reviews.Content: the rooms where very small, the lighting was bad, the rooms were very noisy and the internet was beyong slow. the rooms were clean and bed linen was changed every other day. location was good for times square but you do get the noise throughout the night. the staff were unfriendly and not very helpful and placed myself and my sister in a double bed and refused to help us change this. not very happy with the service but the hotel was okay but not worth the money,

Reviews.Title: “Stay of Best Western plus Presidential in Manhattan”
Reviews.Author: JosephAlanL
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed there for 3 nights and were very pleased. The highlight of our hotel experience was the service provided by front desk representative Suni. She greeted us with a smile upon arrival and did not delay in providing us information concerning our room being ready. Suni greeted us upon our arrivals and departures but she got to know our names which made the experience more personal and warm. We will definitely visit the hotel again and hope that Suni is working during our visit. She is truly an asset to the Best Western Hotel chain.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Location”
Reviews.Author: LisaGJB
Reviews.Content: If you have stayed in NYC you know the rooms are small and not much to write home about this is the same a queen bed, small shower and not much wiggle room BUT the location more than makes up for the lack of space.... Within talking distance to Times Square, 5th Ave, Broadway, fabulous restaurants and shopping.... make sure to take your ear plugs it is noisy all night long.... Staff was friendly and helpful and there is a great restaurant attached to the hotel as well as a fabulous Italian restaurant across the street....

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel. Great staff!”
Reviews.Author: crissy_sc0tt
Reviews.Content: my husband and i stayed here for 2 nights on our recent trip to nyc. the location was perfect! the staff was very friendly and helpful! also, it was nice to have a lounge in the lobby in the evenings so we could grab a drink or two while we planned our night. we will definitely return next time we are visiting new york city!

Reviews.Title: “A great place at a great price!”
Reviews.Author: Emmanuelitier
Reviews.Content: Super central, super hyped decoration and a great smiling staff makes this hotel one of the best choice to stay in N.Y!

Reviews.Title: “you get what you pay for . . .”
Reviews.Author: suzzy66
Reviews.Content: IF you plan to spend very little time in your room and IF you want to be near the theater district and you want to spend your money on theater tickets, only then is this a marginally acceptable selection. Otherwise, room is very small, superficial cleanliness at best, heating and cooling made so much noise that we couldn't sleep, bags of laundry in the hall all the time, lobby is neither relaxing nor interesting people-watching. But we didn't see any bugs in our room, the staff was helpful in flagging down cabs, willing to secure our luggage until our early evening flight, and for NYC, you could pay a lot more and get the same thing.

Reviews.Title: “Who put the best in Best Western?”
Reviews.Author: David B
Reviews.Content: This hotel should really be closed as it is a serious fire hazard. I should have realised something was wrong when I was checking in. There was another line of people all complaining. I had booked a double room when I booked into and paid for this hotel 4 months before my visit. The room we were given was so small I realised something was wrong as there was only a bedside table and bedside light on one side, but having crossed the Atlantic I was exhausted. This was a single room and the bed was quite narrow. The receptionist rudely said it was considered a double bed. But it was definitely a single room. My broom cupboard is bigger. They offered me another room provided I repacked my luggage. The next room was not much bigger but it did have bedside tables on both sides of the bed. However the temterature in the room was like a sauna and we could not switch off the heat. I demanded to speak to the manager but he refused to meet me but they did provide a better room. with a double bed. One drawback there was only a single bedsheet to cover us. I asked to be moved to another Best Western Hotel and was told that they were a privately owned hotel and had only some sort of association with the Best Western Chain. The corridors of this dump of a hotel are extremely narrow yet they are permanently crowded with laundry carts and huge waste collection bins on wheels. If there was ever a fire in this hotel there would be a serious risk to life in a smoke filled space. The corridors are also extremely dirty and never seem to be cleaned or vacuumed. It is obvious that there is no proper management in this hotel. Although it enjoys an ideal location the fact that I joined several disappointed guests trying to get what they had been promised in the promotion of this 'hotel' definately took the shine off the stay. Let me offer advice to the owners. 1 Fire the manager. 2 Dedicate one room per floor for laundry carts and dustbins. Train reception staff on how to deal with genuine complaints. Give the heating a full service and make sure both the rooms and public spaces are properly cleaned everyday/

Reviews.Title: “Balcony overlooking Times Square”
Reviews.Author: Danielle L
Reviews.Content: We stayed for the week before christmas and had a Queen room at the front with a balcony overlooking Times Square. The hotel was clean, contempary and there were always staff on hand to help. The room was clean, spacious, modern - very comfy bed, and had a large balcony with furniture over looking the M and M's sign. Amazing! The location is perfect and although you could hear some street noise - I don't see how you could expect anything else in a Times Square location - if you have 'done New York' you will be too tired to let it keep you awake. I will be recommending this hotel to my friends and would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Very good location and that's all”
Reviews.Author: Aldm
Reviews.Content: To start with positives – staying on 14th floor we didn't have problems with noise. Location is just great. If you have little time, I would recommend this hotel. Wifi worked perfectly. Now... rooms are indeed very small and hot. King sized bed was very narrow. Finding the hotel on the street is quite easy - just look for the only dark spot :). Male concierge was no help at all. On our first evening we went to him to ask what we can do at that time, hoping he could recommend a restaurant or something like that. He said: you're in the centre of New York, you can do anything... On one hand he was probably right, on the other - not the answer I would expect in a four star hotel. We also had a problem with the airport shuttle we had booked in a hotel. Concierge (female one) advised us to take a shuttle that leaves 3,5 hour prior to our flight (from JFK). If went straight to the airport, that might have been OK, but we had to pick up people from other hotels (and they were late), so we ended up driving through our street 50 minutes after we left it. Traffic is obviously not a driver's fault, but when we got to the airport he started to drop off people from the last terminal (our's was first), which costed us another 10 minutes. After all we got to the terminal 1 hour 30 minutes before departure (to Europe) and almost missed our flight. The driver claimed that concierge advised us wrong, that we left too late because this trip could also take 3 hours.

Reviews.Title: “Location makes this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jkwv83
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here a few days before Christmas for four nights. We are in our late 20's and this was just enough for us. We have stayed in four-five star hotels before and I would say this hotel rates about a 3. We had a couple minor issues that we more or less bit the bullett on and just went with it due to the fact it's NYC and we got a great deal. Going into our trip I had read some horror stories and been a little nervous before getting there but was relieved when we saw the room. The location could not have been any better. Literally 2min walking to the heart of times square and subway stops within a couple blocks to anywhere. It was 15 degrees with the windchill and we were happy the entire time. The lobby staff were receptive to our needs as best they could and were very friendly most of the time. The only issues we had were #1 the thermostat in the room seemed to blow hot air constantly....I quickly figured out setting the thermostat to ON and turning it on 70 would keep the room a little cool at night but the auto function was wayyyyyyyy worse....set it to on and 70. #2 we ended up being on the second floor and I read about the noise close to street level so we downloaded white noise apps on our phones and ran one through the iPhone docking station(turn it on airplane mode or it'll pop off and on) and sat the other on the other side of the bed and used earplugs at night. In four nights we never we're woken up by a car horn or sirens. #3 if your going for the free wi-fi....go elsewhere or live in the lobby. Our room on the second floor managed 1-2 bars intermittently, if any at all, but towards the center of the building and the lobby we had full service. But you're here to take in NYC; not look at Facebook and keep up with the world right?lol. #4 our shower curtain in our stand up shower was too short by about half an inch so when we showered the tiny bathroom flooded due to the curtain passing over the ledge and water running off. I made a complaint and asked for a longer curtain and immediately the front desk staff notified housekeeping to come down via walkie talkie. When we came back I could tell they switched the curtain but it was the same as before. So we took the metal basket in the bathroom and sat it on the ledge at the back of shower for the magnet in the curtain to stick to....rolled a towel up and sat it on the middle of the ledge and that kept the curtain from passing over the ledge. Honestly these were very minor problems that were manageable like i said. If you expect a 4-5 star at the price you're paying.....wake up Alice. If you're wanting to stay some where at a price that real people can afford with just enough ammenities... then stay here and experience NYC. I was was very happy with our stay. If this were any other city I would have been slightly aggrevated with our problems but this is NYC, look at the prices of the hotels surrounding this and realize you can sacrifice a little and gain a lot. Location was excellent, people friendly, and a great price. My wife and I would def stay here again. Had an amazing trip and a good stay. Thank you best western.

Reviews.Title: “Small hot rooms”
Reviews.Author: BML186470
Reviews.Content: Location is great and staff are helpful but some rooms are uncomfortably small. Be careful about booking and check that room is not described as standard. Bigger and cheaper rooms are available within 2 blocks. 6-11th December 2011

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the money AT ALL”
Reviews.Author: Judith C
Reviews.Content: I stay at a lot of Best Westerns and generally they are good bang for your buck, but they dropped the ball on this place big time. I selected this hotel because of the Best Western name. They even call it a Best Western Plus, wake up Best Western. I have stayed in Hostels better than this place. The positives is the room was a good size and it was just around the corner from Times Square. Thats it for positives. The bathroon was so small you could barely turn around in it. It was also so run down the bath tub looked like it had never been changed since the building was built, cigarette burns, mold, cracked. The door had such a gap in it when it was closed that someone could easily break into your room. The bed was uncomfortable, decor old and dated. I wish I had taken pictures. I was even concerned about bed bugs, thankfully there were NO bed bugs. Most of the staff was friendly however not very knowledgable and one female that worked at the desk was rude she seemed to be annoyed I was even there. I paid alot of money but thankfully I only stayed one night.

Reviews.Title: “Fun place in Mid-town”
Reviews.Author: Jpepper11
Reviews.Content: We had a great time at the president hotel. The rooms are clean and the staff are very friendly. We'll be back in March !!

Reviews.Title: “I never believe bad reviews but I wished I had listened to them!”
Reviews.Author: Sariefairie
Reviews.Content: There is a huge building site at the back of the hotel. Very noisy from 6 am on. My back is very sore from tiny uncomfortable bed. My boyfriend barely fits in the bed, he is 6 ft 3. There are cockroaches and bugs in the drawer so I had to keep my stuff in suitcases. The elevators are very very slow. Cleanliness is sub standard. Location is the only thing this hotel has got going for it

Reviews.Title: “Pay a little extra to have a nicer stay somewhere else.”
Reviews.Author: Travel_Critic417
Reviews.Content: The hotel has an amazing location, which is great if you are traveling to New York City for the first time and not really sure how to get around. Also, be careful, because a lot of the rooms are facing an ally way and have no view at all and can be incredibly small and dark. One of the best things about coming to New York is having a room facing the street. There is something therapeutic about laying in bed at night and having city street noise. This is, in fact, the city that never sleeps! The front desk is extremely friendly with the exception of a few bad eggs. One in particular went above and beyond the call of duty to make sure everything was to our satisfaction. I don't want to mention any names, but I can say that it sure made our trip "Sunny!". If you have any issues, don't bother calling down and speaking with the operators. They seem like they are burdened by the phone calls and really don't give you a chance to speak. What ever happened to customer service? If I were the front office manager (which I have been at a different hotel chain) I would find nice people to answer the phones, and that actually want to work. (There are plenty of people out there that need a job!) On to the guest rooms. Very Very Very Hot! Even though it was 28 degrees outside during the night, the window had to be open a good 4 inches to regulate the room temperature. This however, is very unsafe if traveling with children, because the windows do not have screens. The rooms can be small, but it is a city hotel in the middle of Times Square, so that is not a big issue. The rooms are also well decorated with nice figures, presidential art, and gnarly headboards. (Thats right, I said gnarly) The television is a joke. There are only a few channels, even though they offer over 100 in the guest room book, and the (flat screen television) is an ancient model with terrible sound and no HD hook up. There is nothing special about it. You can't look at your bill, or watch a movie with the family. Two departments that need acknowledgement is the Maintenance department, and the Housekeeping department. They answer to calls quickly and are probably the friendliest in the industry. Hats off to all of you hard workers! However, the room attendants need to learn that fitted sheets go on first. They forgot a fitted sheet on the bed! There are two adjacent restaurants to the hotel in which you get a discount, however, they don't offer room service. One is a Vietnamese restaurant, and the other is Japanese. That could make the dining a little difficult if you are not into asian cuisine. The website also states that there is a bar. The bar is only open for a few hours at night and the bartender just sits on a chair texting on her cell phone, and is burdened by having to get up to make a drink. It also only stays open until 11:00PM. If you are looking to stay a few days in the middle of busy Times Square, and don't want to pay 300.00+ a night for a room, I would recommend staying here. Just remember, you get what you pay for! For such a small hotel, it is rather busy, so if you have questions about the area, the front desk may not be there to answer them, because they are busy checking people into the hotel. If I were the hotel manager, I would go around to all the guest rooms and make sure that everything is in working order, because there were a lot of stuff broken in our room. (dresser, toilet paper holder, shower head, blow dryer, and ironing board to name a few). Also, If I were the manager, I would go around to the Front Office Manager, and insure that they had friendly staff that were answering phones in the back, because they are the first person people talk to when calling the hotel for the first time, and people can tell when someone isn't smiling over the phone and hates there job. It makes booking the hotel a little harder knowing that there is staff like that.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location”
Reviews.Author: pinkluvinbiatch
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 4 nights in room 222 in this hotel. The location is perfect, literally a stones throw away from Times Square. At the end of the road is the big 'Hersheys' chocolate shop which is definitely worth a visit! Check in was easy and quick and we were given wifi access straight away which was great. The room was small but perfectly adequate. The room was decorated quite plush but had quite a few scuffs and scrapes, however this wasnt a problem as we were only using the room as a base. The bathroom was again quite small but clean apart from the shower head that didnt look like it has been cleaned for years, it was black :-S. Definitely take your ear plugs if you arent used to a noisy nights sleep. We were shattered after long days in New York and so slept well but we both took our ear plugs as it is still very noisy. We didnt eat at the hotel as there are so many places to eat out - a favourite of ours was 'Juniors' and 'Roxy's' for breakfast - huge portions! Great holiday and would probably stay here again due to the location.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for in NYC!!”
Reviews.Author: sarahjbh
Reviews.Content: The hotel has an excellent location and is priced reasonably also. We were a group of 8 people so we needed something not too expensive. That being said our expectations were slightly higher. Our suite was described as delux... I would drop the delux. The heating was not controllable and it was really hot. No double glazing so lots of noise. (although we were expecting noise given the location!). As the building is quite old don´t be too surprised when you switch on the shower that the pipes bang and make so much noise it sounds like the wall is coming down!!! We had 3 rooms between us and they were all the same. Breakfast was good and good value. Staff were OK but none were particularly friendly. It is a busy hotel so they do have their hands full. No chance of getting a coffee or tea in the afternoon. No room service offered by hotel although you can get delivery and there are internet delivery services available also. Tried asking for a couple of recommendations for restaurants etc with no joy. We travelled with 3 children aged 9&10 and this hotel is not a hotel for children..... but it wasn´t really a problem given their age. The hotel renovation is decorative only....

Reviews.Title: “Nothing to rave about”
Reviews.Author: HillTraveller
Reviews.Content: The location is great, hence the cost The rest of it is barely average Two good restaurants attached and a nice lobby bar

Reviews.Title: “It's OK to stay for a few days”
Reviews.Author: ArnauGirona
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in this hotel for two times (2010 and 2011). It's located in a good spot, really close to Times Sq, which means there is noise early in the morning, but we were okay with that. The price was really affordable, keeping in mind it was New York City. Staff in the front desk was helpful and attentive. The views from the windon were'nt that good, but who cares?? Just walk around, the room is just to rest and sleep. The WC was clean and the bed was really big. WiFi didn't arrive well to our room, we had to go to the lobby in order to use our computers, but there are good chairs and armchairs so it wasn't much trouble either. It's not the best hotel in the world but to spend a few days in the center of New York I would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Staff & Location!!!”
Reviews.Author: j P
Reviews.Content: We had a great experience at the Best Western President Hotel with our family. Rooms were spacious and beautiful, staff was excellent and very informative on area sightseeing and attractions. Hotel was in an excellent location to Times Square and Rockefeller Center.

Reviews.Title: “DON'T BE FOOLED! DO NOT STAY AT THIS RAT HOLE HOTEL!”
Reviews.Author: CamiMasdeu
Reviews.Content: My recommendation to everyone considering this hotel is DO NOT STAY AT THIS HOTEL by any means! I've been in the hospitality industry myself for 15 years, I travel a lot and have seen and been to many hotels of all levels and I've never experience nothing like this before in terms of what happened and the treatment received from the front desk agent! There are lots of other hotels within the same location, at a better price and have great service and accommodations. This hotel is a rat hole. Although the hotel's decor is funky, the pictures are deceiving and the hotel actually doesn't look as polish. But that is not the worst thing... the rooms are tiny. My room had a double bed- not a queen, not a king - and I barely had speace, in addition, the walls were scratched and did not look as clean. As soon as we checked in and entered the elevator to go to the room, there was a funny smell a mix of beer and weed. When we got on the hallway the smell of weed was incredibly strong and it was the same even inside our room. We told the front desk agent about it and asked if he could send security to check the rooms and he said there was not security. We asked for a manager on duty and there was none so we decided to check out and even explaining the situation the agent told us we were going to be charged the whole stay because we were within the cancellation policy and we actually did. Now we are hoping we can get to speak to a manager and get our money back. We ended up checking out and going to the Element by Westin hotel just a couple of blocks away at a lower rate, almost $40 less per night with breakfast included and it was another world. The hotel is beautiful, clean, the staff is professional and the rooms are super clean, very new and even have a kitchen!

Reviews.Title: “Worst Customer Service Ever”
Reviews.Author: concernedconsumeryep
Reviews.Content: Worst Costumer Service Ever. Period. The customer service representative I was transferred to not only did not answer the phone with his name, refused to address my concerns, or transfer me to a national representative, but also, in response to my informing him that I had been having terrible customer service in all my transactions with the hotel, said: "Screw you man" and hung-up on me. I still pretty much in shock.

Reviews.Title: “small rooms”
Reviews.Author: elin h
Reviews.Content: nice hotel but small rooms. we changed to a bigger room after geting a room on the 2nd floor with a "view" in to the next building 3 yards away. Got a little bigger room with view out the street. although, much better then the first. Great service at the frontdesk. helpful and nice! Good for someone traveling on their own and that don't have anything against little space!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for girly trip to NYC”
Reviews.Author: Alice F
Reviews.Content: After reading some of the reviews on here I was a little nervous about my stay however when we arrived we were so thrilled and trust me I have travelled the world and I am very very picky!!!! I really don't know what people are complaining about! The hotel is located directly off times square (you can get to times square in literally a 2 second walk!). It is uber modern and looks gorgeous from both the inside and out. Myself and my friend came to NYC for a 5 night stay, we are both 22 and wanted lots of partying and shopping. We found the location to be perfect as there is a subway station just a 5 minute walk away which is the main central subway station to get anywhere in the city. We spent most of our time in the West Village and only took around 5 minutes to get there via subway (Tribeca, Greenwhich, Soho and Meat Packing). However if you wish to get a cab, it can be difficult in this location as it is so busy, i would recommend turning left when you come out the hotel and walk to the next block where it is quieter if you wish to take a cab. The hotel staff were very helpful, and didn't bother us at all, we frequently came in at 5 in the morning and they were just as happy to see us as when we were off out in the day. The room was small but so are most rooms in NYC, we had lots of luggage and we are both very messy but it was not too small for us. We asked for a room with a good view and were given a 10th floor room with a balcony over looking Times Square. The room had a very good sized bathroom with a bath and shower, a double bed, safe and wardrobe. The bed was incredably comfortable and the room was very warm, but with air con available if you wanted it. I can see in some reviews people complained about the wifi, but it was free and worked fine for us up on the 10th floor! Oh also the room is cleaned everyday with fresh towels, wish is a bonus compared to some places! I would deffinitely recommend this hotel if you want something central, however if your on business or a romantic trip the location may be a bit noisy for you, as times square never sleeps, but for two young girls it was ideal for us. We are looking forward to staying here again in June!

Reviews.Title: “Very sad experience”
Reviews.Author: MissDvo
Reviews.Content: Oh my gosh, I don't even know what to focus on because there were so many negative things about this hotel. We stayed at a B&B on the Upper West side for 4 days and at this hotel for the second half of our trip. The sign for the hotel was hard to see, lobby looked like a wannabe dance club, our first room was disgusting, gross, and dirty with a TV that didn't work and needed to be "reset." I was seriously so very sad when I checked in to the 13th floor. I was afraid to take my shoes off for fear that I would get some disease from the carpet. We got the room for $166/nt through Priceline which, to me, was pretty high for such a scarily disgusting room. The accent pillow in the middle of the bed had some burgundy stain on it and there were dust/dirt/marks all over the walls, tiles, bathroom sink. We requested to move to another room due to the bed size. The front desk person told us she would upgrade us to a "premium" room which turned out to be a slightly cleaner room with A/C that was loud and did not seem to work. The second day in our "premium" room on the 10th floor, we were locked out and front desk gave some lame excuse about not having our cell phone numbers on file. There was a bit of noise from outside just because of the tourist location. Thank goodness it was our first time in New York so we were always out and about, but seriously, I was amazed at the poor condition of our first room. My fiance thought that any hotel room under $200 in New York was probably in similar conditions. I hope he's wrong. Positive was the location, between Times Square and Hell's Kitchen with easy access to subways, restaurants, shopping, Dave Letterman show theater, Broadway shows, and numerous other attractions. Overall, I tried not to focus on the hotel because New York has so much to offer that I did not want the hotel to ruin my visit.

Reviews.Title: “Return Visit”
Reviews.Author: awaywego129
Reviews.Content: I stayed here 5 days last year and two days this trip and both times I felt at home. If comfort is what you want then comfort is what you get. The beds THE BEDS-- Oh so cozy! (If anyone from the hotel's reading this, what type of mattress and bedding do you use, 'cause DAMN I had a good night's sleep!) This trip I was on the 2nd floor in a "compact" *re: small* room overlooking a side brickwall and an air vent. Last time, I was in a more spacious room I think either on the 7th or 15th floor, overlooking 48th street. (I'm not complaining as both rooms provided enough space to breath. And in both cases, noise was a non existent issue.) A couple of minor grievances, though: --The remote for the tv wasn't working properly. (I suspect this was a replacement remote, and not the original.-- --The air conditioner could be adjusted as to not always be blowing cold air.-- Small things. Overall I had a rather pleasant return visit and I'll definently be coming back.

Reviews.Title: “Gross Hotel - Good Location”
Reviews.Author: jazappi
Reviews.Content: Hotel is not a 3 star as claimed on some booking sites. My first room had stains on the wall, broken furniture, rusty bathtub, a broken down bed and the management was rude. Although they did move my room to one that only had rust in the bathtub it wasn't enough. The cheesy decor that attempts to be "boutique" is simply tacky. They should have saved money on purchasing glowing heads of George Washington for the rooms and and put it towards renovations. Lose the wall paper on the ceilings which I can only guess are hiding water stains. Each time I passed through the lobby I heard someone complaining at the front desk so the bad experience wasn't limited to me. If you have a chance to stay here. Don't!

Reviews.Title: “Great location and nice staff...”
Reviews.Author: TroupTravels
Reviews.Content: We arrived here via Priceline for the Veteran's Day weekend. We asked for an upgrade and rec'd one, but not complimentary as noted by the other review. The upgraded room was okay. King bed, pull out couch, jacuzzi tub...Our friends had another room and it was small, but we are quite used to that in NYC. After all, you aren't there to sit in your rooms, you are there to sleep (very little) and shower. This hotel is a great location to Time Square/Broadway. My only real complaint is the cleanliness of the room. It needed a good scrub down and dusting. The shower needed some clorox clean up and the room needed some murphy's oil soap! Not dirty, per say, you could just tell it needed a good scrub down. On the plus side, the bed and pull out couch were comfortable. Another plus, most of the staff were very nice. I would stay here again. However, it won't be my first choice. I won't use Priceline again for NYC. The last time we did, we got the Millinneum Hotel/Broadway and it was very nice. I just don't like taking chances. I really like the Comfort Inn Theatre District - 44th street.

Reviews.Title: “Pictures are decieving”
Reviews.Author: Charles Z
Reviews.Content: One good thing.....it was clean. Otherwise the online pictures of the hotel made the room look much bigger than it actually was. The room was so small my wife and I were having to get out of each others way just to get dressed. There was no place to store your luggage out of the way. The closet was an embarrassment. You couldn't even get into it without moving the side dresser. The hotel "lounge" (if you really wan to call it that) was limited in product, only took cash and the staff were terrible. The online description and pictures made it look like something completely different. I felt like we were deceived based on the pictures and line descriptions and the product. The Other good thing about my stay was the propensity of the woman who lived across the street to get completely naked and dance in her bedroom. However, even that didn't make it worth the almost 500 dollars a night I had to pay to stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location with decent room and pleasant staff”
Reviews.Author: Empty-Nesters1956
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the President Hotel over the 2011 NYC Marathon weekend. We were pleasantly surprised with the better-than-average room and "quirky" room decorations: an illuminated bust of George Washington on the desk, pillow covers with a silhouette of Thomas Jefferson and Warhol-like paintings of John & Jackie Kennedy on the wall. (It's the President Hotel. Get it?) The bathroom was nice -- with a double shower & steam bath feature. The location is perfect for Times Square and Theater District activities. This is not a modern, luxury hotel, but we found the staff helpful and the common areas clean and inviting.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, but I expected a lot more..”
Reviews.Author: Carla110490
Reviews.Content: The Best Western was a situated in a perfect location, only footsteps to the main strip of Times Square. The staffs at the hotel were helpful the hotel itself was run quite well. I was rather disappointed though with how run down the hotel actually was compared to the images I had previously viewed online. I know you cannot always go by the photos, but I truly did expect a lot more than what was offered. The room we stayed in was a standard room. The room was small, but not too bad but the bathroom was tiny. We could barely fit in the bathroom and close the door while we were in there. All in all, I would stay here again for a quick stop over before moving to an apartment/more luxurious hotel, but for the price we paid for this hotel I was not satisfied with the quality of our room. The breakfast was good, and the staff were lovely, I think the hotel just needs a bit of a makeover.. or they need to update their photos.

Reviews.Title: “Average Hotel with Above Average pricing”
Reviews.Author: Mark C
Reviews.Content: Not to make the titel of this review sound misleading, but it is what it is. I enjoyed my stay over Verterns Day weekend. When I arrived Thursday night I was assited by the front desk promptly and was told I recieved a complementary upgrade. I would hate to see what teh other room looksed like, but the room I had or course was small, like many NYC hotel rooms, but was functional. TV on the wall, bed desk, small closet space and a decent bathroom. Everything was clean so no complaints there. The room was work but I opened the windows up a bit and it was fine. The noise of the city didn't really bother me. My room was right when you walked of the elevator and there was an elevator shaft next to my room, but it didn't make noise. There was some late night noise on Saturday night when people were coming back late in the night, but other than that no problems. The problem I had was the price, which even at the Priceline bid I placed was still too much for this average hotel. Yes, it's about a 1/2 block from Times Square, but so are a few other hotels I've stayed at and paid less, for more amenities. My stay was OK. It was a place to sleep inbetween your NYC experience. If I find a lower price for this hotel for my next trip I would consider staying again, but at the price I paid, it wasn't worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely location with great amenities”
Reviews.Author: fniklaw
Reviews.Content: This hotel is lovely. The staff and management were great and extremely helpful.
