If you stay here, they have a great bar, attached restaurant and a very nice american breakfast in the lounge area. My room was warm but opening the window helped. I definitely recommend this hotel and exploring the great 9th Avenue restaurants, bars and nightlife (i.e., The Eatery, The Snug and Room Service Thai, Therapy). We had so much fun.

Reviews.Title: “Many faults, location great”
Reviews.Author: a v
Reviews.Content: - Aircon was not working (simultaneously blew hot and cold air) and nobody came to see it despite my message to reception - The whole staff has low motivation which shows in the service - The multimillion refurbishment is a low quality bolted-on rush job - The rooms are slightly tacky. I started by packing away all the knick-knacks into one of cupboards - The gym was missing some dumbbells and the pin to press machine rendering it useless - The hotel's laundry service killed two buttons from my trousers. I left the trousers in the morning to reception for them to sort out the issue. When I got back afternoon, nothing had been done about the issue. The receptionist was unable to get the manager to come to the lobby (offices are in the basement) so I chatted to him over the phone. The manager repeatedly said that it is not their responsibility and by giving my trousers for them to wash I had agreed that something may happen to them (some small print somewhere). He never said he was sorry and I left in a pretty pissed off mood and had to fly 9 hours in narrow cut pants which just aren't suitable for that. - The lobby is beautiful - The laction is excellent - The breakfast is okay

Reviews.Title: “Very poor and unappealing hotel!”
Reviews.Author: scruffybuttons
Reviews.Content: My room at this hotel was exceedingly hot; I had to turn on the air-con each night, as I could not open the window - even though it did open apparently. I tried to call Front Desk from the room telephone, but no-one answered. When I did speak to a staff member, I found them to be very off-hand. Hallway has a very musty smell. I felt the room was not particularly clean, although the bed was very comfortable. Coffee was not replenished on a couple of days - small thing I know, but it just made me feel that I was paying top dollar for poor service. I stayed on the 2nd floor facing the street and found it to be very noisy, especially at 3am when trucks roll-in to collect the rubbish left in the street. Free wireless connection was frustratingly slow in the room. Basically, I would never recommend this hotel. My family stayed nearby at the Hampton Inn on 8th Avenue; their room was much larger, cleaner and service seemed excellent. As well, they had a free breakfast included in the price, which was roughly the same price I paid at this very poor hotel. I think the dim lighting in the foyer serves to disguise this hotel's shortcomings! Only good thing I can say is that it's in an excellent location. Nevertheless, I found New York wonderful and would visit again - just not stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Pricey but excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Slalom2003
Reviews.Content: Location of this hotel can't be beat. It is literally one block off of Times Square, so it is great for tourists and theatregoers alike. Being across the street from an apartment building provides some quiet as well. The central Times Square location provides access to all the major subway lines. Decor of the lobby was nice, and front desk staff was fast and friendly. The cocktail lounge could have had longer hours, though. It was closed by 11:00 on a Friday night! Rooms, while small, were remarkably clean. The ambiant lighting throughout was a nice touch. My wife and I really liked the illuminated nightstands. Our queen sized room also had a safe, iron and ironing board, and an alarm clock with i-Pod dock. The room was a little warm when we checked in, but the window opened which was awesome!!! Hotel will provide validation for $30 parking at a garage two blocks away. There is a parking garage right across the street from the hotel, but it doesn't validate for that one. However, since we only stayed one night, we were able to print a coupon for the Icon parking system garage right across the street for $30/24hrs. Not sure if you could do this for multiple days, though. Although we liked the hotel and location, the price would probably cause us to look harder for a better deal for future visits to NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel ever!”
Reviews.Author: Douglaschen
Reviews.Content: Seriously, what the hell is wrong with this hotel! Totally not value for money. Damn small room, noisy air con, small bed, small and dirty toilet, felt like I was cheated of my money! Location is so-so. I certainly stayed in better ones at the same rate. Try room mate grace instead. Honestly, I felt more like a prisoner rather than a guest. It's that bad. And the worst thing is the housekeeping people leave their working station/trolley just outside the lift lobby of every level. Totally regret to the max!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: Janet H
Reviews.Content: Always loved this hotel, could not believe the beautiful job done on remodeling. Great location, we loved it.

Reviews.Title: “The worst cost/ benefit ever!”
Reviews.Author: rachefilipov
Reviews.Content: Summarizing: it is an expensive hotel with a poor service and facities. The "extra bed" is the most uncomfortable mattress ever and there is no solution. "all rooms have the same one", the staff said. They gave a an extra blanket for protection of the bad mattress... Internet doesn't work in the rooms. Cleaning services just don't organize the extra bed and leave all lights on (why?). Please don't do that with your money, don't go there!

Reviews.Title: “Best location downtown !”
Reviews.Author: Jacques B
Reviews.Content: We stayed for three nights with my family in the penthouse suite on the top of the hotel. From our private terrace we enjoyed a magnificent view on the Hudson River in-between the skyscrapers. Best accommodation, well furnished, no noise during the night and excellent service. There is no better location then this hotel, close to Time Square and walking distance of all the points of interest. Staff was very friendly and the welcome and farewell regards from de GM where very appreciated ! We will return !

Reviews.Title: “good save”
Reviews.Author: janet o
Reviews.Content: we called the hotel in a panic because the other hotel we had booked turned out to be filthy and awful - we were traveling to participate in the 9/11 memorial program at Lincoln Center and I really needed to be able to relax and feel comfortable inbetween long rehearsals and re-charge for the event - Assistant front desk manager Kori Yoran got us in and saved the entire trip - loved the hotel and the service - will DEFINITELY go back - great location and very comfortable

Reviews.Title: “If proximity to Times Sq. is your priority…”
Reviews.Author: freqtraveleratl
Reviews.Content: …then this hotel is a good choice for you. It’s located one block away from the bustle of Times Square while being surprisingly quiet. You’ll be right in the middle of the theatre district and within walking distance of Central Park, Rockefeller Center and shops on 5th Avenue. The subway line to the financial district and the 9/11 Memorial is just two blocks away. For breakfast or dinner, head west to Hell’s Kitchen for some great, very affordable "local" restaurants. There are many good options and varieties of cuisines on 8th and 9th Avenues within a 5 to 10 minute walk from the hotel. Rooms at the hotel are average at best. Our basic double was small, more typical of a European hotel. The size was fine as we were not in the room very much, but the general condition was a bit run down, particularly the bathroom (cracked tiles, missing grout in the shower, and not particularly clean). We had a room facing the side, so it was quiet enough on the weekend nights to sleep with the window open. The jackhammers on 48th Street start at 7:00 a.m. on the weekday mornings, however, and you'll hear them no matter where you are. The check-in and check-out process was speedy and we were lucky to have a room ready for us when we arrived at 11:30 a.m. on Saturday. Finding an affordable hotel near Times Square and the theatre district is an adventure these days, but if you’re primary need is location, this place fits the bill for a comparatively reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel/excellent location!”
Reviews.Author: cogiebear
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Best Western President for 9 nights in Sept 2011 and LOVED it. The Hotel and all the staff were brilliant. Hotel: the hotel was modern, clean and the "presidents" theme was perfect for a trip to USA, really reminded you where you were when youo wake up each day. Our room was gorgeous, really spacious, air-con kept us feeling cool and the bed was really comfortable. The room had a safe, coffee making facilities and a huge TV. The bathroom was really light and had a great mirror for doing hair and make up in, the room had 2 full length mirror which was great for checking outfits befoe heading out. We had asked for a fridge which was ready and in our room when we arrived which meant we could have cold drinks anytime we wanted, however the hotel has ice machines available on a number of floors so even without a fridge you could get cold drinks. Lifts to all floors, and a nice seating area in the lobby if you wanted to have a seat or a drink in there. Location: Just on the corner of Times Square is perfect. There is a small shop right on the street where you can buy water, stamps, newspapers etc, across the street is a great deli and since you are right in the heart of the city there is literally everything you could want on your door step. The hotel is 2 streets away from the sub way that taakes you right down to the Staten Island ferry, and on that route you can get off at a number of great spots all the way down town. We were also only 4 streets away from the theatres showing Phantom, Addams Family and Rock Of Ages. We were 2 streets waway from Hells Kitchen which has so many lovely places to eat. And as you come out of the hotel, turn right, walk for about 3 minutes and you are on Times Square which is just spectacular to walk through on the way to and from your days/nights out. It is busy but thats what you want - why go to NY for a quiet holiday? haha. There is very little noise that comes in at night, but what we did hear from the street was no more that we would hear in our own house. As we flew into the Newark airport we used the Newark airport express which was only $15 per person each way, took 35 mins to get to the airport to the port authority bus station, and since the bus station was so close to the hotel, we could walk to the hotel, even with cases, it took us less than ten minutes, which was quicker and less expensive than getting a taxi. We would stay at the hotel again, as it was clean, great service and in such a good location.The hotel manager Jay, took time out to come and welcome us and had given me some great help and advice before we booked the hotel and after we arrived. Big thanks to Jay Deans and all the staff at the Best Western President, you really made our holiday extra special.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible hallways”
Reviews.Author: Maurício A
Reviews.Content: Maids carts are spread all over the hallways. Not worth the expensive price you pay!

Reviews.Title: “bestwestern,palmsprings,california”
Reviews.Author: manjulasharma
Reviews.Content: good bed comfortable room and breakfast. value for money. i will choose it any time.

Reviews.Title: “I'm here now. Do not spend a cent! Terrible. Run down. Disgusting.”
Reviews.Author: Haturanda
Reviews.Content: We were granted an early check in, which was great. The first room was so overwhelmingly hot and the a/c was down.... We were patient and allowed the staff ample time to rectify this. We returned 3 hours later and were given another room (it was not resolved). The new room had an open window and wet carpeting. Yes, wet carpeting. We are in this room now as I write this... The odor is intolerable. It's as though mildew married hot garbage. We were offered another room without a/c, which I suppose is more intolerable. We are staying the night and checking out 72 hours early and as fast as possible.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal location if your in New York”
Reviews.Author: mikie346
Reviews.Content: Stayed in a suite with family. Room adequate but could have been a bit bigger - however, considering location was to be expected, so not disapointed. Ideal location just off Times Square but off a side street so not too much noise. Easy walk to Broadway show (which was great) but if you walk in the other direction there are a few typical "older type" New York Streets that include Italian restaurants, live music piano bars, typical American diners etc. Hotel was clean and functional with a great restaurant on one side of the hotel and a good bar on the other side (neither were owned or part of the hotel - however hotel did serve food). As you can imagine great city to visit and all wiithin walking distance - although some "attractions" obvioulsy a lot further than others so you will need to plan a route in the direction your take; and then have another trek the next day. Dont miss a trip to the top of Empire State - but try to pick a quiet time (if you can). Would return if planning another trip to the city.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, price but really.....”
Reviews.Author: giannaCa
Reviews.Content: Loved the location, the price was not bad for NY and the room was relatively quiet unless you turned on the shower which sounded like a pneumatic drill. Old NY hotels are small and this was no exception Very small room with poor and intermittent internet reception but at least they did not charge for it. The bathroom only had room for one person at a time. The hotel said that the bed was a deluxe queen ( can't believe it but if the bed were any larger you could not have gotten out of it. The decor was odd. The lobby looked like it was decorated by Alice in Wonderland (see picture), the combination of purple and brown elsewhere was off. The maids carts were left parked in the dark hallway right by the elevators, It might have been a good idea to save a room for them to store supplies. I understand that the elevators are small and crowded so it might be reasoned that keeping them in the hallway on the floors was at least convenient. And the bedroom had a large light on the desk made of plastic in the shape of a bust of George Washington ( which did not work). But again the location was convenient and the price although high for much of the US was less than a lot of other hotels. There is an option for a continental breakfast or a full breakfast in the entry lobby. It is not a deal and you would do better to go to one of the small delis or an Europa cafe. Oh and the keys take a lot of tries to work. Try putting the key to the left side against the slit, that sometimes worked better than the 5 or so times it took to open the door. The bed was very comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Location Location”
Reviews.Author: Keane79
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel recently for a few nights with my husband. The location was fantastic, walked out the door right onto Times Square, The interior of the hotel was really modern and attractive. The is my second time to New York and this is by far a better location that last time on lexington. The rooms are quite small, buts thats to be expected in NY anyway, Would highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: Virsen
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel while in NYC in May. Chose it over the internet, because of the location, and wasn't disappointed. Very close to Times Square with numerous theatres and subway stations nearby. Safe to walk around the area at night, since it's so close to Times Square. Also just a few steps to 5th avenue. Rooms are very modern, with white leather couches. Only complaint was that the walls were very thin, so I could hear the neighbours talking. Very good front desk service... They were more than willing to keep my bags, since I had arrived a few hours before check-in time. Overall, very worth the money if you're looking for a good location and a real NYC experience.

Reviews.Title: “DIRTY HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: Susannagln
Reviews.Content: It was a terrible experience! the only good thing about this hotel is the position! it's really really dirty. and during the night you can't sleep well!!!

Reviews.Title: “It's just like being mugged....”
Reviews.Author: jacamp1
Reviews.Content: The recent upgrade they boast about isn't a big deal - you can't put lipstick on a pig! This hotel was very dirty and there is construction on the adjacent property - hope you like 7:30 AM jackhammering! There were hairs in the bathroom from several "guests" and the new bedsheets had a huge brown stain. We moved rooms due to the construction and our new room had the strongest musty smell I've ever encountered - I looked inside the air conditioning unit and it was a mix of grey and black mold due to condensation build up. The entrance to the hotel looks cool and glitsy, but you can't shine a turd and this dump is to be avoided. The location is excellent, but that is about all it has going for it.

Reviews.Title: “location is the only nice thing about this hotel”
Reviews.Author: g10betr0tter
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Best Western PLUS President Hotel at Times Square in September 2011. The good - The hotel is located on W48th Street between Broadway and 8th ave. It is only a block from times square and the theater district. The bad - In the first that we were assigned. the air conditioner did not work. We were then moved to another room where the air conditioner worked, but there was a musty smell in the room. Also, the rooms and the windows are not sound proofed. We would hear traffic throughout the night and woke up to the sound of very loud road construction at 7am. The elevators, hallways, and rooms are all very narrow, so it's hard to navigate if you have big suitcases. The bathrooms are not much better. There is no room to maneuver, and the tub is VERY slippery. Housekeeping were the worst. They left their carts in the hallways all day and night that made the narrow hallways even more narrow. They would also just barge into the room without knocking.

Reviews.Title: “Very well located – not very comfortable”
Reviews.Author: miroma
Reviews.Content: The location of the hotel - just a couple of minutes’ walk from Times Square - is what you pay for when you book it. The design of the lobby is quite interesting but that’s about all. Tiny rooms, walls that are not soundproof, noise from the airconditioning unit outside (bring some earplugs) – those are the main cons I think. Paying for the hotel breakfast is not really worth it as you can eat cheaper and better at one of the many cafes in the area. Free wi-fi is a bonus of course. If comfort is not a priority and you need a hotel just as a starting point to explore NYC and as a place to sleep – then go for it.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Good Modern Decor”
Reviews.Author: Helena P
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel at last minute at a very good rate and was pleasantly surprised. The hotel was easy to find and was within a decent walking distance of most tourist attractions. The interior of the hotel was very modern and spacious and my room was really nicely decorated. The bed was really comfey and the room was suprisingly quiet considering it's location and I slept very well! The room was very clean and all of the electronics worked perfectly, I particually enjoyed the I-Pod speakers provided as I was able to listen to my music whilst relaxing in the bath!! A fantastic hotel and I would highly recomend it!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice place”
Reviews.Author: subwoof3r
Reviews.Content: The hotel and rooms were great. Very close to Times Square and all important subway lines. It is New York, so do not expect silent nights... But the hotel is clean, staff are friendly and always happy to help. Booking long in advance also gives you a great chance to lower the rates very (!) much. When going to NY again, I will surely check this hotel's availability first.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, well located, average...”
Reviews.Author: malatestiano
Reviews.Content: As said below by many reviewers, very clean, well priced and great location (basically on Times Square). On the minus side: AC unit in my room was way too noisy and breakfast (not included in price of the room) not worth the additional 14+ dollars.. Saved quite a bit by using an online booking site via TripAdvisor.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable stay in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Rollo P
Reviews.Content: The room we stayed in was plenty big for three. The king size bed was very comfortable. The pull-out couch/bed also was reasonabley comfortable.We liked the view from the room(we could see a bit of the river). Bathroom was a good size and had a Jacuzzi tub. Overall a very nice experience. Plan on staying again next time we're in town.

Reviews.Title: “A nice place to stay in NY”
Reviews.Author: MariaM133
Reviews.Content: The location was great! Me and my daughter stayed there for 8 nights. We had a great time. The rooms were clean. Nicely decorated. Small but spacious enough for two (not so big) people. We were there the weekend of hurricane Irene. We had no trouble at all because of that. Lots of things to do/see was within waking distance. It made a verry pleasant stay for us. The staff was friendly. We liked Sunny, she was verry friendly, thanks for the service. They were verry helpfull at the frontdesk. I would surely stay here again. M Magdalena

Reviews.Title: “Great staff, view, and location”
Reviews.Author: Baffled48
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful stay at this hotel over the September 11th weekend. Woke up Sunday morning to bagpipes playing at a 9/11 memorial service in a park across the street. What a moving experience. Hotel was conveniently located near everything so getting around was quite easy. The manager Kori Yoran was extremely helpful and pleasant to work with and I would highly recommend him and his hotel to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Worth overlooking some negatives for location”
Reviews.Author: MeegieD
Reviews.Content: The staff are not the friendliest, and the lobby looks and sounds like a bar, however the price for the location is worth it. I asked for a late checkout and was given an extra hour which helped. I was also upgraded to a king without asking which was a very nice surprise. The rooms are a little cosy, but I was hardly there, so it didn't matter. Overall pretty decent

Reviews.Title: “Moldy room and rude staff”
Reviews.Author: pixelrenderer
Reviews.Content: Checked into the hotel. The staff was very unfriendly right off the bat. She put us in a room on the second floor. We entered the room and found dirty spots on the bed spread. It didn't stop here - we found mold (see photos) on the bathroom ceiling and the flushing system was not working right as well. I called the front desk to tell them about the problems, the same person answered and said: "We don't have any more rooms, if you don't like it, check out." Talked to the general manager two days later (checked in on weekend) and right away he attacked us by saying we were being unreasonable for trying to reach a manager after the incident late at night even though the staff has told us no one is on duty (which she didn't). Repeatedly told us the staff was trying to help us but she might be busy and that it was late and no one is around. I assured him she didn't do a thing to help and there weren't any traffic at the front desk. I have taken this up with customer relations. No words from anyone so far. Do yourself a favor and stay away from this hotel, there are other better options in the area that I wish I had checked out.

Reviews.Title: “good location room was tiny but clean very pricey”
Reviews.Author: CLARECM
Reviews.Content: the room we had was so tiny ...we paid $665 for two nights ....the towels were skimpy the bathroom was so small that you had to set the waste basket out if you wanted to close the door...you had your knees under the sink when seated on the toilet.......the bed was just a double...only one chair...the safe was so high in the closet that we could not use it with out a ladder.....they did supply two luggage racks...........the hall ways to our room were decorated with such a dark effect...it was claustrophobic...........the lobby of the hotel is bright and cheerful during the day....at night it doubles as a bar............the breakfast was not included in the price of the room and cost $14.95...think cruise buffet..not worth it...only reason to book this hotel is location.....just off times square close to the theater disctrict

Reviews.Title: “"NYC kind Hospitality"”
Reviews.Author: gfelsen
Reviews.Content: Had a great stay at the BW Plus President Hotel at Times Square. The front desk was very helpful in organizing Taxi's to the airport, directions to sightseeing locations and great restaraunts in the area. The beds were very comfortable to sleep in and enjoyed the breakfast buffet in the lobby. Obviously, you can't beat the location and proximity to Times Square. Being a Best Western Rewards member, I have always been impressed by their hotels service and ammenities and this stay was no different.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: TheCushNZ
Reviews.Content: Good option for times square in terms of price... But... 1. The standard rooms have beds that are the smallest doubles I've been in. Prepare to be cosy! 2. Who would have thought that what are supposedly Egyptian cotton sheets could feel so cheap and plastic? 3. Paper thin walls - at least you'll never feel lonely. On the plus side; the decor and the locations were stand out. Pity that the place let's itself down with cheapening out on the promises it makes.

Reviews.Title: “More than acceptable”
Reviews.Author: Jim_Jessome
Reviews.Content: Stayed there Aug 14-18th room was a bit small but it is NY ! PROS: EXTRA close to Times Square....well close to everything it seems Clean hotel with clean rooms and bathrooms. Free Wi-Fi Free upgrade when i said there for Honeymoon Able to leave luggage at front desk if room not ready on check-in CONS: A/C was hit and miss but maintainance was quick each time. (Did tell us that we could switch rooms if we wished) Breakfast over priced, signage not clear, especiall with such great deals a few min away...continental and americian breakfasts next to each other one but 2 different $$ One Front desk lady very rude and impersonal, didnt acknowledge our issues, just said....hmmmm thats too bad Toilet over flowed on our last morning, had to stay in room with maintainance until Fixed, lost the entire last am of our trip If you had to use their computers for internet, cost is $5.00/ 20 minutes

Reviews.Title: “Disappointment for the price”
Reviews.Author: lutzenkopf
Reviews.Content: Realizing NYC hotel rooms are somewhat small in size, I should have expected this, however small was an understatement. The common hallways are dimly lit (not a safe feeling) and when in the room, you needed to have one person sit on the bed or you couldn't get by one another and the bathroom was lacking proper housekeeping. The shower was moldy & someone's hair was all over the floor when we arrived in the room. The only real plus was the location, but having so many other hotels right within 2 blocks, I would not choose this again....sorry.

Reviews.Title: “It was ok, I would have another short stay......Great Location!!!”
Reviews.Author: fresh4yphe
Reviews.Content: Room was small but clean, they need to fix the smell on the floors.... the carpets smell like urine. Bed was comfortable and ok....... Checking out shouldn't be that long though, felt like i was at the desk for half an hour. GREAT LOCATION THOUGH!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing, claustrophobic and badly managed”
Reviews.Author: Judge404
Reviews.Content: Coming from a foreign country to NYC, we picked the Best Western chain because it offers good value in our country. Not this hotel. Out of 3 lifts only 2 worked. According to TripAdvisor reviews this has been the case for a long time. Each lift only fits a few people and there are 15 floors to service. Ended up using stairs for 8 floor journey - was faster. Passages are narrow and always seem to be cluttered with cleaning trolleys and bins - all times of day. Bathroom was a little grimey and smelled like sour socks. Overall a bad experience and not recommended at all.

Reviews.Title: “There was a MOUSE in my room!!!! WORST HOTEL EXPERIENCE EVER”
Reviews.Author: NJRRM
Reviews.Content: Ok the usual, rude staff, bellboys unwilling to help and even got some long faces when asked to help, free wifi kept kicking us off, but THE WORST: The night before check out I woke up about 5 am because I heard something. Woke up my husband to check and indeed he saw a MOUSE scrumming through some bags! I'm afraid of mice so I started screaming. I've never had anything like this happen to me before and I've been to a lot of hotels. Called housekeeping and they said they would send someone, it was taking too long so we went down to the front desk and told the guy about the mouse and he said yeah 1415 right, I was just up there but no one answered, well with every little sound I heard I started screaming and I do recall something which sounded like knocking, why didn't he say something or keep knocking? Anyway he told us due to the construction more people have complained about mice! Only on the 15th floor, the smoking rooms, they've not yet been spotted on. He couldn't do much he said we had to wait for the front office manager. He did give us another room on the 5th floor, he did not send someone up with us to help us with our luggage, so my husband had to carry everthing out from the 14th to 5th by himself (I wasn't setting a foot in there anymore) THIS IS NOT WHAT WE CAME TO NYC FOR!!! To be continued

Reviews.Title: “front desk manager very rude”
Reviews.Author: joesmi
Reviews.Content: during my stay in august of 2011 i had the misfortune of having to deal with the front desk manager i believe his name was william even though he refused to give me his name when i asked luckily i heard someone call him by his name found him very rude definitley not an assett to your hotel the front desk would probably run better without him because of him and him alone i would never stay there again he comes off very uptight very cold does not care about someone's feeling when i requested to see him 3 times he blew me off every time telling me he had a meeting and also rooms are the size of a closet with mice running all over the place

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced and very small”
Reviews.Author: SarahA_140
Reviews.Content: We came to the hotel for one night while travelling around the USA. Having paid nearly 300 dollars for one night we were expecting a nice hotel and room. Upon arrival the hotel reception was nicely modern and clean. However our room was very small with the bed shoved up against the wall. There was a plug socket hanging off of the wall and the toilet was so small you could barely move about. There was no toiletries or soap left for us either. The hotel had obviously recently been decorated however the bathroom was still quite dated. All in all we were very dissapointed.

Reviews.Title: “Overall an ok stay.”
Reviews.Author: lippam08
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the hotel for three nights. Overall stay was ok. Some of the front desk staff were super helpful...one even helped fix my computer...where others couldn't even give me directions to the closest subway (about 2 blocks away). My room was the smallest I have ever stayed in but you can't beat the awesome location. I found many hairs on the air conditioner and bath tub but otherwise the room was nice. The lobby of the hotel is cozy and well decorated.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: aizi
Reviews.Content: If you want to go to Times Square and be close to the city centre and the action, Best Western President would be the perfect choice. Great service and friendly personnel, very nice housekeeping service, new neat and clean rooms... No need to worry about wasting time coz everything is near...

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for....”
Reviews.Author: rsmmom
Reviews.Content: Here are the pluses: - Lobby was nice - Front desk staff were nice - rate (for being close to Times Square) And now the not so good: - upon arriving at floor, there were several boxes of toiletries in the hallway. they were there for 24 hrs (at least, as you'll see below) - chair in room had broken arm that hung down - towel rack in bathroom hanging off wall - couch in room had plastic-type covering. like sitting on your grandma's couch - fold out bed sagged badly - a/c in main room made HORRIBLE sound every time the compressor kicked in (like every 10-15 minutes). after not sleeping for several hours, we turned off. but it had been raining and hot, so not real pleasant. - and the kicker... when making rez, asked for quiet room. when we arrived it was raining. when in room we looked out at an empty lot with construction equipment there (no one working as it was raining). and promptly at 7am (after not sleeping due to a/c, etc.) we got to hear non-stop jack-hammer, beeping, etc. Like it was 10 feet away. Yes, this can happen, but what bugs is we had originally planned to stay 4 nights and after telling the clerk we were leaving (after 1 night), she offered to move us. Huh? Why didn't you just give us a decent room like I requested? We checking in on a Tuesday, so I know they weren't booked. - luckily we booked with AAA rate and was able to leave. If I paid the entire 4 nights up front, I wonder how that would have gone. It's sad that this hotel was renovated somewhat recently (2-3 years?) and it's already gone waaay downhill. The whole 'lipstick on a pig' thing.

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING. I recommend!”
Reviews.Author: Crisreg
Reviews.Content: The service was great. The front desk staff Cassandra and Kumar were very friendly and informative. Check-in was very quick and easy. The room was very clean and comfortable. The room included wi-fi which was great. The housekeeping staff, Ingrid and Angel, were super nice and very accommodating. The shower and bed was amazing. The restaurant downstairs was incredible. I would recommend to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, but tiny rooms”
Reviews.Author: Tyronegirl1971
Reviews.Content: Unbeatable location, right off Broadway. Some staff were wonderful, others downright rude. The rooms are tiny. I know you don't stay in NYC to sit in your room all day, but I found the rooms somewhat claustrophobic. I personally didn't like the decor, it was a bit too kitsch for my liking....

Reviews.Title: “"Tropical Rain" inside the room”
Reviews.Author: Filipoco
Reviews.Content: Hotel very well located near Times Square. With modern common areas, great decor and refurbished rooms. However, not all rooms were fully refurbished and redecorated. First I was put in a small room, which at first sight had been restored, thanks to the new wallpaper and modern decor. However, the bathroom was not redecorated, seriously in need of work. The sink taps sometimes just lay cold water, while other times the water only came out hot. Everything was old. Poor air conditioning, too old, whose temperature I could not regulate and the noise was unbearable. A few days after arriving (and with very negative temperatures on the street and as air conditioning that didn't work properly) I tried to turn it off (despite the cold) but the situation only worsened. The noise grew louder and I had to ask to fix that. Although initially seem that the situation was resolved, the air conditioner started to make noise again and pour a lot of steam water (like a sauna). During the night, when I finally had fallen asleep, I began to feel a few drops of water falling on my body. The air conditioning released so much steam water that allowed water to accumulate on the roof, causing rain in bed. Faced with this situation, I went to reception and demanded immediate change of room. The new room had an air conditioner that worked properly and the room was more spacious. What made me realize that I had initially been assigned a lower bedroom category than the one that I've paid (Deluxe queen room). That's why I was surprised by the small dimensions of the room ... Because of this confusion, I can not recommend the hotel. When returning to New York, surely I will choose another hotel. And another area of the city. After two times in New York, both times in Times Square, there are other quieter, beautiful areas, and equally well located, where to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Would not stay there again”
Reviews.Author: BeatleFanFCB
Reviews.Content: The Best Western President Hotel has a great location in the heart of the theater district, literally just down the block from Times Square. The staff was friendly. Unfortunately everything in the hotel is beat up. The sink in our room was cracked and there were scuff marks all over the walls. It was the smallest hotel room I have ever been in. There was no desk. Ordinarily I don't use a desk but I wound up eating in the room one night and realized there was no place to sit down and have a meal other than on the bed, I could live with that for the location. What I could not cope with was the noise level. 48th Street is extremely busy with tour busses and commercial vehicles AND there is a fire station just three doors down from the hotel. If you have a room on the 48th Street side of the building your chances of getting a decent night's sleep are zero. We wanted the room made up because we wanted dry towels. Left the sign on the door when we left for the day at 8 am and returned at 3 pm and the room had not been cleaned. I would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “nice family getaway”
Reviews.Author: John P
Reviews.Content: Got the room through Priceline and I admit I was a bit concerned about the size of the room for our family of four. I conttacted the hotel and they were able to upgrade us to a room that was comfortable for all of us. The staff was excellent - and the location was perfect! Would certainly go back again.

Reviews.Title: “Beware of priceline”
Reviews.Author: nitenursing
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel through priceline and got a decent price although it was only $50-$70 less than booking it directly. Unfortunately I was given a single bed room and I needed 2 beds. I called the hotel directly and to change it they wanted to charge me another $100 a night thus canceling my "good deal". I talked to the manager who( after a few insults on his part) worked with me and gave me a two bed room for an extra price. I'm not sure if I will be staying here again but I wanted to get the word out to be leary of using priceline if you HAVE to have more than one bed.

Reviews.Title: “Superb location”
Reviews.Author: fatshaman
Reviews.Content: The room I got was of decent size...small but enough. Have to keep the blinds down all the time as the window faces the opposite apartment block. You could just about see what's going on in the apartments. Lifts were pretty small and tight and took a while. The corridors were narrow. Room and bathroom were clean. Internet in the room was a pain even though it was free. Better to use in the lobby. But location is perfect. Minutes walk to the subway, Broadway, restaurants, cafes, and everything else. Staff were ok. Not too friendly but not grumpy. Room rates were pretty high but I guess that's what you pay for location.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty basic, but great location”
Reviews.Author: snoopee
Reviews.Content: Initially, I was very underwhelmed, even disappointed with the hotel itself. However, the location is the best you could hope for. It's dead center of everything you'd want to do in NYC. I like to walk, so I walked in all directions of the hotel for hours and never a dull moment. The Vietnamese restaurant downstairs (Saigon) is awesome, reasonably priced and the staff bend over backwards to make you happy. The rooms at the hotel are quite marginal and the internet is unreliable, but who cares....you're in the heart of everything! And the price isn't bad...all things considered. Warning...no desks or chairs in the rooms, so be prepared to lay in bed with a laptop. No biggie....just know it ahead of time. All in all, a good value. Oh, one last note....I am really picky about mattresses and they have really great mattresses! No breakfast included.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location to Time Square”
Reviews.Author: FLskibear
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Best Western President in July. This hotel is in a great location to Time Square. Just close enough to the lights and excitement of Time Square, but far enough away to get out of the craziness. We arrived a little before check-in time and to our surprise our room was ready. The room was very comfortable and the bed slept well. The housekeeping service was great. Our room was very clean and made-up daily. All appears to have been re-modeled recently. A few nights during our stay we did hear the sirens of the firehouse that was next door to the hotel. You also hear the large trucsk and horns of the cars driving down the steet. The front desk staff is not very friendly. As we were checking out of the hotel the women at the front desk asked the gentleman ahead of us if he needed a cab, however did not offer the same service to us. Also, do not bother with eating breakfast here. It is not worth the money. You can find better out on the town.

Reviews.Title: “great little nook in the big apple”
Reviews.Author: missanabanana
Reviews.Content: I've been to NY plenty of times and have stayed at friends apartments throughout the years. This time I decided to be a "tourist" and see what NY was like from this perspective. To my delight I managed to find a great little place called the President's Hotel (an off branch of the Best Western Chain). This hotel will have deals from time to time on the various travel sites (expedia, travelocity, hotwire etc). If you can get a room when there's a deal it's well worth it. You're in the very core of times square and literally 1 -2 blocks away from theaters, media studios and about 3 NY blocks from rocker feller center. The hotel is a bit older but very clean (which i am a stickler for). The service of staff were polite with a bit of that new yorker twist :) they have a great little bar in the lobby and the staff there were great as well. Considering you're in the heart of the action, the price for the place was fair and justified considering other hotels adjacent to it were overcharging by at least $80 (US). As a side note, keep in mind that due to it being in a busy bustling world class city, there is some traffic noise but i found it to die down by midnight as it's located on a side street. If you're looking for a venue where you get the most bang for your buck I highly recommend this place and will certainly be booking again for future visits to NY.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but overwhelmed staff.”
Reviews.Author: Ssimon11
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a nice lobby but from a functionality prospective it is very inefficient. Elevators run horriblely. The bar and excersize room are in photos are virtually non existent. Staff here was not friendly either. The room decour is tacky.Now the positives: location. Cleanliness. Safe. Nice lobby. Affordable. Free wifi. All in all it was okay if you paid $150 like I did. Look for cheaper rates on 3rd party sites or on the hotel tonight iPhone app.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, friendly staff, comfortable beds..”
Reviews.Author: Bujci
Reviews.Content: We had a great time át this hotel. The location is wonderful, only 2 minutes walk from Times Square. The staff was always helpful, the rooms were clean and most important of all the beds were extremly comfortable. There's nice view of the city and all the lights from the windows. Great value, I would definitly go back!

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable hotel in a good location”
Reviews.Author: MauroSantos
Reviews.Content: Our family (couple and 2 teens) have stayed 11 nights in a Suite Deluxe. The hotel is small and reasonable. It's a Best Western! Positives: Good location near the theaters and Times Square. Easy subway access. Cleanliness. Suite Deluxe for 4 peoples with a enough size. Pleasant decoration. Confortable bed. Good AC. Wi-fi for free everywhere in the hotel. A lady at the desk speaks portuguese. Budget Car Rental Store very close. Staff correct. Bathroom correct. Negatives: Unconfortable sofa-bed (ask for a suite with 2 full beds). Small and malfunction fridge. Broken knob of the shower. They've ignored my complaints for 2 times, so I gave up. There's a fire station in the corner, so the noise sometimes can be boring. I recommend it, I could come back. But if you can spend a little more money, take a look at the hotel Crowne Plaza Times Square, just across the street.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Times Square location, great value.”
Reviews.Author: SalemTravelBureau
Reviews.Content: I travel to NYC fairly frequently and prefer the Times Square area. The BW Plus President is an excellent location between 8th and Broadway on 48th. Walk one-half block from this hotel to Broadway and all Times Square has to offer. Walk up two blocks to Stardust Diner where the aspiring singers and dancers will entertain you while you enjoy typical diner breakfast, lunch or dinner. The hotel has two restaurants flanking the hotel, Aoki and Saigon 48. Although I didn’t eat there, the menus and prices looked reasonable; the hotel offers full American breakfast in the lobby for a fee. Room service for B L D. This hotel is older, the rooms are tiny by American standards. My bedroom was small (pictures posted) but adequate for one or two guests; it had one queen bed with nice crisp white sheets and duvet. The hotel recently underwent an extensive renovation and the carpet throughout looks new. Large flat screen television, ample plugs for electronics, modern lighting, double window coverings, a blackout shade and a decorative privacy shade, coffee maker, a small closet with safe, iron and ironing board and free local calls as well as free wifi. The tiny bathroom had a very short tub (4 1/2’max). The shower was good, water pressure strong, hot water hot and a curved shower bar for added comfort. Good bathroom lighting, makeup mirror and hairdryer attached to the bathroom wall. Again, an average size traveler will have no problem in this small bathroom. I observed guests at reception who were wanting king rooms but paid standard double and a family of three who paid standard double and expected two double beds. The lowest price gets you one double or queen bed. I am told the hotel has king beds in suites and queen beds in some rooms but I didn't see those. The hotel has 44 suites with a bed and sofa bed, they also have Presidential suites with outside patios; I have only seen those in the brochure. Through a travel agency, I booked a vacations package with air and hotel at a very reasonable price. When I arrived the room was paid as agreed, I provided a credit card for incidentals ($3.80 for bottled water from the lobby bar). Remember with free internet throughout the hotel, paying for water is still a good value! The hotel has two small elevators that were fairly fast and smooth. Elevator service better than in many older hotels, but not as spacious (with 9 people was packed) or as many as in newer hotels. Hallways were dark with wallpaper and carpeting that added to the dark effect. I did think the maid cart should have a different home than always in the hallway but there probably isn’t any place to store it when the hotels is completely full which it was. The large aquarium behind reception desk was a delight to the kids. By contrast to the dark corridors, the lobby is white and bright and airy. Caution to any traveler, you are buying a clean hotel with friendly personnel service and location, location, location. It is easy to pay two or three times the money for other hotels only blocks away. Value for money, this was hotel is perfect especially if you are one or two travelers only per room. I will stay here again and will recommend to friends. Remember Best Western hotels are not cookie cutter design they are independently owned properties unique to each location. Part of the enjoyment to me is that the hotels do each have a personality of their own. This one offers a very good option for NYC!

Reviews.Title: “Try to get as far as you can from a window!!!”
Reviews.Author: PepeRivas2
Reviews.Content: Great location, didn't like the restaurant and try not to get a room facing either 8th Av or the 48th. You won't be able to sleep. If you get an upper room or one of the suites, then you are lucky and you will get a great return for what you pay. For some reason, at the time of doing the renovation they forgot to renew all the windows!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel will stay there again”
Reviews.Author: JoanBruceC
Reviews.Content: This was our first time staying in New York City and we had an excellent experience staying at Best Western President Hotel. The service was super, the room was very clean, bed very comfortable and felt very safe. It was a very enjoyable stay and we plan on coming back here again to stay. The location was convenient to everything. We took in a play, went to South Street Seaport, Times Square, Rockerfeller Center and because of the location found many wonderful restuarants to eat at. I highly recommend this hotel to stay at when in New York City you will be pleasantly surprised how nice it is and how friendly and accomodating the staff is. It is a great value for your money. Joan & Bruce

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay at the Best Western Hotel”
Reviews.Author: FreshFlowers2009
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at the Best Western hotel in July 2011. It was a good value - great location. Really great spot for people watching. Just blocks from everything Theaters, subway, Times Square.Very clean, comfortable room. Lovely soft bed with puffy cover .Nice staff. Helpful bell station.Quiet--although we recommend asking for the backside of the hotel, Con--Small bathroom, but that's not unexpected in NYC.Restaurant--we didn't eat there but looked nice The bar prices on the high side. On the other hand, a glass of wine will cost you $8 just about anywhere in NYC.Overall--We'll go back..

Reviews.Title: “The staff were incredible”
Reviews.Author: Enjoywork22
Reviews.Content: I loved the firendly and efficient service of the front of house staff. I felt very at welcome. The restaurant attached to the hotel had great food and service. The bedding was very comfortable..I trruly was like sleeping on a cloud after a busy day of work and sightseeing. The shower was strong and pleantly of heat The room was always cleaned to highest standard and the housemaid staff were also very friendly and efficient. The location is fantastic close to everything you need to enjoy a busienss and pleasure trip to New York.

Reviews.Title: “stay away from this hotel !!!”
Reviews.Author: zvibleier
Reviews.Content: We reserved two nights and we stayed only one night. After a long night that we did not sleep at all, we jumped to the shower and found out that the drain was clogged, later the toilet was also clogged. The free internet is not working at all. We called and let them know that we wanted a quit room with working plumbing, they were unpleasant to say the list and told us to wait until they have a room. We went out and return after two hours, there was no room and again, the nasty attitude. We checked out and will never come back to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good cost benefit at Time Square!”
Reviews.Author: FelipeVicari
Reviews.Content: The location was the main reason to us to choose this hotel but arriving there we've were surprised by the modern atmosphere of the place. From the front desk to the accomodations its all renewed with a modern design. The rooms are small but offers all we need to have a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “In the heart of the action”
Reviews.Author: markbnyc
Reviews.Content: Our family of 2 adults, 2 kids stayed in April 2011. This was my second stay at this hotel and it has been extensively re-furbished since my 2008 visit, with the "president" theme throughout the hotel from the photos in the lobby right down to the illuminated "Washington head" lamp and JFK linen in the room! A double room does not afford much space, but other than sleeping why would you want to be in your room anyway...your in New York - get out there and see the place. Rooms were clean & presentable and although the hotel is in the heart of the theatre district I didn't have any concerns about noise & slept well on a really comfortable bed. As just mentioned, the hotel is in the heart of the theatre district and a one minute walk will see you in Times Square - an ideal area to be based as all of midtown is within walking distance. It took me & my daughter 15 minutes to walk from the hotel on 48th to the Empire State Building on 34th St, and roughly 15 minutes to Columbus Circle & Central Park straight up 8th Ave, although there are plenty of cabs should you not wish to walk everywhere. The only things that annoyed me about the hotel were the temperamental shower at times of high demand (ie mornings) and the time spent waiting for the elevators - the record stands at 15 minutes before one arrived that wasn't full. Otherwise OK and would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Don't go!!!”
Reviews.Author: sifab
Reviews.Content: I could be ok with the fact they didn't get our reservation we made by phone, because they gave us a room in any case when we arrived. The hotel is overrated: ugly, dirty and the people are unpolite (not in NY style, in texan style...). The bathroom sink was completly broken, the room was so tiny that the bed arrived at the door. fortunately there was a (small) flat tv, otherwise there would not have space for the luggages. Please, avoid it.

Reviews.Title: “Do Not book this hotel-disgusting”
Reviews.Author: jessicajhall1984
Reviews.Content: I read a couple reviews that put this hotel down, but I thought it would be fine because the location was good. the hotel was the worst I have ever stayed in. Our first room smelled so badly of mold and uncirculated air AND ACTUALLY HAD DRIED URINE ALL OVER THE TOILET!!!! I asked to be moved. The front desk seemed so used to complaints, he didnt even care and changed us rooms. Our air conditioner died in our new room and I woke up soaking wet and went to the desk at 3 in the morning and they gave me no apologies but gave me this gigantic fan that sounded like a plane landing in our room. We both got sick from the lack of circulation and the dust in the room. I also assume that there is mold in the hotels because of teh smell. It was honestly THE WORST HOTEL AND NOT WORTH THE MONEY!!! STAY AT ANY OTHER HOTEL NEAR TIMES SQUARE THAT IS NOT THIS ONE. I have never complained anywhere, but this one was so awful words can not even describe it!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel from hell”
Reviews.Author: OceanLove3
Reviews.Content: We are from Jersey, but no longer live in the area. We were visiting family there and decided to spend one night in the city. This hotel was absolute hell. First off, it took over an hour to check in. One hour!!! The room itself was smaller than my closet, and the ac was not working. Let me mention, I am 7 months pregnant and NYC was going through a heat wave (it was over 100 outside) so this was just not going to fly. Now, let me get to the worst part. The people in the room next to us were blasting their music so loud, that it was hard to hear each other. You could hear it the second you stepped off the elevator, it was that bad. We called downstairs to complain and they said they'll send someone up. My friend and I decided to go downstairs to complain about the lack of ac, and my husband stayed behind in the room. We ran into a security guard in the hall, who was on his way to the room next door to tell them to be quiet. We told him it was us who called, and I guess he thought there was no one else in the room. Little did he know, my husband was in the room and heard the entire conversation. He was able to get the ghetto guy to come out of his room, shirtless and tattooed, and the guy was screaming at the security guard, telling him he'll show us how quiet he can be in the middle of the night. The security guy's response? "Do what you have to do, just don't do it on my shift," then he proceeds to tell him when his shift ends! What kind of security do they have working at this place? We felt completely unsafe after that, and were moved to another room on another floor. I would not recommend this hotel to anyone. The staff sucks and your complaints go unheard.

Reviews.Title: “Totally worth stay here”
Reviews.Author: Fernandoliborio
Reviews.Content: I liked alot in a general way, people are very helpfull, and you can reserve at the hotel lobby a shuttle for a lot of places, like teather AirPort or tourism spots. The price is good too!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location in TIme Square!”
Reviews.Author: ryzach
Reviews.Content: This was my first trip to NYC with my 2 children, who wanted to stay in Time Square. This hotel was great as far as location goes! Price was under $200 which was also great for the location. We had arrived early (1pm) and was told -after not being acknowledged for 5 minutes at the fron desk - that our room was not ready and that we could leave our luggage with the doorman. Apparently there were several people in the same situation because the hallway was packed with guest luggage! I thought the day front desk staff were average-not overly nice or helpful. The evening staff were much better! The room -we had a junior suite- had a queen bed and pull out sofa, was small but nice. Took forever for the shower to get hot water. The decor was modern, but could tell the place was old. The bed was very comfortable and the room had 2 flat screen TV's. Hallways and elevators quite small. I would probably stay agin if in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Front Desk and Manager were great, but room was soso”
Reviews.Author: jswonger
Reviews.Content: Before coosing this hotel I read earlier reviews and emailed the manager concerning them. He was very polite and stated that the problems were no longer and issue and offered me a free upgrade to my room selection. I was glad of that, as I would hate to see what my original room would have been like. I expect rooms to be small, but I don't see how the room could have been any smaller without the upgrade that I was told I was given. When I checked in the front desk made no mention of it either, but I did get a room quickly. I checked in at about 4:45, well after the 3pm check-in time, and was dissappointed to find the room without towels. Then again there was no towl rack either, the shelf for the towels was there, but the towel rack had gone missing, so we had to drape towels on coat hangers so that they would dry. The walls of the shower were not too clean, still plenty of soap scum that we wiped off before showering. I guessed that the room would be small, but I couldn't walk around the bed without having to move the desk chair. The coolest thing about the room was the bust of George Washington that glowed when you turned it on, very fun. Only one other nitpick, the breakfast there was, to my mind, over priced for what it was. I would suggest going around the corner to one of the many little bodegas or restaurants nearby and get the same breakfast for half the cost.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Stay”
Reviews.Author: TomInNYS
Reviews.Content: I was worried about staying the President after reading some of the reviews here but used an Expedia reservation without knowing the name of the hotel. We arrived early (10:30 am) and the lady at the front desk was very pleansant. She allowed us to check our baggage and said our room would be ready by 12:30 pm which it was. The room was very clean; the bathroom, clean and modern. There is a closet in the room with a safe, iron and ironing board. A coffee maker was provided. Nice toietries and plenty of towels in the bathroom.I felt that some of the reviewers must have stayed in the hotel before the hotel was refurbished. Check out was easy and baggage was checked with a fee of $1.00 per bag. Front desk clerks were very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “WOW~”
Reviews.Author: PURPLESCOUT7
Reviews.Content: This was such a pleasant stay. Everyone from the front desk clerks, the lobby personnel, the cleaning team etc were very gracious and polite. My adult daughter needed to print something and they helped her out. The room was gorgeous, clean, and very chic. We were thrilled with the location! 1/2 block from Times Square and parking easy across the street. We will be using this in the future for any adventures in the Big Apple!

Reviews.Title: “Planning our next trip back”
Reviews.Author: mep69
Reviews.Content: The staff was most helpful above and beyond courteous! The rooms are very clean and comfortable. The neighborhood is safe, you couldn't ask for a better location!! Centrally located to walk most anyplace with easy subway access or catch a cab right out front. Quick, easy trip to Yankee Stadium!! Highly recommended!!

Reviews.Title: “super stay in the heart of time square”
Reviews.Author: 99galway99
Reviews.Content: my girlfriend (Fiancée) and i stayed here on our first trip to NYC, we got engaged while there and the manager was great, making our stay really comfortable. we really only used the hotel as a base as we spend all day out enjoying the city. for the price we paid compared to that of other hotels we looked at on hotels.com it was very good value. as other reviews have stated if you want some highend luxury well pay for it. but if you want an excellent base in clean comfortable accomadation you wont go too far wrong here. in regard to the room size, we were in an upgrade and it was plenty big. staff were fine as plesent as anyone we met in nyc although we found general service in nyc to be poor. one gentleman on front desk was very plesent and i only delt with him as a result, sadly cant recall his name. i would recommend this hotel as a good base to discover the city from.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel - Great Location”
Reviews.Author: andyoScotland
Reviews.Content: This was our second visit to the Best Western President, the first being 2 years ago while it was undergoing extensive renovation. The location is fantastic, on a fairly quiet street, yet only yards from the bustle of Times Square. We had booked a smoking suite, but on arrival were told that there were none available - presumably our suite had been sold to someone else? I know we smokers are in a minority these days and smoking rooms are becoming a rarity in some locations, but why tell you you have secured a smoking room then let it go before you arrive? Anyway, that apart and the fact that the wireless internet was next to useless, we enjoyed our stay. The hotel has been tastefully updated and the staff were pleasant and generally helpful. Our suite consisted of a good sized bedroom with a large tv and small fridge, and a similar sized sitting room with bed settee, again with a large tv. The bathroom had a large walk in shower. Overall the accomodation was very good. It was good to see the improvements that had been made since our last visit, but we were saddened to hear of the death of Manny, who was a porter then and who was a very helpful and really nice man. His presence in the lobby was missed. In all, we would certainly stay here again, but I would ask that reservations should be honoured where possible and that if you book a particular room, eg smoking, well in advance, that room should be waiting for you on arrival (Ok, I know I should give up)

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: jessatl
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed my stay at the Best Western. The hotel was updated and clean and the location was great. I was a little apprehensive about the staff and a couple more things because of several reviews that I read. But everyone I talked to was very friendly and prompt; including the General Manager. When I go to New York in the future, I will look forward to staying at the Best Western!

Reviews.Title: “Unbeatable location”
Reviews.Author: DFWjournalist
Reviews.Content: You're in the heart of Times Square and the Theater District. Lots to see and do nearby or a short subway ride away. The rooms are small but comfortable. When we checked in, the air conditioning in our room didn't work. However, the staff quickly and politely moved us to another room. The ice machine on two floors was out of order. But overall, I would have no problem staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in mid-town NYC”
Reviews.Author: Bluestar99
Reviews.Content: Well located, clean, professional staff makes this an excellent hotel for the travelor looking for a good room, reasonably priced, without the kitchenette type set-up which I don't use.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome location!!”
Reviews.Author: ushakrish
Reviews.Content: The main argument for the hotel is its location and its proximity to Broadway and Times Square.the room on the sixth floor given to us was small and compact and after our stay in other cities and hotels ,this seemed cramped. Luckily for us, the bathroom was clean except for a leaky commode.The housekeeping staff left their supplies and carts always in the corridor which was annoying cos last thing you want to be greeted with is garbage and carts in the corridor on the way to your room. the staff at the front desk do have an attitude and are not all that welcoming. Since we did not spend much time at the hotel,it was ok. As i said earlier, the winning argument for the hotel is its location!!

Reviews.Title: “Our 30th Wedding Anniversary was perfect”
Reviews.Author: littlebear6252
Reviews.Content: Everything was perfect. I can't think of anything that could have made our stay anymore enjoyable!!! We would love to return to this hotel as it was very pleasant, clean, comfortable, and quiet with plenty of space and in a great location. We were very pleased with the cleaning staff, reception, bellman and the concierge. They were all very willing to assist us. We did not spend a lot of time in the hotel but we slept great and were very comfortable. We'd like to say Thank you to the President Hotel for a perfect weekend. You helped make our 30th Anniversary in New York City one that we will remember and cherish.

Reviews.Title: “Location excellent but read on!”
Reviews.Author: Newyorkfan11
Reviews.Content: Excellent location only a minute or two from Times Square. Had little contact with staff but found them to be courteous. The room was compact! for 4 people and had a massive TV attached to the wall. The TV was far too big for the room and we all have bruises after bumping into it. The room was bright and the air-con worked fine. Cleanliness was OK. The hotel website mentions that the hotel had been refurbished however they must have forgot to do the bathroom, it was smelly, looked like it hadn't been refurbed since 1970's. Sanitary ware was stained and cracked however the water was always hot. The corridors smelt of food! I found like other reviewers that the housekeeping carts and wastebins were always in the corridor close to the lift and fire exit (I saw this on at least 4 floors) - could this be a hazard if an emergency evacuation were required? Unlike other hotels there did not appear to be any literature in the room explaining about the hotel or it's services. Other than location I would not recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very Bad Service”
Reviews.Author: Anaknilinda
Reviews.Content: We arrived quite late, around 9pm and found our room is disarray. It was hard to tell if the room was cleaned. The bed was not made and the trash not taken out. I was angry but I very calmly called the front desk and they quickly sent a most gracious woman from housekeeping to clean the room and make the beds. The room was small, as expected. On the second night, after being out all day seeing the sights of NYC, our key would not open the door! There was a coffee maker but we couldn't make coffee because the supply was not replenished! Overall, the staff was apologetic but it was not enough. They did nothing to make our stay better. They advertise Free WiFi but this is a lie. You get no signal from the room! My husband had to hang out in the lobby for WiFi. When we checked out, I sought the GM and politely told him that we were very disappointed with the service and that I would write a review in TripAdvisor.

Reviews.Title: “Dirty and stinky with a rude, nasty, condescending staff!”
Reviews.Author: PennsylvaniaJosie
Reviews.Content: I purchased a one night stay for me and my daughter through Priceline for $189.00. When I arrived (at 10:30 am) the exceptionally RUDE woman at the front desk told me my room would be ready at 12. Although I didn’t expect my room to be ready, I did want to check in and leave my luggage so we could set out on our journey through New York for the rest of the day and most of the evening. She would not let me check in, in fact, she was snippy and didn’t welcome us nor did she even look me in the eye. I felt like I was an annoyance to her. We left our luggage and decided to do some shopping and have some lunch and then check in before we hit downtown – since the room would be ready by noon. We arrived back at the hotel at 1:30 and the same snippy woman said “your room is not ready, come back at 3”. When I reminded her that she told us it would be ready at 12 and that we delayed our day to get settled, she slammed something down and told me “CHECK IN IS AT 3!” Again delaying our trip downtown, we decided to walk to and through Central Park to kill some time. Around 3 I called to make sure our room was ready, and it was. Upon arrival I was greeted by another woman who checked us in. We took the elevator to the third floor and was shocked by the stench and the bags of garbage sitting in the hall way. THE FLOOR STUNK! We got into our room and were pleased that it did not stink and was very clean and cool. I decided to get washed up and my daughter decided to play some music in the IPOD station. The whole window side of the room was without electricity. No working lights or IPOD station! I called the front desk and was told someone would be up to fix it. I also requested some towels and shampoo. We decided not to wait and left the room to do some shopping – which was already delayed by several hours. We returned to drop off some shopping bags and the stench in the hallway was even worse and now there were about 6 overflowing bags of trash right outside the elevator doors. We were happy however to find the lights and IPOD station working, but still no towels or shampoo. 2 calls later and towels and shampoo arrived. One positive note is that the bed was extremely comfortable, the air conditioning was great and the bathroom was clean. Woke up refreshed after a good night’s sleep and my daughter went down to the gym while I ran out for some coffee. Once again I had to make my way around the overflowing bags of garbage and bear the disgusting smell of trash to get to my room from the elevator. When I returned my daughter was already back from the gym. She said the gym STUNK and was too hot. At that point we decided to check out instead of prolonging this experience any longer. I was annoyed to see the same woman who gave me such a hard time Monday morning at the reservation desk. I handed her my key and asked for my receipt and she told me you don’t get one, if you want one you have to go through Priceline. When I protested, she put her hand up to my face, closed her eyes and dismissed me. I didn’t appreciate being treated like an unwanted guest and will NEVER return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location. Kind of chic, kind of gross.”
Reviews.Author: SoFlaFam
Reviews.Content: You can't beat the location--so close to Broadway. They fortunately updated this hotel with some fun and funky decor touches and decent bathrooms, but that didn't totally mask the fact that it's an old building and kind of run-down. There's a perpetual greasy garlicky smell in the lobby because of its proximity to an Asian fusion restaurant. The walls are paper thin; I fortunately have a white noise app on my iPhone or I wouldn't have been able to sleep. But the gym was great and the staff was nice. It's a good bet for the money, all my complaints aside. I might stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Love the best western President Hotel”
Reviews.Author: doc038
Reviews.Content: Friendly staff, great location, nice rooms! I'll be back in Sept!!

Reviews.Title: “Sadly disappointing”
Reviews.Author: Ans40
Reviews.Content: I have travelled to North America since I was young and Best Western was always our hotel of choice because of the consistent service and standards. So when I was looking for a spot in NYC, choosing Best Western felt like a safe bet. Sadly it did not turn out to be the case. The location is great. When the taxi pulled up the doorman tried to chase him away (i was still in the taxi)...he then turned around, didn't welcome me or offer to help with my bags. I was welcomed fine at reception and even though I was early and happy to store my luggage I was offered a room. It was tiny, but okay. However, the room was next to the elevator which rattled and banged against my wall the entire night. A tap in the bathroom ran the whole night. I called during the night begging to be helped. the person who answered the phone was sympathetic and said they would change me the next day. However, the next day I was treated like a pariah and like a second-class citizen, no apology. I was sent to another room which was again on top of the lift lobby, but luckily not next to the actual elevator shaft. I am a journalist and seriously considering taking this further. Oh yeah, the room was also dirty, not good. Wi-fi was down the entire day.

Reviews.Title: “Good for the self-sufficient traveler”
Reviews.Author: mandyb321
Reviews.Content: As the other reviews state, the rooms are extremely small and basic but clean with a unique aesthetic. Great location if you want or don't mind the chaos of Times Square. If you are a self-sufficient traveler who simply needs a place to sleep at night this is the perfect place for you, but if you're hoping for a helpful and accommodating staff I'm not sure you'll find it here. During both check-in and check-out the front desk staff acted cold and impersonal, and in my entire weekend stay neither a concierge nor a bellhop could be found. But then again, if you know where you're going and can hail your own cabs then this isn't a problem at all. All in all, a fine place to stay but don't expect them to roll out the red carpet. Quick note if you're booking on Priceline and hope to request a specific room type (such as 2 beds or a specific bed size) -- there will likely be an extra charge for the upgrade or change.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Corinna_5821
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel at the beginning of April for 5 nights. When we arrived check in was easy and we had no troubles. The room we had, however, was very small. Just about enough room for the bed, 2 suitcases and 2 people. For the price we paid we weren't going to be complaining though, as the location is excellent. Right in the centre of everything! I think that is the most important factor, after all you don't go to New York to sit in your hotel room! Even though the room was small, it was clean and well kept. When we were in New York the weather was quite cold, but our room here was always warm - no heating troubles here. This hotel has pay internet in the basement and it was quite good, we experienced no problems with slow internet or computers that kept freezing. Overall this was a great place to stay with no major flaws. We would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “An average experience with friendly staff, small but stylish rooms but not totally clean and a bit noisy”
Reviews.Author: jetlag83
Reviews.Content: We spent 5 nights in May 2011 in this hotel. Location: The hotel is centrally located and is very close to subway, broadway and times square. Also many restaurants and an amish supermarket are located close by. Staff: The staff is very friendly and helpful, nothing to complain about at all. Room: The guest room has a certain design attitude, but looked a bit lived up and not totally clean, e.g. stains on the bed cover or hair in the bathroom after it was cleaned. It was also rather small, with a french bed. The room itself was quite noisy, and the AC was super loud. Coffe machine and free coffee was supplied every day. There is a Safe in the room. Free wifi is offered, access code is handed over without request on checkin. Conclusio: This hote is a good pick, if you are looking for a hotel in a central location and intent to spend most time on the town, not on your room. If you do not care about total cleanliness and do not want to spend a lot of money for your stay, to me this is a good value-for-money pick.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is still very ok”
Reviews.Author: bbb05
Reviews.Content: Rather small room as you can expect at this rate in Manhattan, but very good value for the price if you appreciate the location 48 Str - Broadway

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - Small Rooms”
Reviews.Author: Clinchx
Reviews.Content: Overall we had a good time during our stay at the President Hotel. The decor throughout is pretty fun. Very modern and cool. The staff were very friendly and the concierge really helped us on the first day. They have a great Japanese or Korean restaurant onsite. Very authentic food. We had reservations at the Hilton in Hasbrouck Heights (see my review). After one night we switched to this hotel. It is right on Times Square at 48th & 8th. In the heart of the action. The one bad experience was that the first room they gave us had a dead mouse right inside the door. They apologized profusely, comped our meals for the rest of the trip and gave us a new room. I was satisfied. I guess the other thing is that the window A/C unit was very noisy which made it hard to sleep. But I didn't come to the Big Apple to sleep!!!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Location, Funky Decor, Great Value, Room was Poorly Cleaned/Dirty”
Reviews.Author: annilizzi
Reviews.Content: This hotel has an AWESOME location - just a block from Time Square action. Also, plenty of great restaurants right outside the door. The hotel's decor was fun and funky! I loved it! Customer service over the phone was rude, but in person was fine - hotel staff was nice and helpful. My only issue was that our room was dirty. Stains on the decorative pillows and the walls. Under the bed, and desk, and side tables hadn't been vacuumed. I mean, it wasn't unlivable and it wasn't disgusting, it was mostly disappointing. Overall, it was fine.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded My Expectations!”
Reviews.Author: onedumgoy
Reviews.Content: I normally stay away from booking Best Western properties as I have found them to be very inconsistent.
