It was with a bit of trepidation when I pulled the trigger on this one for 2 nights, but I must say that I was pleasantly surprised! Lots of good things here and in an intimate boutique style atmosphere with a superb location. The good stuff is: good powerful a/c, great location, room is super clean and updated, easy access in and out, nice and helpful staff. The only negatives are: tiny room and the decor was Warhol versus Peter Max. As far as the room size, I am 6 ft 200 lbs and there was barely enough room for me. The bed itself almost runs from wall to wall, so not much room to play half court basketball. If there are two of you, you might want to consider upgrading to a larger room, unless you REALLY enjoy each other's company. The rooms are fully updated with a flat screen TV, coffee maker, and a good shower. I had an inside facing room and it was quiet. Breakfast is pricey, head on down the street for less expensive options with the local commuters. Elevators are tiny so pick a lower floor and take the stairs to avoid claustrophobia. Overall, one of the better choices in NYC!

Reviews.Title: “Very accommodating. Short Trip, but found everything to be nice.”
Reviews.Author: dijon1997
Reviews.Content: Located in great area for walking to everything. Nice people worked there and were extremely pleasant. Manager was delightful, friendly and the staff was very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Was a great value when I stayed”
Reviews.Author: APS7
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in 2004 and for about $140/night including taxes. I had been to NYC about 4 times that year and this was by far the best value. I was attending a conference in Times Square and I had a leg injury so I needed someplace walking distance. This hotel was much better than I expected for the price. The room was large, huge by NYC standards, and very clean. I realise things may have changed and we may have been lucky with our room and the rate was really awesome. But this hotel would still be one I'd check rates at if I were looking for a room in NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, great hotel”
Reviews.Author: thomfre
Reviews.Content: Small room, but big enough and very clean. Perfect location, almost right in the middle of Times Square. Not much noise, so sleeping is no problem.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel.”
Reviews.Author: sunshine2107
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on business for 5 nights. Positives were: Location - right in Times Square, loads of subways, and 20 minutes easy walk to the JAVITS centre. Free wifi that was super quick, good enough to skype video call back to the UK, with easy login. Lovely decor both in the rooms and throughout the hotel. Enough toys in the room - AC, TV, Ipod dock, etc. Bathroom was a little on the small side but good enough. Hotel staff on the whole were friendly and helpful in directions, organising cars etc. Cash machine in the hotel. A changing room would be helpful for international travellers when doing the check out / fly 10 hours later' freshen up. Will definitely use for all further NY travel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay-Great Location-Great Service”
Reviews.Author: minpin02
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the BW President, first time on April 26th. It was a great experience the room was clean and well decorated, the breakfast was "as if I had cooked it myself" and the bell staff was helpful with my heavy load. I would recommend to anyone. I am currently trying to get a friend to stay there in August. I work in the hospitality industry and I can notice things other do not. It is now my place for future stays.

Reviews.Title: “I WANT TO LIVE IN NEW YORK!”
Reviews.Author: christinawitmyer
Reviews.Content: Loved my trip to New York!! Would return and stay here again. We arrived during Easter week a very busy time. The hotel was not perfect but the location made up for all the discomforts. I would rate us as demanding clients. Because of that we really put the staff the hotel to the test. We actually went to celebrate our four birthdays. Mine, my husband, my son and daughter in law. We arrived at the hotel and they had no idea who we were but then of course they found us. My husband had arranged ahead to have gifts and decorations in the room and the hotel staff did a great job setting it up for him which made it comical they did not know about our reservation. The doorman as many have said was wonderful and knowledgable. I would call ahead once you arrive to New York to confirm your accommodations. We had two rooms during our stay. The concierge was an amazing help to us for all sorts of info but make sure you check their hours. We had the suite the first half of the stay which was really nice although it looked like someone had a fight with the bath room door. Beds were nice and clean. Walls were less desirable. Internet did not work all four nights. But Starbucks was close. There were broken outlets. TV had a big line through it but we weren't there to watch TV. Did not give enough towels and wash cloths for four people but did not make us wait and sent someone immediately to provide the proper towels. Breakfast too expensive but there is a Starbucks and Jamba Juice very close. Had a street view which I loved. I loved the New York sounds so this wonderful for us. It was pouring rain when we got there. I had an umbrella but the kids didn't. Thankfully the staff allowed us to borrow an umbrella until we bought another one. They don't usually loan out umbrellas but it was nice regardless. We went shopping at midnight in the rain and had the best time!! When the kids left we moved to a room that was a closet. It was awful but again the concierge came to the rescue and moved us a few doors down with the window view as requested and it was extremely nice. Internet worked the rest of our stay. Every discomfort we had they dealt with immediately and kindly. But again we are sort of demanding. The location was very close to Times Square which was a wonderful surprise. We walked everywhere from our hotel. Great location!! WE would stay again!!

Reviews.Title: “Good Business Hotel - Good Value”
Reviews.Author: MQuinn65
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed in one of the Junior Suites. It offered a little more room since I was meeting clients during the week. The lobby areas were very modern and special. Clean floors, polished marble etc. The staff was friendly and attentive, and just as importantly they all seamed to know the area. Being in a suite, it had a little sitting room separated area. Flat screen TV , desk, large couch. The bathroom was fantastic. Large bathtub, plenty of water pressure etc.. The proximity to the midtown business centers and Rockefeller Plaza was perfect. There were many choices of restaurants to choose from. I enjoyed the workout facility, it was modest but clean and plenty for me to do. The Wi-FI was free, it worked fine. I would recommend this hotel to other business travelers, I saved well over $75 per day. Well worth it.

Reviews.Title: “A bargain in the Big City!”
Reviews.Author: tproctor
Reviews.Content: The hotel is nice... with a few flaws. The lobby is beautiful and the staff is friendly and helpful. Rooms, while small, are clean and comfortable. Nice Panasonic flatscreen TV hanging on the wall! The location is awesome, one half block to Times Square, a block or two to Restaurant Row, a block or two to the subway. Breakfast is $14.95, but there is an in room coffee maker. Safe in the closet. I enjoyed my stay here and would stay again. One downside is the speed of the "high speed" internet. VERY slow... dial up speed.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: fremantlevisitor
Reviews.Content: Rooms small but clean, bed very comfortable. Wish we could have had a small fridge. staff helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Not so good!”
Reviews.Author: Oslohawk
Reviews.Content: Small and hot rooms, very noisy in the room. Impersonal service, and yoy feal that it is a sleeping factory. We was not impressed, The Doorman was very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “A great deal in the heart of Times Square”
Reviews.Author: molecular_4u
Reviews.Content: This hotel is excellent. It was clean and had no bed bugs. There was a mix up with the booking and the front counter staff (cory) was sensational and simply organised replacement rooms of a higher standard than was booked and also included a complimentary breakfast for each day of our stay. I would highly recommend this hotel as being of great value in the heart of new yorks theatre district. Give them a try you won't be disappointed..

Reviews.Title: “Fun hotel great staff”
Reviews.Author: Jsmith224
Reviews.Content: I had a great stay at this hotel the front desk and housekeeping staff were great. I wish I could remember there names and also the front desk manager was great he gave us a queen bed room upgrade. I would recommend this hotel to any traveler looking for a great hotel with resonable rates.

Reviews.Title: “Welcome to New York City”
Reviews.Author: BennyH45
Reviews.Content: Welcome to New York City I often work late in New York City and need a place in Midtown. The price is right and the place is clean and comfortable. The staff was warm and friendly. The hotel is centrally located near the subway and an easy walk to most midtown offices. I would recommend this hotel for the price and location. The internet is free. There are plenty of places to get a bite to eat in the are, the hard part is to decide what to eat. Enjoy

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel lacation "Love the decor"”
Reviews.Author: Mikeyhq
Reviews.Content: I love this hotel the location is perfect we could walk to all the shops and we even saw ben stiller on the first night we were in new york right in fromt of the hotel!! The front staff were very warm and welcoming and they were able to get me in my room at noon when check in time wasnt till later. I saw the new play book of morman while we were there and it was very fiunny ( thank you creaters of south park). I will be back in the US and new york in august and will be staying here again. Until then i bid you all a fairwell and thank you to the President hotel for making my stay wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “good tourist location, bad internet service - disappointing”
Reviews.Author: onthemove17
Reviews.Content: the rooms are clean, bright, functional although not decorated to my taste. the internet did not work at all during my 4 day stay despite calls to front desk and then I was referred to dial out to best western internet help desk. then call back to front desk for a password. Saigon restaurant next door -- had very disappointing meal there.

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT ENTER!”
Reviews.Author: yaloveit
Reviews.Content: Let me start off with the only good thing about this hotel. And that is the location. It was dead set in the middle of everything. No cabs needed! Now, as for everything else, I dont have ANYTHING good to say. Service was garbage. The room was smaller than anything I've ever seen before. Which I know is typical for a NYC hotels, but this was crazy. You walk in, and there's your bed. A tiny bathroom with no tub, just a standup shower. Elevator was down for most of the weekend. The decor was gross. When I read the review on their website, it said they just went through a $15 million renovation. That's physically impossible because I've stayed in the middle of no where and seen better renovations. The hallway was dark and purple with no lighting ( looked like a porno shoot) and stupid room service carts all over the place the WHOLE time. There arent any noise barriers either. I'll leave that to your imagination. When you see the photos of the hotel, it looks very art deco and pretty. The only nice thing about this hotel was the lobby and thats when it ends. So just do more research. DON'T STAY HERE!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, but disappointing Staff”
Reviews.Author: em2602
Reviews.Content: The hotel had a great location, right next to Times Square and only down the road from Central Park and other attractions such as the Empire State Building, New York Public Library and Grand Central Station are in walking distance. Our room was very small and many of the amenities that the hotel website claims the room to have were not provided. We were also situated next to what must have been a smoking room, and the smell often found its way into our room, something that I wasn't too comfortable about. The lobby in itself was beautifully decorated, but there was often other people's rubbish left around the seating area and most of the lobby floor space was taken up by "stored" luggage from holidaymakers who were leaving on that day. Most disappointing, in my opinion, was the service I received from the Front Desk staff. Although there always seemed to be a different person at the desk, it was rare to find someone who was not rude and uninterested. I feel that I was not provided with adequate information, for example, when check-out time was, which meant I was charged $100 for checking out 30mins late, after house-keeping had been holding up the room and preventing us from packing. Worse still is that we were not informed of this charge ("just try and check out as soon as possible" when we told them about house-keeping) and only realised what had happened when we returned to England and found $100 missing from our bank account. We are currently taking this up with Best Western Customer Service, but feel it displays the lack of communication that the staff wish to have between themselves and the customers. I felt that some of the staff were eager to converse with friends/fellow employees at the bar or desk, and that when they did listen they came across as snotty and patronising, I feel that the staff at the Best Western made our stay at the hotel significantly less comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Great Day in NYC”
Reviews.Author: AndreaV11
Reviews.Content: Wow!! What A Great Value. The Front Desk staff are very professional both for check in & out. Kudos to the 2 FD staff that helped me arrive & depart feeling like I belonged and mattered to their hotel. I had a wonderful opportunity to meet with the General Manager, he exudes the commitment, determination, and genuine concern for the daily day to day of the hotel. In my opinion this says a lot about how each guest is truly appreciated and thought of.! The rm I had the pleasure of staying in had a balcony view of Times Square, which was breathtaking both in the day to get a breath of fresh air and in the evening just to sit back and take in the whole experience. The decor is great boutique design... something like "Alice in Wonderland" meets "Modern Chic" with a Presidential flair, bright in color which is very soothing and energizing. I shared some photos with friends and we all plan to stay here for our visits to NY. ***Sincerely, Andrea V

Reviews.Title: “Not up to the mark; avoid if you can”
Reviews.Author: vagabond0074
Reviews.Content: Apart from a superb location this hotel is not worth a second visit. Rude bellhops(hotel employee to assist you with your luggage) who cannot hold open the main door for you when you are struggling with 4 suitcases, unfriendly front desk staff who cannot give proper directions to nearby attractions, unclean rooms at check in including soiled shower caps tucked inside the bed covers was how I started my stay at this place. Although Best western Platinum Elite member, I was offered one of the most lousy rooms which was extremely small, no decent view and was not clean. Phone calls to my room from outside were not patched through as front desk does not bother to answer the phone when they are busy and people calling from outside cannot directly dial your room number; they have to go through the front desk!! A package that was sent to me from Maryland was kept at the front desk and repeated enquires about the arrival of the package from one of the Best Western Hotels in Maryland where I had stayed earlier was met with a standard response that no mail was received on my name. Repeated calls and multiple inquires finally led to the package being "discovered". During check out repeated calls to front desk to request a bellhop to carry the luggage down was necessary. The staff was unhelpful, uncooperative, rude and some of them were probably not fit to be in a hospitality business. I have communicated with customer care of Best Western who are normally very prompt and responsive to address this issue. Although a Best Western Platinum Elite member and having stayed at 3 Best Western locations in 15 days, I felt that it is very difficult to avail some of the elusive privileges like "free upgrade", "late check out" and "better room allocation" that are promised on their website.

Reviews.Title: “Great Way to Celebrate 25th Wedding Anniversary"”
Reviews.Author: wulfpak
Reviews.Content: Had a wonderful experience at this Hotel. Great location - near everything. All hotel personnel extremely helpful and friendly. Would definitely stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel.. really small room”
Reviews.Author: kaps_77
Reviews.Content: We booked the hotel on the day of travel using an App on my iphone. Got a very good rate of under one hundred twenty dollars. Reached the hotel and check in was super easy. The lobby is good.. looks like it was recently updated. They validate parking which gets you a cheaper rate, but make sure you are going to the right parking lot. The parking lot is half a block away from the hotel. We only stayed for one day. Reached around 4pm, check in took 5 minutes. The room was nice and clean, but really really small. You have to set your expectations right. Since we were there for only a day, we did not care that much about the size. The bathroom was really small too with a small tub for shower. The AC was a little noisy and the room had some street noise too, but nothing out of the ordinary for Times square hotels. The bed was a comfy but small (again the room was tiny) I am attaching pictures of the room too. I believe it was about 100 sqft. The hotel is so close to times square. Only a block from the action. We requested a late checkout the next day and out check-out time was extended till 1 PM. Again great staff we checked out at 1 PM, went to the busy lobby and wanted to keep our luggage at Concierge and had no problem with that. It was just one dollar per bag, which is the cheapest i have ever seen in NYC. We wanted to see a Broadway show and right opposite the hotel is one of the theaters. One and half block away is the half price ticket "TKTS" counter too. So it is very convenient for theater trips Good hotel.. clean and nice staff. If you are ok with super small rooms, this is a good option. Since we got the room for cheap on the last day, it was great for us.

Reviews.Title: “Very trendy”
Reviews.Author: AFau21
Reviews.Content: I loved this hotel. Awesome location, rooms and all hotel was beautiful. I have no complaint. I really recommand this place.

Reviews.Title: “Small, but an awesome location”
Reviews.Author: Titanstasis
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the President Hotel for 5 nights in total. I went on a girlie trip with one of my friends and from the pictures this looked like a beautiful place to stay. We upgraded to a Queen deluxe room & it wasn't a disappointment. It was well decorated, very modern and clean. The only drawback was that the rooms were very small, however its pretty much on top of times square so obviously space is at a premium. The broadband wireless network was unusable as it dropped out every 5 seconds but it wasn't essential for me to be online at any stage. I would definitely stay here again as the staff were friendly and helpful and the room was maintained to an excellent standard.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful interior design, fantastic location and really nice staff!”
Reviews.Author: IrishPotato25
Reviews.Content: Myself and my sister stayed in this hotel for 5 nights while site-seeing and shopping in New York. This hotel is on 48th street placing in just a few feet from the beautiful Times Square. The room was clean and comfortable. The staff were more than helpful and very friendly. The hotel itself is very funky and contemporary in style and the presidents of America theme throughout added to our already amazing trip to New York. I have already recommended this hotel to my other sister and my friends who are planning to take a trip to New York. This location means that you will be in the centre of everything. We literally just had to cross the street under the Crowne Plaza car park to go see Chicago (the broadway show). Public transport and taxis and realily available. Here you will be close to broadway, restauants, all the amazing shops, souvenier shops and everything that a tourist desires from a destination. The houskeeping staff were great. The maintainance guy helped us sort out our European adapters. The staff at reception were lovely.We chose a smoking room because we are both smokers. But smoking and non smoking options are both available. I just thought it was great to have a smoking room option because many hotels in NYC have a complete non- smoking policy throughout their building. This hotel was ment to be 3 star. I'd rate it as definately 4 if not more! Our hotel room for 5 nights for two people came to $1090 which converted to about 800EURO when charged to our credit card. Thanks Best Western President Hotel Times Square, if we return to New York, we would definately stay here and will consider other Best Western Hotels worldwide if we are travelling elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic stay. Lovely and perfect…”
Reviews.Author: DrL45
Reviews.Content: Lovely trip with my daughter. We celebrated her 18th birthday with a bit of shopping. Hotel location was centralized and we felt very safe. Nice quarters and staff. Plenty of good restaraunts to choose from in the area. The metro was nearby which led to all major attractions. We are sure to be visiting again for many years to come.

Reviews.Title: “Plus! Plus what?”
Reviews.Author: GoSD
Reviews.Content: Is this what the Plus in Best Western means? Here's what we found. The night stand had water damage PLUS there were no washcloths in the bathroom PLUS the safe didn't work PLUS the knobs on the sink both read 'cold' PLUS there was no handle on the shower door PLUS the blow dryer didn't work. Called the front desk twice and still didn't get one. Really? PLUS?

Reviews.Title: “Great Times Square Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Theatergeek101
Reviews.Content: I stay at the BW President almost everytime I come to see theater. It has a great location and generally the price is right. For what I enjoy, seeing Broadway and off Broadway shows you couldn't ask for a better location. During the day I spend my time visiting museums, galleries and other such cultural activities. Again, the location is great. Of course, the rooms are small, This is Manhattan for gosh sake and besides, I'm not here to spend time relaxing in a spa like atmosphere. I am out and about enjoying everything that the Big Apple has to offer. The redecorating is interesting. I am glad they have updated the decor and turned the President into a botique hotel. I've never slept with Jack and Jackie O before! The staff always seems to go out of their way to accomodate my needs. Check-in and Check-out are both a breeze. I constantly recommend the President to friends contemplating visits to New York. Thank you for making my stays pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “trendy little gem.”
Reviews.Author: cazb85
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel in December 2010. We moved from another run down hotel to the best western and it was much better, rooms are tiny tiny! but beautifully decorated and very trendy door men and luggage guys were so friendly and helpful! more so than the receptionists. but really who cares your in New York, if your in your room for more than sleeping time you shouldnt even come to this fantastic city!. Location was fantastic walking distance to EVERYTHING.!! p.s one warning: dont use the internet room. it ate $14 dollards of mine! but on a whole great Hotel. Great location!

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel, great value, great location”
Reviews.Author: Sheila89
Reviews.Content: Perfectly located close to all transportation and within walking distance of many key sites of the city, this little hotel is a gem. We stayed four nights and the rates were better than anything comparable in the same area. Staff were most helpful, plenty of space for clothes etc and good TV. Lots of good restaurants close by too.

Reviews.Title: “cool place great location”
Reviews.Author: beachhousenow
Reviews.Content: The room was very small and old looking, but it was fairly clean and the price was right. The only warning I have about this place is that if you need internet the internet they provide is very, very bad. It cuts out and works around dial up speed the rest of the time bring a wireless enabled laptop or something becuase if you need reliable internet they do not have it here.

Reviews.Title: “Best location and cozy hotel”
Reviews.Author: vio073
Reviews.Content: Very clean hotel, staff is really nice and happy to help. Located in the heart of Time Square, great restaurents and night live around the corner.

Reviews.Title: “Ok, but will stay somewhere else next time”
Reviews.Author: SLWNovaScotia_Canada
Reviews.Content: My husband & I stayed here for 2 nights in March. The Hotel is in a good central location, but the area is very noisey. There is a fire sattion on one corner and it seems the garbage trucks collect all night long. A higher floor may be better, but found it very difficult to sleep. The room we had was a suite and not really large for a suite but it was clean and bed bug FREE. The hall on our floor was always very cluttered with garbage bags, vacuum cleaner, laundry carts etc. I was cold when we came back from an afternoon of sight seeing, tried to get the heat to work and it wouldn't. When I mentioned it to the front desk people they informed me that the heat only comes on if the temperature falls below 40 degrees. To me that is getting pretty cold, I like my heat to click in if it falls below 60 degrees. Wanted to print our boarding passes, was told to go to a place in the basement, it costs $5 for 20 minutes and the computers are so slow, you will be lucky if you can get it done in 20 minutes, the printer wouldn't work and the letters are pretty well all off the key board, so unless you are a typist and know where all the letters are on the keyboard, good luck. I asked for help 3 times, because the printer wouldn't work, the first 2 people told me to go back up stairs, the third said someone will be here in a few minutes, well I only have 20 minutes before I need to put in another $5. No one ever showed up, my time ran out and I wasn't about to put anymore money in the thing. When I went upsairs to find out where the guy was that was going to fix the printer, they finally agreed to let me print from the front desk, but those keyboards also had most of the letters missing. Some of the staff were very friendly, others really seemed like I was bothering them. So if you don't mind noise and cluttered halls this is probably an OK place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “luxury and value on 48th St.”
Reviews.Author: river96
Reviews.Content: The Best Western Presidential Hotel has a prime location. It is within walking distance of Lincoln Center, the Museum of Modern Art, the gallery district in Chelsea and Times Square center. It is near theaters and first class restaurants Its lobby and rooms are stylish and comfortable. The staff is friendly. This is a well-managed, sophisticated hotel, which helps provide a great New York City experience.

Reviews.Title: “The location, cleanliness and excellent service of this hotel was beyond what I expected!”
Reviews.Author: Annette59_3
Reviews.Content: We went for an overnight visit to New York city, and this hotel was an excellent choice. Clean, friendly staff, and to be just steps from Times Square made our stay very enjoyable! I was mesmerized by the beautiful aquarium behind the reservation desk. We have already suggested to many friends and family, that if they go to N.Y., this was the place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “If on business, avoid at any cost.”
Reviews.Author: MisterMikeSeattle
Reviews.Content: For the price, this is easily one of the dirtiest, most cramped, gaudiest Manhattan hotels I've ever stayed in. And lousy for trying to do business in - no desk, no space. It's kind of an upscale hostel. Sure, it's a great location off Times Square - it'd probably be ideal for a large group on an all-day, all-night tour since they wouldn't (thankfully) need to be in their rooms. The only good thing is the staff - the staff was great.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff, awful wi-fi connection, prescription drugs stolen.”
Reviews.Author: Tecleski
Reviews.Content: The good: The staff. The manager and the people at the desk (William, Suny, and Tricia) were kind and helpful and with that they made up for what I tell in the " the ugly" part written below. Breakfast at the hotel is good and both restaurants associated to the hotel are fine and with good prices, specially Aoki. The room was very clean. For people wanting to be close to Times Sq. and the Theater District, the hotel's location is perfect. I don't like Times Square, at all. I'd have picked a hotel far from there but my client chose the hotel for me. The bad: The decor is tacky, to say the least. A lamp/bust of George Washington? Come on! Pictures of Jackie O and JFK? The room was on the small side, but it seems that most hotel rooms in NYC are like that.The AC's controls didn't work, same for most of the functions of the TV remote. The wi-fi is so crappy that they shouldn't dare to advertise that they have wi-fi. When it works, the speed is what you got with dial-up connections ten years ago. The hotel should make a serious investment in increasing bandwidth. I could look the other way in regard to the tacky decor, but not to the lousy internet connection. The ugly: I have to take a pill for the proper functioning of my thyroid gland every morning, so I brought with me the amount of pills needed for the whole of my stay in the U.S. The first morning I took one pill and left the rest on the bathroom shelf. The next morning, I noticed that they were gone. Yes, GONE! Someone had stolen the pills from my room. The hotel manager assured me that the housekeeper had been with them for twenty years, and that it was pretty impossible that she had any involvement in the " misplacement" of the pills. Anyway, anyone familiar with how things work in the U.S knows that it is impossible to get prescription drugs without a prescription filled out by a doctor with a license to practice for the state you are buying the drug in. It seems that because of that, there's a huge black market for drugs. I couldn't take the pill for over a week. In the end, the hotel manager found a pharmacy chain that provides a walk-in doctor service where I could get a prescription, but for that I had to ask my personal doctor to fill out a prescription, scan it, and then send it to me, and the appointment cost me over USD 100, plus the cost of the drug. I have to say, the manager was very helpful and I ended up having breakfast six times at the hotel for free ($100 worth). So, beware, keep your prescription drugs in the safe box at all times. That applies not just for the President Hotel, but for all hotels in the U.S.

Reviews.Title: “Bell Man went above and beyond”
Reviews.Author: CherrySlurpees
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for just one night on our return from Europe (our flight from Ireland arrived too late for us to catch a flight to the west coast-ish). Having used BW Status Match , I received Platinum status and was upgraded to a very nice size room that accommodated 2 adults and 2 children quite comfortably. It was cleverly decorated and the bed was very comfortable. But the pillows? The pillows were amazing! The front desk staff was thorough upon check in and check out. They were personable and quick to fill my request of some photocopies. The bellman went above and beyond. When he couldn't hail me a cab on the street he walked to the nearest corner and hailed me a cab in the freezing cold. Though I wouldn't normally pay this per night right for a hotel (I don't think the price is high for the area, I'm just frugal), the proximity to Shake Shack and the superior customer service made this hotel well worth what we paid.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: doc038
Reviews.Content: The location is terrific . I stayed here about 40 days in the last year and a half. Sunny, Trish,and the young men at the front desk are terrific.Only one complaint---the bath tubs could use rubber mats. They are very slippery

Reviews.Title: “Business and Pleasure Nice Trip”
Reviews.Author: Pete33Tvl
Reviews.Content: I spent 5 days here in February during my stay in New York City. After reading hotels about how the hotel was small and the service issues.... Well as far as New Yorkers go the staff was great. The hotel is 15 stories, the bedroom was small although I declined the $50 upgrade offered on check in. I was most impressed, and with the proximity of Times Square, literally steps away. The doormen were great in getting a taxi for me rather than I going outside in the snow and doing it myself. Little touches like that make it a much more enjoyable. Beds were very comfortable. Loads of restaurants int he area.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best around”
Reviews.Author: rherbold
Reviews.Content: I travel on business a lot and spend lots off time in Manhattan. I am a real estate engineer consultant and travel on my own dime. The President BW is great ... the staff is wonderful. The General Manager is great. Walk out the front door and you are there - right in Times Square. Take in a play ... you are there. Go out to eat ... you are there. Go to a deli or pick up a soda and bag of chips at a local store ... right next door. Eat out ... dozens of restaurants right there, including three next door. Rooms are modern and super clean. Lobby is super-modern. Hallways and corridors are little dark ... so? Who lives in a hallway. And ... the price is right. Need a cab .... you can shoot up town and downtown in minutes from 8th Ave and West 48th. Plus .... you can walk to Amtrak in Penn Station. Jogger ? run up 8th Ave to Central Park ... run around. Why is the hotel called The President BW? .... photos, decorations, pillows with Presidents faces everywhere. Why? Simple. The owners love the good old USA and say it by the interior decorating. Want a bigger hotel lobby .... just walk around the corner to the big hotels and use the lobby facilities. Is there a negative? Hmmmm. Maybe leaving the cleaning vacuums in the elevator lobbies? Maybe the hallways are a little dark. That's about it. And, just sit in the lobby and listen - a dozen conversations in a dozen languages may be happening around you. Pretty cool - a World Class hotel. Ohhh ... did I mention. The price is right.

Reviews.Title: “Great location with the best front desk service.”
Reviews.Author: birkin40
Reviews.Content: Sunny at the front desk always takes care of me. She is the best. The hotel is located just steps from Time Square and Saks Fifth Avenue.

Reviews.Title: “Great location to stay for a Broadway show.”
Reviews.Author: todd_richert
Reviews.Content: When you compare all the hotels close to Times Square, this is the most reasonably priced. If you drive to the city, there is a lot across the street. The room was small, but very clean and the bed was very comfortable. The WiFi was the only complaint I have. It wasn't worth using. We arrived around 1pm and we got right into our room. Very happy and I'd stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great staff, very unique”
Reviews.Author: SGreene1981
Reviews.Content: Check in/out was a breeze, room was clean, Hotel staff were friendly, great location, themed,unique and stylish,local transportation not a problem, relaxing nightlife enviornment, hotel its self is a eyepleaser.

Reviews.Title: “Small, hot and uncomfortable”
Reviews.Author: emmat23Woking
Reviews.Content: I visited New York with some friends for a long weekend. When we arrived at the hotel the doorman only helped once we had struggled with our cases from the taxi and got into the hotel- he stood and watched before hand. When we checked in they took a swipe of my credit card neglecting to mention they would be taking the full bill then. We had made it clear the bill was being split. As a result of this the trip was virtually ruined due to the bank placing a stop on the card. We had a 'deluxe suite' if you could call it that. The bathroom was tiny. On the site it said there would be a mini bar and a bath. We had neither. You also have to pay a charge for the safe which they don't mention. The wifi was awful when it would actually work. The hotel was really hot and the room controls didn't work to call it down. There is a fire station at the end of the block which was really noisy. The folder in room said we could order breakfast for room service but there was no number. When we called reception there wasn't anyone who could speak English let alone know about room service. Concierge were also rude and unhelpful. The only thing to redeem the hotel is the great location.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect stay!”
Reviews.Author: NatalieS190502
Reviews.Content: Even though we did not spend much time at our room, we enjoyed every minute that we DID spend there! Much space (we had a suite), with nice furnitures. The room was clean! A trendy, but still quiet and classic hotel. With a PERFECT location!

Reviews.Title: “Great location - renovated”
Reviews.Author: 2Euro-Travellers
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights at the Best Western President Hotel in May 2010 and we have to say that this is place is all about the location. You step out of the hotel and you are right at Times Square (not even a 5 min. walk). The decoration is modern, but a little bit too pink and kitsch for me. The service was quick and effecient. The rooms are very small and we found the room to be very hot. We informed the reception and maintenance came immediately to fix it, although it remained very hot. The walls are quite thin too and you can easily hear your neighbours. All in all I would recommend this hotel for its location. + great location next to Times Square, newly designed clean rooms - very small sized rooms with unefficient airconditioning, thin walls

Reviews.Title: “Amazing :)”
Reviews.Author: daniela1990
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Best Western from the 9th January until The 14th. When we pulled up outside the hotel you could see the lights and buzz of the M&M store and times square literally 30seconds away. The location could not have been better. Checking in was fast and we would like to really thank the Manager Jay Dean for upgrading us to a suite. We arrived at about 1pm, 2 hours early for check in but only had to wait 15mins until the cleaners had finished with our room. The room was huge with a massive bed, sitting area, tv on the wall and great bathroom with jaquzzi. The bus stop for the tours is just around the corner as is the TKTS booth and all your amaizng restaurants and shops on Times square. The door men were always on hand to open the doors and greet us when leaving and entering the hotel. Our holiday really was amazing. There is a tourist information counter with leaflets and information on anything you want to know and on our second last night we saw that they did bus runs to the airport so we booked one which cost us $27 each which we thought was a good deal and saved us with the waiting about on the day of departure as we were able to do our last minute shopping and get picked up at the hotel. We would definetly recommend this hotel and would like to thank the managers and staff again for our great holiday and we will be back :)

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Stay in New York”
Reviews.Author: brinkley2011
Reviews.Content: We had a very pleasant experience at the Best Western President Hotel. The room was comfortable. We had a broken iron but the problem was remedied by housekeeping. The wireless was slow but worked. Suny, at the front desk, was absolutely fantastic. She was friendly and went out of her way to be helpful - providing us directions, suggestions etc. Due to bad weather our flights were canceled and Suny worked to acommodate us with our reservation rate. - The location is great - close to everything. I would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Best for location and value!”
Reviews.Author: shonapona
Reviews.Content: We have just spent 10 night at the hotel and it was perfect for our needs. Location wise, we love being in the hub of Manhatten and walked to battery park and to beyond central park. The room wasn't huge but we were comfortable. Our only complaint was the heat! NYC was cold during our visit ( we are from Scotland and are used to the cold) but even sleeping in shorts and vests and with the window wide open the heat was intense! We were offered another room but all the guests said the same so we didn't bother. We would highly recommend it and would definitely return. Watch out for the added taxes though roughly 17$ per day!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, newly renovated, and great staff”
Reviews.Author: Lee22923
Reviews.Content: Great location on 48th and 8th. Two blocks to Times Square and within 4 to 6 blocks of most plays. The rooms and lobby have recently been renovated. WiFi in the rooms for free. Within walking distance to restaurants and bars. Great Value of a Hotel. Will stay there very often. .

Reviews.Title: “excellent hotel for the price!”
Reviews.Author: daisygirl2234
Reviews.Content: If you want luxurious rooms this is not the place but for the price it was in an excellent locale the price was right and it was clean. What more do you want

Reviews.Title: “Poor service”
Reviews.Author: georgecan
Reviews.Content: Good hotel the location is good , the rooms are well kept. I was over charge by the transportation company that the lady at the front desk gave us , I found out that its only $55 going to Jfk on a taxi ,she charge us $75 , when i came back the following week I confronted her about the charges and told me that she will upgarde me to a suite.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and price”
Reviews.Author: f365er
Reviews.Content: We loved it here! The location, staff and price were all fantastic. We were literally 90 seconds away from Times Square. The staff was extremely helpful right from the beginning of our trip when we contacted them. We arrived very early (10am) and our room was ready, the concierge was very helpful also with some great recommendations. If you are looking for something close to Times Square within a budget, I strongly recommend this hotel for your staff. If we return to NYC we will for sure consider this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “We stay at your property every January...my parents and my children. We love your staff, location, etc. Thank you! :)”
Reviews.Author: daughtry2007
Reviews.Content: My parents, children and I stay at your property every January. We love the staff, the location, the price, etc. Thanks for all that you do! :)

Reviews.Title: “Do you want to experience NY on the luxury way?”
Reviews.Author: Jenny2207
Reviews.Content: I stayed only one night at the Best Western Presidents Hotel at Times Square, but it was a great experience. Once you enter the lobby of the hotel, you think you entered an other world. Everthing is so shiny and glamerous, just like what you imagine a "Presidents Hotel" would be. The check in was very friendly, they even help you carry your luggage upstairs or just call the elevator. The rooms are big, white and have an awesome flatscreen TV. The beds are very compfy and the bathroom looks great, too. I would recommend this hotel to everybody who wants to spend a great time in NY, doesn't want to waste time to get to Times Square and likes to have a little glamour. Even it's directly at Times Square, in the middle of the city, it's not too loud or noisy.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, perfect location, good rooms”
Reviews.Author: AmsterdamSquirrel
Reviews.Content: Great located, around the corner of Times Square. Good size rooms, small bathroom however. Breakfast is good and not expensive. Very good price-quality ratio. Free Wifi!

Reviews.Title: “TIMES SQUARE at its BEST w/ one of the most attentive staff amd Mgr!”
Reviews.Author: barone35
Reviews.Content: From the moment we stepped out of the taxi we were greated with one of the most attentive staffs and General Manager! Hotel is clean / Beds are GREAT! and its steps away from one of the most exciting parts of NYC

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel with great service and location!!!”
Reviews.Author: Wotsit1211
Reviews.Content: I travelled with my partner, our 14 month old son and my husband to be's brother and girlfriend. I had initial dealings before arrival with Jay Dean the Manager who sorted our reservation and went out his way to make our stay special as we were going to NYC to get married and it was also his brothers 40th so lots of celebrating was done!! We stayed in a suite and it was extremely spacious, clean and had all the amenities you would need. The hotel even supplied us with a fridge so we could store our sons milk in it. The service received from the reception staff and door staff was absolutely amazing to say the least. They provided a very personal service especially Suny who doted over our son!!....He loved the huge aquarium in the reception and they used to take him behind the counter to see the fish! We just can't say enough about this hotel....from location which is only a couple of blocks from Times Square to decor of hotel to service etc, and we will definately be recommending this hotel to friends and family, and if we return to NYC, we will have no hesitation to staying in this hotel again!! Thanks very much to all the staff for making our holiday extremely special.....!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the location and the experience”
Reviews.Author: JandEMinden_Nevada
Reviews.Content: Great location, just a few blocks to Times Square, easy access to subways, and walking distance to several theaters. Rooms were very clean, and extremely comfortable bed. This helped to get a good nights sleep, even with the sirens going all hours of the night. The front desk staff were friendly and helpful. Rooms tend to be on small side, so recommend staying in a queen suite. Had plenty of room...Room lacked a full length mirror which would have been nice; bathroom clean but small, especially not much shelf space for toiletries. Thoroughly enjoyed oour stay.

Reviews.Title: “President Hotel is in a great location!”
Reviews.Author: michele772
Reviews.Content: Best Western President Hotel is located right off Time Square. The President theme is a kick. The staff was very helpful. My teenage daughter loved it. We would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT VALUE FOR BUSINESS”
Reviews.Author: KParks55
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed in a queen room for three nights. It was more than adequate for our needs, with very comfortable beds. The staff there were very friendly - welcoming and helpful, always smiling. The breakfast area is lovely with a huge screen TV - The hotel looks like it was just renovationed. There is a lobby lounge which we also enjoyed, very nice ambiance. This hotel was value for the money paid, with the added bonus of the friendliest staff. Thank you for a lovely weekend break.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but........”
Reviews.Author: PJP_Mumble
Reviews.Content: First thing I will say is that the hotel has an amazing location for anyone who is travelling to NY and for that alone it is probably worth staying at the hotel but being honest there was little else that would make me stay there again. On arrival we checked in very easily and quickly and went to our room to get showered and get out and experience NY, just a note but we carried our own bags through the main door and to our room without the offer of any assistance which was fine but I was a little surprised. On our way to the room the corridors just felt small and a little claustrophobic and to be honest they were a little shabby at best, the staff were cleaning and the cleaning trolleys and bags probably added to this but for the duration of our stay there were cleaning bags and supplies lying around at all times and it didn't look good. We got to the room and were immediately disappointed with the size and cleanliness and it was freezing cold. We turned up the air con and had showers but the room was still freezing and having checked the windows found one of them broken and the blinds and shutters in poor condition, we decided that we were going to ask to be moved and to be fair they moved us without any trouble even taking into account we had showered and our first rrom would need to be done up again. Our new room was as small as the first but we decided to make do and that's what we did but its not something you should have to do. The bathroom was tiny, I could put my left hand on one wall and my right hand on the other while trying to stand in the middle of it!, in order to open the door I needed to step back and have the toilet between my legs so the door would open and I could get out. The shower was good and there was no problem with the hot water( the pipes were extremely loud even when we weren't using them). The bed was very small too and the covers on the bed not great, it was comfortable though. The view from both of the rooms we were in was awful but that wasn't too big a concern. On previous visits to NY we have stayed in The Westin and The Sheraton Towers and while I accept that we paid more for both of these hotels they were much much nicer hotels and the rooms were far superior. A proper bar in the hotel would have been nice too. On the website there are two images for the Primary Lounge which makes it look really nice but the truth is the first image with 4 seats at the counter is all there is too it, that's the size of the bar and it is located beside the check in desk and right beside the main enterance. Its not really a lounge its more a counter beside the check in desk?!?. We didn't have any food at the hotel and there was no room service available. Everyone says you don't spend time in your room when in NY and that's very true but I think I would prefer a little more comfort. As I get to the end of my review the next question is would I recommend the hotel and honestly I'm not sure. Its location is great, the customer service was very good but we were disappointed on arrival with the rooms and the general cleanliness. I guess I would recommend it but only for its location and I would warn about the roomsize.

Reviews.Title: “Great if you're looking for location!”
Reviews.Author: ColmHalpin
Reviews.Content: As you'd expect with a New York Hotel, the room was tiny but that's a given in New York these days. Hotel was clean and recently refurbished. Small bar at reception only serving beer bottles and cocktails was a let down and Internet access was limited. All in all, I'd stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Best Western clean and helpful”
Reviews.Author: Horton43
Reviews.Content: This hotel had no negatives that we could see. It was friendly, clean and helpful. The breakfast buffet was plentiful, and had the location is great. We felt it was a good value considering a very busy time of the year to travel to New York City.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, What a super experience!!!”
Reviews.Author: JennMac32655
Reviews.Content: Great Hotel, What a super experience!!! Right from the second we walked through the front door we were met with the friendliest staff we have encountered. Everyone, from the maids restaurant, front desk, bellman to the Manager were really friendly and happy to talk to us. The room was nice the bed was comfortable and clean. The food was pretty good with a great choice of Asian. Plenty of variety for breakfast. Many restaurants in the area The bar staff were very efficient and friendly especially Grace. It is just a quick walk to Times Square. Enjoyed the staff and the stay. Would recommend and will be returning next year.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel on a beautiful section of Manhattan- Times Square.”
Reviews.Author: SusanP1111
Reviews.Content: Well we just got back from a week in New York City. I wanted to share some highlights. Best Western President Hotel Great hotel on a beautiful section of Manhattan- Times Square. Excellent service , great room small but clean. Staff very helpful good location. We were amazed at the location and found many restaurants in the area. We would recommend tis hotel and its location to anyone. We also went to the TOP of The Rock , there were amazing views

Reviews.Title: “Beware when making reservations at this hotel, your "requests" are not "guanteed”
Reviews.Author: moe3232
Reviews.Content: family vacation started out poorly when checking into this hotel, booked room at this hotel only because it offered smoking rooms. Best Western reservations assured me that once I made my reservation I would have the smoking room I reserved and paid for. I WAS WRONG! as it was explained to me, at the hotel property, (Not best western customer service) my "request" was not a guantee. After being moved to a smoking room on night 2 I asked for a refund for the first nights stay since I didn't get what I paid for....... Direct quote from an email from William Bornheimer Front Office Manager BW President Hotel Time Square I am sorry about the inconvenience of not having a smoking room and I want to assure you that we always try accommodate all our guests requests. Unfortunately I will not be refunding the night. We did provide you with a room in our hotel for the time here. Our smoking preferences are a request and are not guaranteed.

Reviews.Title: “Not that crash hot”
Reviews.Author: travelingpasta
Reviews.Content: Upon arrival, hotel is swave, and funky. Staff didnt seem too friendly, but it was busy so I initially didnt think much of it. Then, when we got to our floor, impressions faded, decorated nicely, but a moldy smell, attempted to hide behind tacky air fresheners. We had booked a deluxe queen, through hotels.com, now first of all hotels.com messed up our booking so that we were not even in the right month with the hotel, even though our confirmation has our dates on it, and the room we booked was described as having a sitting area, mini fridge and safe, none of those in our room, so we checked the booking online, and even though hotels.com listed a deluxe as that, it is not so on the best western site (needless to say, i wont use hotels.com again)! Back to hotel, 3 lights are not working, cant get hold of the front desk to fix it, shower head was rusty, and the bed is a small sized queen, if there is such a thing, bedding has pulled threads and is none to nice. and we had to spend a half hour on the phone to get the internet to work

Reviews.Title: “Nice upgrades”
Reviews.Author: TravelingDog08
Reviews.Content: This is the second time I've stayed here. The renovations that were made in between visits are fantastic. The rooms are brighter and overall nicer, nice new flat screen TV's. Great location near Times Square and the theaters. Rooms are small as is typical for NYC, but have everything you need.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for 1st time visitor”
Reviews.Author: JT71
Reviews.Content: The hotel's decor is quite unique and looked very fresh. The rooms are a bit small but still comfortable. Getting around was so easy and the travel desk was very helpful in booking tours. I would stay here again when back in New York.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and nice renovations BW!!”
Reviews.Author: meh2
Reviews.Content: We always like to stay here when we go to NYC. It is right in the heart of Times Square. All the rooms we have stayed at have been the same nice decor and size typical of hotels in its class in NYC. Wish they still ahd their free breakfast pre renovation, but having free internet and a great location more than make up for that. Staff appear to be well trained to give personlized service to each guest and we enjoy this service.

Reviews.Title: “In the heart of the Big Apple”
Reviews.Author: LordPippo
Reviews.Content: We've been at BW President for 4 nights. Far better than the expectations: we've been upgrade to a King Deluxe room, so I've no clue about standard rooms I've been reading on this site. Room was more than decently wide. Huge and comfortable bed. Bathroom ok compared to NY standard even if the shower was noisy because of plumbering troubles. The real PRO of this location is absolutely its position: right aside times square and Broadway. Absolutely safe to be reached walking at every time of the night (and we didi it!!). Check-in very quick, good attitude from the desk personnel in providng info, maps, details, taxis, etc. The hotel is close to a FDNY station (it's on the 8th avenue) but I had windows on the 48th street and experienced no problems in falling asleep every night: of course manhattan is not exactly a small silent countryside village! We've been there in a very peak season so room rate were quite high but, i admit, even because of room upgrade, absolutely worth! I do suggest this hotel to everybody willing to be in the very heart of New York, for a medium/short holiday for the excellent position and the chance to be at once downtown. Good trade off value/money

Reviews.Title: “Good Unique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: WilsonRX
Reviews.Content: Unique Hotel I stayed in one the suites for about 259 dollars a night, and for the price and location, it was the best hotel I have ever stayed in. The rooms featured a large sitting area a large flat screen tv, chest of drawers, and cloudlike bed. The other area features a spacious area including a desk, and another flat screen. There are other presidential details that the hotel has paid attention especially in the lobby, to which increased my overall satisfaction level basically quite content. I would highly recommend. There is a unique Brazilian restaurant on 8th Ave around the corner from the hotel. Also Carmines in the same area

Reviews.Title: “Work and Play Great Location”
Reviews.Author: DebbieDmm
Reviews.Content: Just returning from a long weekend in New York City. We booked a beautiful hotel in the middle of Times Square. The room was clean and spacious. The hotel was close to the Times Square and all of the NYC attractions. There are quite a few restaurants within a couple of blocks of the hotel. They offer a shuttle service to the airport for a small price, better than taxi. We realized that my son had forgotten his toothbrush, but they had one available free at the front desk. We would definitely consider staying here again. The comfort of the bed, room and location was very good.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location, Nice Clean Hotel”
Reviews.Author: flyersrok
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed our stay, nice clean hotel, 1/2 block from Times Square. Rooms were small but had a nice big balcony and could leave the door open for fresh air. Didn't like that complimentary breakfast wasn't included, and beware if you intend to drive and then park your vehicle at on of the garages. Make sure you pick the correct parking garage that is associated with this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “very disappointed”
Reviews.Author: rina98
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel for it's location and read reviews of how people liked this hotel but after being there for 3 nights we were glad that was all we were staying. They seriously need to look at replacing their beds and linen as both were extremely uncomfortable.No way big enough to fit two people on. The room was so stuffy we needed to open the window for some fresh air even though it was close to freezing outside.In our opinion the price was far too much for what you got. Location was good if there was any positives of this hotel, will do more homework on hotels in NY from here on in,

Reviews.Title: “Really Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: xtreme_buffy
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel the last week of November for our Honeymoon. I also work in a Best Western so I stay in a lot of them and I have to say that this one is by far the nicest one I have ever seen. The location is ridiculous! You cannot get closer to Times Square! The lobby is gorgeous, very art deco moderny, it really gave you a New York City feel, the rooms are awesome, they have a George Washington bust for a lamp and abstract paintings of JFK and Jackie O on the walls, vrey kitchy place, we LOVED it. We stayed at a few other hotels in NYC on the same trip as it was a spur of the moment thing over the Holiday weekend and it dompared with the big guys (ie the Hilton) The rooms I will give you are a bit of a tight fit but we expected that form NY and we didn't really think about it unitl now that we're home and reading reviews. I would definately recommend this property to anyone, it has like I say the greatest location, very nice decor and a very safe feeling to it.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, snazzy decor, but not comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Barbmom1
Reviews.Content: We are two adults and two teens. We paid extra for "suite" because two double beds are too small for the four of us, so we were counting on the queen sleeper/sofabed . We've slept on some perfectly comfortable sofa beds, but this one very uncomfortable, like a stack of cardboard. We would have gotten more sleep in a less expensive standard room. Also they waste money and energy on heating; the hotel was always too warm, we were sweating until we opened the windows, but even then it was warm because the whole place is heated up. Also the jets on the "spa" did not work. All in all a good location and reasonalble price but a less-than-comfortable place to relax and sleep after a busy day in the city. They should save on decor and energy and spend on comfortable beds.

Reviews.Title: “Comparing Apples to Apples”
Reviews.Author: TRAVEL_LOVER96
Reviews.Content: I can see how a picky person could rip this place apart. However the fact of the matter is, you're so unbelievably close to times square you could crawl, the rooms were quiet for sleeping, the rooms were comfortable and very clean, front desk is very efficient with providing anything you may need to make your stay better, they were also excellent with providing maps and help of where to find locations. You are not going to beat the prices of this hotel in Times Square, with a private bathroom in your hotel room. Last time we stayed in New York we stayed at lower priced wonderful hotel up on 78th street. Which was wonderful and peaceful, but inorder to make to the shows or get tickets at the TKTS booth, we were constantly on the subway. If you stay here at the Best Western, the TKTS booth is 2 blocks, with it being so close we were able to make it to 7 shows in 5 days with excellent seats for all of them! Reality is yes, the rooms are small, but you're hardly in your room hopefully, the cleanliness and location would bring me back as a return client. There is a tons of wonderful restaurants and pubs in the area too! It's a winner! One Suggestion: If you are a taller person, make sure to book at least a queen size room, the double was comfortable, but a little small. They have very comfy bedding and pillows too!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, confortable room”
Reviews.Author: DMPareto
Reviews.Content: Staff was kind and efficient. The room was confortable and spacious with a very nice bed. The bathroom could be cleaner, but it was within the standards. The hotel is extremelly well located. The downside was the internet connection which was slow and instable. Would reccomend for couples without kids, or small groups.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location!”
Reviews.Author: snikmis
Reviews.Content: The Best Western President Hotel is situated in an ideal location. It is very convenient to the Theater, dining, shopping and Pubs. The rooms are on the smaller side, but they were clean (thanks to Desiree) You are just a few steps from Times Square...but quiet enough for a goodnight's sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: jillianTRIP
Reviews.Content: Great Hotel Perfect Location This is a great hotel in a super location. The staff was friendly and very helpful. The only fault I had was my trip was too short. The service was good and the room was good size. and spotless. My kids loved the hotel and the location. We would definitely stay there again and next time we will stay longer.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, Value, Staff the reason I will book again”
Reviews.Author: CarlDownUnder
Reviews.Content: I am from Australia who was born in Germany and I have made a number of trips to New York City over the years. When I am in NYC I stay at the President Hotel. The people that operate it are great, friendly, speak many languages. They also ensure that I always feel welcomed back - they remember from year to year! Rooms are nice size for a medium price option and the beds are comfortable, with nice decors. Flat screen TV with a number of good channels with sitcoms or movies - which I've used to retreat from the hustle and bustle of Times Square and the City.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: janet_francis24
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel to Times Square and the Subway system is fantastic! Times Square is literally right around the corner and not having to pay the blown up price of a Times Square hotel is an added bonus. The rooms were clean and I'm not sure if because we had a corner room our room seemed bigger then what I had expected for an NYC hotel room, we actually had space! Little noisy at night, as there is a fire station right around the corner but after long days as tourists in NYC, this didn't affect our sleep at all. One tip: if you remember throw some faceclothes in your suitcase before you leave home! Although housekeeping was great and brought whatever we needed up, 3 out of the 5 nights we stayed we had to call for facecloths or handtowels, or bathtowels. The in room safe made up for any towel issues we had tho, this was another great feature. And I highly recommend the restaurant Saigon 28 located next door! Great food for a great price! And you get lots of it!

Reviews.Title: “A must see”
Reviews.Author: SunnyNov2010
Reviews.Content: Fantasic, exciting, elegant...wonderful location and great staff.

Reviews.Title: “Home away from Home, Nice Trip Love NYC”
Reviews.Author: CareyCrown
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were celebrating our 25th wedding anniversary. We were looking on line but booked directly to the hotel. The bellman was helpful and quickly took our bags as we parked the car at a nearby parking lot. The front desk was very helpful and eager to help us out. The room was adequate with an incredibly comfortable bed. Out room had a city view form the 10th floor. The location was superb and we walked pretty much everywhere. We attended the Broadway show Chicago which was a 5 minute walk. The area was safe and clean. . There was a discount ticket place nearby which had a long line but we didn’t have the time. There were many restaurants in the area. Several Museums were also nearby. We highly recommend the hotel

Reviews.Title: “Remarkable Stay Highly Recommend”
Reviews.Author: alextravel1955
Reviews.Content: Travel often to New York City and wouldn’t stay any other place. The hotel is perfectly located in midtown New York City, in Times Square. The staff at the hotel is very professional and extremely helpful. The room was very clean and anything we needed was quickly taken care of. The value we felt was excellent especially considering the location. The subways are all close by Buses were nearby and the taxis were right outside the hotel. The Broadway show we attended was a short walk. There was at least one restaurant at the hotel but we choose a New York Steak House instead. There are too many choices where to eat you first need to decide what type of food you want then the choice seems to be easier. Instead of visiting the Empire State Building we toured the “Top of the Rock” which was magnificent and just down the street from the hotel. Whatever your travel is business or pleasure you will be pleased

Reviews.Title: “terribly overpriced”
Reviews.Author: tali71
Reviews.Content: I purchased two nights at this hotel on hotel.com. The hotel had 3 stars but should have had one. The rooms are minute which is not the end of the world (unless you actually want to be able to stretch out your legs in the tub, which I could not and I am 5ft 3) but the dirtiness of the place was awful. The back board had brown marks on it that I had to wash off myself. The bathroom was dirty, tiles cracked, broken hairdryer. The first day, there was a vacuum cleaner parked outside the elevator on my floor all day long. However, the carpets in the corridor were never cleaned. To give them credit, after I complained, someone did clean them. The noise is awful- you can hear every car horn, person, whistle, trash collector etc. from outside. If I had paid a small amount for this hotel, I would not be complaining but when I'm paying over $300, I expect a little more!

Reviews.Title: “Good location, reasonable price for Times Square"”
Reviews.Author: arrestea
Reviews.Content: Its a reasonable hotel in a good location close to Times Square, and the staff were very nice indeed. It's close to everything--shops, restaurants, the heart of midtown. Step out of the door and you're in a sea of neon lights, people and major activity. However, it suffers as with all downtown or Manhattan NYC hotels, from serious price inflation. The rooms are smallish, the wifi is slow or nonfunctional (but free). There's tons of things to do nearby. Its location, location, location...the hotel itself isn't special, but you do pay a whopper of a bill to stay there.

Reviews.Title: “President only on the wall's poster”
Reviews.Author: STEVE-CH-I
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this property over 3 nights at the beginning of november. The first impression was very nice with the modern, trendy and bright lobby. I had room 1429, a double one. Althought nice appointed with nice colours and president pictures on the wall, this room is the smallest I have had in the entire world. There was a desk, a coffee making set and a big plasma TV. For the double room though the wardrobe was very small. The bed was confortable but it was just my size (5ft6) and could accomodate 2 persons with restrictions. The bathroom was ok and provided a large shower but I had quite a problem with taking it: it was almost impossible to adjust the water temperature (either tooooo hot or tooo cold). After 3 complaints I managed to use it . On arrival I found my room dusty and a big long hair was waiting on the „fresh“ bed at night when I wanted to rest. I found the room overheated and althought up on the 14th floor too noisy, let alone just around the corner there’s a fire station. There is free Wi-Fi connection available: the problem is the connection itself. Poor at best. The hotel has a little bar open only night time and breakfast is served in the lobby with the buffet formula at 14 US$ per person: I didn’t take the chance since the quality and variety of the food looked average. One can have a nice hot breakfast in one of the many cafes around the street nearby. There are also 2 restaurants to choose from but if during the day you feel like having a drink or a coffee (like I was on the departure’s day) you are stranded. Overall the stuff was helpfull, corteous but not behind expectations. The location is nice, very close to Time Sq and to the Subway Station but keep in mind it is not a quite place. Personally I found the room rates overpriced for the quality

Reviews.Title: “My Home away from home”
Reviews.Author: kbogos
Reviews.Content: I go to New York at least 2 times per month and have been staying at The Best Western President for almost 8 years now and it is definately my home away from home. From Suny and Pat at the front desk to Larry, Sadat and Manny who seem to do everything else, it's the best value in the city. And since they've remodeled I'm almost reluctant to write a review because I'd like to keep it a secret.

Reviews.Title: “Poor Value”
Reviews.Author: travelcanuck29
Reviews.Content: While this hotel has added modern decorations, I feel like the basics are not at the standard they should be for the rate paid. I have no issue with small rooms, as it is Manhattan, but the quality of this room was not good. The air conditioning, and heating system was terrible. It was loud and inconsistent, and really impacted the comfort of the room for our entire stay. There was a significant amount of noise during our stay. I appreciate that there are many sounds that are outside of the hotel's control, such as siren's, but the noise within the hotel wassignificant. The heating system was very loud, and the fan and water systems in the adjacent room could be heard in ours. The location is good if you would like to be by Times Square. I find the Times Square locaiton a greater hassle than it is worth, and there are many, better locations in NYC. I feel this is an average hotel at best, and if you have to pay anything over $125 - $150 a night, it is not worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable Experience”
Reviews.Author: GameSetMatchWithStyl
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed my time at the Best Western President Hotel. It's an excellent location should you seek to be near the theater district or business areas. The staff was helpful, friendly, warm and quick to respond to requests. As a woman traveling alone I felt secure.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel & fabulous location w/wonderful restaurant attached”
Reviews.Author: LMHColumbiaSC
Reviews.Content: We've stayed at this hotel many times and are always treated with respect. All employees go above & beyond to please. The rooms are well appointed and clean. The hotel is also very quiet for a busy city. We can walk to all theatres and many restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location in Times Square”
Reviews.Author: marilynlanton
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed for two nights and were very pleased with the hotel. Staff was very helpful, room very clean and we highly recommend this hotel especially for those who love the theater and want to be in all the excitement of Times Square, yet have a quiet respite from the noise.

Reviews.Title: “What a deal!”
Reviews.Author: LandJNYUK
Reviews.Content: I live in NYC area but wanted a night in the city with my boyfriend.--so I know what to expect in NY hotels. SMall, crammed spaces. Boy, was I wrong! We got an exceptionally good deal at this hotel. By far, superior to other Best Westerns. Room was modern and very clean. Manager even gave us free breakfast coupons. Cost about $150 with parking (which is across the street). ONly bad thing is there are a lot of guests waiting in lobby for their rooms to be ready, usually Euro trash but.....we are booking in again in 2 weeks!

Reviews.Title: “CHECK IT OUT”
Reviews.Author: Jerry21Girl
Reviews.Content: Great location. A few blocks from The Empire State. A couple of blocks from subway. Clean. Modern feel. Quiet room. Close to shopping, and nightlife. Generally happy and it made sure we enjoyed our week in NYC. What we loved best was the convenience of being right in the heart of Times Square - fantastic!! Great facilities, fitness center Didn't have a chance to enjoy the hotels restaurants - too much on offer in Times Square. Broadway shows all nearby !

Reviews.Title: “Super Stay in Manhattan”
Reviews.Author: CC1957aw
Reviews.Content: In a great location in New York City this hotel exceeded our expectations. The staff was exemplary from front desk to the housekeepers. We stayed several times the second for four nights. My daughter was interviewing at several colleges in Manhattan. The location really is excellent with all the theatres close by not to mention numerous restaurants. The lobby bar was unique. Our room was really immaculate a credit to the housekeeping department. Overall it was refreshing to enjoy the hotel and were well received from all employees. We will definitely return. You will not be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: SandTT
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay here very much. Lovely hotel. We did need to wear our ear plugs for sleeping but it is New York City and is to be expected, although the bottom half of the window didn't seem to seal properly and may have added to the problem. The room very clean. We would only have one complaint and that would be the wifi connection. We always had to log in and I would say 90% of the time you could not log in. The hotel may want to look into getting a more efficient system.

Reviews.Title: “Memerable Stay in a Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Kuntmissioner
Reviews.Content: I traveled to NYC from Boston in early NOV 2010 to attend a concert at the Best Buy Theater. My gf lives in NYC, and initially our plan was for me to stay w/her in her apt. A last minute change in plans necessitated that we book a hotel room, and she picked out the Best Western President Hotel at Times Square. She booked us a room using her IPhone as we walked the few blocks from the bus stop (where she met me) towards Times Square. Upon arrival at the Best Western (which is located only minutes away from the concert venue) we were notified that our reservation hadn't processed yet. (A third party website was used for booking, and only minutes had passed since the transaction had completed.) The clerk, whose name escapes me at the moment, was made aware of the fact that we were pressed for time, and he then took action. He told us that not only was he going to re-book us in ASAP, but he was bumping us up to the Penthouse! My gf and I were elated at this service, to say the least. That action alone would make for a five star review. However, I must mention the room itself. Room #1601 has a 1950-60s luxury feel, fully restored w/ a presidential theme. The door opens into the sizable main living space. The suite has 2 separate, sizable balconies- one off the master bedroom, the other located off the living room. (Both have enough room for at least a dozen people to hang out on, and give gorgeous views of the surrounding buildings.) There is also a bathroom located off of the main living room space. The bedroom (also w/a balcony) is moderately sized. The master bathroom is entirely marble, has a screen-less double shower, large flat screen TV, jacuzzi, etc. One of the largest master bathrooms I've ever seen. Luxurious. I highly recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a place to stay in or near Times Square. The prices are competitive, considering the location. Obv my gf got a wonderful deal/upgrade that won't be possible on most occasions- that aside, this place is still a great value. Staff goes above and beyond the scope of their expected duties.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant!”
Reviews.Author: FrancesEugenia
Reviews.Content: This renovation was brilliant! It was both modern and cozy. Truly inspired! I will definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible Staff!!!”
Reviews.Author: kristend44
Reviews.Content: I will never stay here again! When we first arrived, the staff was moderately friendly, but definitely did not go out of their way to help.
