Once we got to our room, we found that the air conditioner was leaking all over the room. The floor was soaked!! We called the front desk and they said they would send a maintenance person up to work on it. An hour later, no one had arrived, so I called the front desk again. Finally someone came up to look at the AC. The man was very rude and told us we "might" be able to change rooms or we might have to deal until he can get a whole new AC unit installed. Luckily, we could switch rooms, but the front desk never apologized or anything! When we got settled into our new room, we began to shower and get dressed. The one blow dryer we used kept blowing the fuse. The maintenance man yelled at us and told us we could not use our blow dryer again. Well, being 3 girls in NYC, we couldn't do that and the power went out 3 more times! No one ever apologized for anyone being rude or for any inconvenience. The next day went alright until we went to pick up our stored luggage. The bell man got our luggage, asked if we needed a cab and walked away before we could even answer him. He could have cared less what we needed. The only positive part about the hotel is the decor and the location.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Value”
Reviews.Author: TommyCella
Reviews.Content: I found the President's Hotel to be in a great location (Times Square), the staff were friendly and helpful, a great lobby, complementary internet. The decor made me feel like I was in Europe and it also had an excellent restaurant in the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “good stay”
Reviews.Author: cfir
Reviews.Content: First time in new york and manhattan. I went through several reviews of different hotel, and saw this one a week before the trip. I had already booked with another place, but saw that this was directly off times square and near some of the stuff we wanted to se. Had a great stay, yes rooms are small, but to me you have enough room, and get use to it. stayed on the 5th floor , yes it was noisy, but I had no problem sleeping. what do you expect in a 24 hour city??? close to a lot of the theaters, 5 short blocks to david letterman show great places to eat near by, avoid the bar hurleys next door a little expensive and food not great check out carve around the corner, across the street from starbucks great pastry, $ 3 dollar eggg sandwich great, open 24 hours, pizza and sandwiches also. http://www.tastespace.com/Carve staff at hotel was great, need a few more pillows, or bigger clean rooms, fire station around the corner so you feel safe, and cops all over the place would stay again

Reviews.Title: “Terrible hotel”
Reviews.Author: willington10
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for one night in October 2010. The traffic noise was terrible that kept me awake all night (bring sleeping pill if you do want to sleep)! Most receptionists are cold faced and you cannot expect any from therm. The (free) wireless internet does not work at all.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, great location, great staff”
Reviews.Author: MariaT16
Reviews.Content: Great location for business trip,,, subway stations, restaurants, grocery nearby,busy but exciting street,,,weak wifi connection which might be caused by wifi traffic from luxury apartment located across the hotel (improvement needed in this area) ,,,excellent front desk service by Kumar,,,,will definitely go back to this hotel,,,

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel for your money”
Reviews.Author: BonnieSueFlorida
Reviews.Content: Excellent Hotel - Clean - Great location - Hotel front desk staff Tricia, Adelina are so helpful. Very comfortable beds - Very charming hotel

Reviews.Title: “Location, cleanliness, value. What else is there to say?”
Reviews.Author: BadJuju
Reviews.Content: This hotel was in the heart of Times Square, with all the energy and fun of the area reflected in its eclectic politically-themed decor. The rooms were decently-sized, clean, and cheerfully decorated with prints of former presidents printed on clear acrylic, white patent-vinyl furniture, crystal chandeliers, and quirky ambient lighting (one bedside lamp was a full-sized bust of George Washington lit from within). Dozens of restaurants and theaters are within a short walking distance. The Grayline hop-on-hop-off buses stop within a block or two of the hotel. There is a bar downstairs, but with all the great bars and restaurants so close at hand, we never visited it. Other reviewers warned about the flaky Internet service, which was definitely a problem. We usually had to take our computers out into the stuffy hallway to get Internet. There was a little bit of street noise, but we were on the 12th floor and generally didn't find it kept us from sleep. Overall, a great value-priced place to stay. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “If you want pleasant memories of your hotel, stay somewhere else!”
Reviews.Author: SunshineTess
Reviews.Content: Reservation made 2 MONTHS in advance. When we arrived our preferred room was not available; hotel said a change in policy meant they could not accommodate us. They had 2 months to notify us before we got there. The staff at the front desk seemed unconcerned. We insisted that they honor our reservation; they eventually found a room for us that did not meet our needs, but they said they could change that the next day. The next day they gave us a different room. The sheets felt like paper. The shower stall had mildew all over the floor and walls, and also on the little bench inside the stall. The ONLY thing this hotel has in its favor is its location, which is really close to the heart of Times Square and other tourist attractions. Even so, we would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic, first class service, wonderful hosts that looked after us like family.”
Reviews.Author: ademjana
Reviews.Content: we were treated like royalty. staff were warm, kind and most helpful. this was my second time at this hotel and it really meant alot when Sunny recognized me and welcomed me back with a warm beautiful smile.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, amazing staff”
Reviews.Author: lini31
Reviews.Content: We booked one night and were so impressed we stayed another. Never been so impressed with the quality of customer service from hotel staff especially in New York. There are two staff members in particular that deserve a mention, Kumar and Cassandra, the most helpful people I have ever come across - I'm afraid I cant remember the door mans name, he used his mobile phone to look up things for us - These staff went the extra mile for us whenever they could. Loved the rooms and the location, lovely hotel but the best thing this hotel had to offer was its wonderful staff and their excellent customer service skills.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: ca4niagrl
Reviews.Content: Very pleased with this hotel from the moment I arrived and they let me check in early (10 a.m.) to the day I departed. The lobby is gorgeous, staff very nice, location perfect if you want to be near Times Square (only a block away), and in a decent size room with a very comfortable bed and free wi-fi. I even had a view of Times Square! The rate was very good for the area so I wasn't sure what to expect but I was very pleasantly surprised and will definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: kcopis
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Best Western President's Hotel was great... It was centrally located and we were able to walk to most of our destinations.. I would definitely go back...

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Lease1720
Reviews.Content: What a great hotel, location couldn't be better. The lifts were slow but we were on the second floor so we just walked the stairs .Staff were helpful and friendly. Right off Times Square ideal location. Our room was nice and brighta bit small but what can you expect for New York. Hope to be back again next year and would stay in this hotel The only draw back was the halls were decorated in dark wallpaper which made the hall quite dark. Don't believe all the bad reports , you just can't please some people

Reviews.Title: “Good value and Good stay”
Reviews.Author: lawyerSanFran
Reviews.Content: I needed to stay in Manhattan for a couple of nights, and I picked the President Hotel because of the value and reviews. Value: Excellent. The room wasn’t huge but it was nicely decorated and very clean. The room rate was about $80 better than any where else I could find in midtown. I felt I received an excellent value for NYC. Cleanliness: This hotel is VERY clean. Hallways, room and especially bathroom - super clean. It is an older building with a lot of charm. I think the older buildings are usually have smaller rooms than the newer hotels. But I guess that is part of the charm of NYC. The beds were very nice extremely comfortable. The area is very safe and close to EVRYTHING. I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “What a surprise, nice visit will be returning for many years”
Reviews.Author: motherdaughter2040
Reviews.Content: I took my daughter here for 18th Birthday as a surprise. What a lovely grand time we had. The concierge aimed to please us. We were within walking distance to most good attractions within midtown, which was quite a treat. You could always get a cab outside the hotel. The Lobby was so beautiful with a extremely large fish tank, Hotel employees were very accommodating and the room clean

Reviews.Title: “Not Bad, Great Location, Snazzy Room - No Bed Bugs!”
Reviews.Author: DustyLylac
Reviews.Content: Really enjoyed the decor and the space, bed was comfy. Didn't get bed bugs! Housekeeper was a freak'n hoot. She took great care of me and had quite the sense of humor! Perfectly located to Time Square and Metro. Everyone was super friendly. A bit pricey for a Best Western but considering the location, I understand why. Exactly a $50 Taxi fare from JFK. Give yourself about an extra 30mins to have the bellboy flag down a cab.

Reviews.Title: “Not what I expected”
Reviews.Author: FrankfurterColumbus
Reviews.Content: For $350 a nite I did not get a good nights sleep. Every time someone flushed a toilet upstairs a loud bang came from the wall. This would wake my wife and I several times during the night. The bed actually had bread or cookie crumbs in it when we turned down the sheets. The walls were covered with marks and scratches like wwf wrestling matches had taken place in the room. The staff were hit and miss, 3 guys behind the counter were too busy talking to be bothered by a customer, but one female staffer was very helpful. The bathroom was so small it was difficult to use and there was a small amount of mold on the shower curtain. YMMV.

Reviews.Title: “very clean and frendly staff”
Reviews.Author: MarioJones
Reviews.Content: We spent four night's at the Best Western president hotel in New York,very clean rooms and the employees were very friendly und polite.It was a good experience ,we will come back.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome staff and very clean Hotel”
Reviews.Author: HiltonHeadPlaces2010
Reviews.Content: Great location for visiting NYC. Everybody was extremely helpful right as we stepped in the lobby. Very clean rooms and thoughtful housekeeping staff. It is a very cozy hotel which was a pleasant surprise since this was our first stay at a Best Western President. See you next year NYC and Best Western.

Reviews.Title: “AWESOME SAFE LOCATION BY TIMES SQUARE!”
Reviews.Author: JawsNewYork
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel with my teenage daughter in July for 11 nights & it was a great base. It's a small boutique hotel on 48th street between Broadway & 8th Ave. Only 1 block from the Times Square area, GREAT location! Convenient to everything! Shopping, subways, buses, Broadway Theatres, Central Park, & Rockefeller Center. Very safe area, I had NO CONCERNS at all for our safety at night returning to the hotel. My room was well appointed, clean & comfortable, as were the public areas. My room had white walls which I loved because during the day it was very bright. I hate dark hotel rooms! Sometimes there was an issue with the hot water for the shower. There's only 15 floors so if you're on one of the lower floors you can take the stairs up to your room instead of waiting for an elevator, you could also go down the stairs zip zip. Come on people stop being so lazy! I'm amazed when the elevator stops at the 2nd floor on the way down & healthy people get in! The front desk staff is VERY friendly & helpful, especially Patricia & Suny. Bellmen were very friendly too, Quintin & Al will treat you & your luggage right! I highly recommend this hotel if you want to be in the heart of things, want nice clean accommadations & a friendly staff!

Reviews.Title: “President - Great Place To Stay”
Reviews.Author: picasso0401
Reviews.Content: Regular visitor to President. Staff is friendly and Jay Dean is excellent manager. Helpful Hints to make your stay better. Check into larger rooms as they have larger rooms with nice bathrooms. Internet is not available in some rooms due to metal in building construction so dont plan on access. Location is incredible!!!!

Reviews.Title: “The ideal hotel for a popular area”
Reviews.Author: mgml50
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 5 days at the end of September. The reception area was modern and bright, the staff friendly and helpful. The rooms were clean, quiet and modern. A couple of times we ate breakfast in the hotel which was very good and at a reasonable price. The position of the hotel is really close to Times Square. If I ever visit Manhattan again I would always use this hotel which was such a reasonble price. We met a few other guests there from Europe who were also returning guests.

Reviews.Title: “Best Western President Hotel - GREAT SPOT in the Big Apple”
Reviews.Author: SiennaMammola
Reviews.Content: Just want to thank everyone at the Best Western including Cory who helped me get out of a jam re my reservation - I will definitely be back along with my fellow co-workers. The hotel decor took me by surprise - charming! - both whimsical and a bit esoteric - incredible aquarium at the reception - my room was small but totally cute with comfortable bed and excellent linens. Really great staff from everyone - great spot if you want close to Time Square without all the noise.

Reviews.Title: “The Best Western President Hotel, Times Square, NY is fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: norva04
Reviews.Content: I recently returned from another trip to New York City where I was treated as a visiting family member by Manager Jay Dean and his delightful staff. In particular, Ms. Patricia and Mr Jose at the Front Desk greeted me warmly and courteously. Without them I wouldn't have returned (I have been housing there for some ten years now). It was a great discovery--wonderful location, attentive staff, great management, clean, efficient, and interesting guests! The entire hotel (lobby, rooms, restaurants) have been remodeled. It is clean and well functioning. I met people in the hotel lobby which only increased my enjoyment of being in New York. The two new Asian restaurants flanking both sides of the hotel are a great treat and offer discounts to hotel guests. I enjoyed having the breakfast buffet at the hotel each morning, too. The concierge was cheerful and friendly. She assisted me to get around the city and its suburbs as well as provided me with great advice about where to go and what to do. As you may know, it is centrally located close to the theater district and restaurants. Taxis are plentiful and there is no better place to get on a subway in NY than where the hotel is located at W48th and Broadway. I travel often but this is the only hotel I look forward to returning each year. Great place, great people. I recommend it to everyone. It's a fantastic place to visit!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Staff.”
Reviews.Author: TJBrown109
Reviews.Content: Had a great business trip with my regional director. Great location and clean hotel. Staff was friendly and polite. Will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Won't stay here again. There are much better 3-star hotels”
Reviews.Author: summit_warrior
Reviews.Content: From the start my experience with this hotel was not great. Old air-conditioners and skipped wake-up calls were the beginning. Internet access was variable and slow. Housekeeping uses sheets that are too short so your feet are exposed to mattress cover (unhygienic) which is typical of a 2-star class hotel. When I changed rooms at their suggestion, I asked for a quiet room away from the street, assured it would be only to find out when I returned late in the evening it was on 48th and noisy. I travel extensively for business and would put this hotel in the bottom 5 percent of hotels I stay in.

Reviews.Title: “Absolute rip-off!”
Reviews.Author: brotherdogs
Reviews.Content: Only decent thing about this place is the location - really central and in the midst of it all! Other than that, WAY too expensive for what you get ie@ a tiny, box-sized room where you have no room for a suitcase to be placed, no room for two people to get ready and the bathroom is tiny! I understand this is standard for New York apparently but to add to this, the staff are absolutely useless and so unhelpful! I witnessed on our first night, some poor group trying to check-in and were told they couldn't have a non-smoking room as there was none available!! Apparently this is what they had requested and booked but were given the wrong room. Straight away I thought the staff's attitude was pitiful, and the next day we asked for a toothpaste sachet (as directed by wall sign telling you if you forgot anything, just ask) and I asked for an extra pillow - a very unhelpful young gentleman just said "no, sorry, have none of those"....! Now we had been travelling for almost a year and had stayed in many Best Western's - all were great apart from this. The staff at the front desk (two women) stand chatting to each other whilst guests wait to be seen and there was a horrendously noisy air con unit at our bedroom windown which, for 3 nights, made constant, LOUD noise!! I would definately not recommend this place - the barman is also very unfriendly and unhelpful, consideringhe asks the equivalent of about £19 for a wine and a beer! Stay elsewhere, New York is awesome but not this place.

Reviews.Title: “Good Choice in the Theater Distict Manhattan”
Reviews.Author: CalDrive77
Reviews.Content: Hello. Just returned back and felt compelled to offer my sincerest kudos for the staff at the President Hotel. In the four nights I never experienced one problem, not a moment of disappointment with the employees or the hotel. The bed was perfect with a pad on top of mattress, heavy coverlet. We traveled for hours and were in desperate need of a good night's sleep. We weren’t disappointed. If you want to go to the theater/Broadway plays New York this location could not be better: walking distance to almost every theater; a block away from times square; 1 to 6 blocks away from most subway lines. Everybody was friendly, pleasant, eager to help with directions, reservations; they all were genuinely interested in and committed to my satisfaction. They made it possible to have a once in a life time trip.

Reviews.Title: “Great Times in Times Square!”
Reviews.Author: Tour210x
Reviews.Content: Great Times in Times Square! As this was now my third time we have stayed in this Hotel , I have decided it would be only fair to write a review. I contact the hotel prior to arriving, as the first time we went there had been a mix up with the booking, so I wanted to ensure things would be ok ,The man who me back, Jim? , was most helpful and gave us a great room. Thanks again . The hotel is very convenient for walking or taking the subway. The rooms are spotless and have very comfortable beds. Lifts small, but efficient. Plenty of good restaurants within walking distance. Will return

Reviews.Title: “Simply Delightful!”
Reviews.Author: flyer02
Reviews.Content: I absolutely loved my stay here! While business brought me for only one night, my stay here was accompanied with a very warming front dest staff. Even though I checked in at 1 AM, the front desk staff was EXTREMELY helpful with directions and very kind checking me in for the night. When I got to the room, as tired as I was, I plopped onto the bed. The bed was SO comfortable, which provided a great night's sleep so I was ready for work in the morning! Overall, the hotel was extremely accommedating, not to mention right on Times Square, awesome location! I had a great time and I would completely recommend this up-beat, fun hotel!

Reviews.Title: “stay was luxurious and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: jjsbu
Reviews.Content: very relaxing, great location and very friendly staff. Easy to ask for help and easy to talk to staff. comfortable and would recomend to anyone looking to stay at affordable hotel in times sqaure.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, vastly improved and beautiful decor but poor hotel staff”
Reviews.Author: carolans69
Reviews.Content: I had previously stayed at this hotel in 2009, and the experience was by far better this year. The hotel reception area is fantastic- a very positive impression on entering the hotel. I was very impressed, especially since last year when under rennovation [which was not mentioned at time of booking] it was chaos and very unattractive. The hotel floors now have an expensive boutique look about them and my room was plain but bright, clean and functional with a balcony [albeit lacking in space to put clothes]. The bathroom was also just ok. The bath/tiles need to be addressed- the grout was grimey. The toilet seat was broken. Had it not been for the dirty tiles, i would have rated accom as excellent. The location is excellent for Times Sq and Broadway as you are about 100 metres from Times Sq which is hectic. You are also a block away from the starting location of one of the city bus tours. My BIG negative was the reception staff. The house keeping and most of the door staff were very nice and friendly but the front desk staff were rude and snooty. There were either several of them standing around when people needed served and they were 'looking' too busy or there was only 1 person on and a queue of 4/5 people waiting to be served. While checking out I had to wait for at least 10-15 mins whilst one of thefemale staff was very rude to the guest in front of me. She obviously could not understand what the guest was asking but she was very abrupt and obviously lacks in any customer service principles when handling a customer. Had she spoken to me in the same manner, I would have escalated the incident into a complaint- I was not impressed by the attitude. Overall, the hotel is excellent value for money. The rate was reasonable, room was clean and functional and fantastic location but the front desk staff need to have some customer service training and be friendlier towards their guests- this is the one big failing point.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location & Staff”
Reviews.Author: airmb
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel on several occasions and always found the staff genuinley helpful and nothing seems too much trouble. Suny on Reception is an absolute star and the rest of the team that I came across demonsrated the highest levels of professionalism and attention to making my stay an enjoyable one. The hotel as been renovated and the rooms are excellent and great value for money. I would suggest a double or a queen as an absolute minimum, I did look at a single on the day I arrived and the noise from the AC machine was right by my ear, so close was the bed to the window, due to the small room size. Noise in reception from piped music is a bit of a pain and the bar along-side the reception is a bit intrusive when trying to check in and get sorted etc. Room 1224 is a nice room nice and quiet and good size.

Reviews.Title: “Gracious, Friendly, Accommodating Staff with excellent accomodations”
Reviews.Author: raminc73
Reviews.Content: All wound out, Hot, fatigued and feeling rather poorly, we were without accomodations. Ms. Suny on the Desk was very intent on meeting our needs even with a foyer full of other travelers. Within the hour I was stradelled over the AC in a clean, pleasant, bright, modern room. The bed slept better than my own. The Manager, doormen and room attendants were all smiles, highly attentive, conversational, and made us feel that NY City was a Great City to visit. I would reccomend these accomodations Very, Very highly! The location so close to Times Square is excellent. But it is the people who operate this establishment that will make you extremely glad you chose to stay with them.

Reviews.Title: “Really happy with this hotel”
Reviews.Author: nicos2010
Reviews.Content: was very paranoid about staying in the city as heard many complaints about hotels being filthy, cannot say anything about this one. I cannot stay in a dirty room, and mine was very clean. From when we walked in we were happy, as the lobby to the room had a very modern feel to it. The location was incredible and the price, although always expensive in NYC, was the best around, espescially for the location. Had no towels in the room when i checked in, contacted front desk and had them within 2 minutes! Wireless was a little spotty, aside from that it was perfect would definitely be back

Reviews.Title: “Worst Hotel Room Ever”
Reviews.Author: pjaatpdx
Reviews.Content: We were in a street side King on the fourth floor. Very Noisy; couldn't sleep well. Asked for another room, were put into a smaller room on the inside. Needed paint badly, incredibly small (could barely open dresser drawers as they bumped into bed). Had to be careful getting in the shower to avoid large waste basket that wouldn't fit anywhere except next to the shower. One chair in room, missing towels, light fixture didn't work. At least it was quieter. Won't stay here again. The Hampton Inn is two blocks away with much nicer and larger rooms, for less money. Wish I knew that before staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Stay”
Reviews.Author: TracyC44
Reviews.Content: I have used tripadvisor a number of times to see reviews for cruises and hotels. This is my first time I've actually taken the time to write a review. Our stay was the best weekend my husband and I have had in a long time!!! The weather was fabulous and the hotel helped to make the trip wonderful. The service received at the hotel was wonderful and the concierge was absolutely wonderful! Would definitely recommend and would definitely stay her again. In fact we will be coming back to New York City in October and have already booked the hotel. Don’t hesitate to stay at this fabulous hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible”
Reviews.Author: cat155019
Reviews.Content: My husband and I arrived at 1am in the morning to check in and found the employee sleeping on a couch. The room was very small could hardly fit in the bathroom, window shaker air conditioning that made alot of loud noises. The hotel seemed something out of a horror movie like everything was make believe. It smelt awful throughout the whole hotel. I would never stay there again we left 2 nights earlier than planned.

Reviews.Title: “Simply Perfect Will Return Love New York”
Reviews.Author: AngelTrip2010a
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel as it was in close proximity to the Times Square where we had booked to see a show. We were Immediately pleased not just by how lovely the hotel looked but by the service we recieved, the receptionist who checked us in was extremely polite and very friendly, he informed us of all infomation we inquired about and then some. When we arrived to our room,it was amazing the room was perfect,it had everything we could possibly need, from internet to an ipod docking station. The room was spoltless it was so clean and very tidy. After a super night sleep,we made our way down to breakfast and the excellent service.The food was delicious. This was by far the NYC hotel I have ever stayed in, we enjoyed our stay so much am in the process of booking another package later this year with my entire family. We felt like it was bargin we couldn't refuse! Would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Poor Cleanliness”
Reviews.Author: Audrey009
Reviews.Content: This hotel couln't put you in a better location for the money. One block from Times Square. Room was typical size for a downtown NYC hotel room, noise from street was to be expected (you are in NYC, near Times Square, what do you expect?) However, the room was filthy! Stains on the sheets, walls were extremely dirty, dirt on the bathroom floor, very disgusting stain on the throw pillows. I was nervous to put any of my bags on the floor due to the dirt that stuck to the bottom of my bare feet. Had to wear shoes every time my feet hit the floor! Remote control has some type of stickiness on it.....If you don't mind a dirty room then stay here! If you could get past the stained sheets, the bed was very comfortable!

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff and Trendy Vibe!”
Reviews.Author: noel2010
Reviews.Content: I came to New York City for the first time on a trip with some of my close friends. Coming from the Midwest, I was warned by some friends that the people are not always the nicest in New York City but thought quite the contrary when we arrived at this hotel. The staff was very nice and accommodating! Without getting into a long and embarrassing story, we accidentally lost our room keys one night and i was surprised at how helpful the staff at the front desk was. I really felt welcomed and also found the room to be very comfortable. The hotel overall had such a trendy vibe and I loved all of the decorations. I would definitely recommend this hotel and, when you stay here you must eat at the attached Japanese restaurant…it was yummy!

Reviews.Title: “Very accomodating front desk.”
Reviews.Author: nanfanc
Reviews.Content: The rooms and bathrooms were smaller than we're used to, but they were clean and the beds were very comfortable. The hotel is right off Times Square and even though we were on the ninth floor for the second night we could still hear sirens. The Vietnamese restaurant downstairs was lovely and the food very good. I cannot say enough about how helpful and friendly the ladies at the front desk were. We'd stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “We've been all over the world but I've...”
Reviews.Author: cuinche
Reviews.Content: We've been all over the world but I've never experienced ignorance from staff like I have at this hotel, however only for us dealing with the manager "Corey" who was professional & personable we would have looked for a refund. Beautiful location around the corner from times square rooms tiny. The bell staff were deplorable & we were charged for keeping luggage in storage. The breakfast was terrible

Reviews.Title: “Great location.”
Reviews.Author: OscarLee
Reviews.Content: The hotel was a great location and the staff were very friendly and helpful. However, the cleanliness of our room was disappointing. After switching to a different room and finding it the same, we just made do. For almost $300 a night, we just expected a clean room. Everything else was good and if the hotel had a thorough cleaning I would have given them a very good rating.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, Great location!”
Reviews.Author: Holidayfromcamberley
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the BW President Hotel from 29th June - 3rd July inclusive. Hotel is in a great location 234 W 48th Street which is about 50 steps to being on Times Square itself. You come out right next to the Hershey's and M&M Chocolate Stores...what more does a girl need! We had an Executive Suite which was perfect for 2 ladies as it had a queen sized bed and a pull out queen sofa bed (which was actually a white patent sofa when in sofa form - interesting!). Room size was perfectly ok for the 2 of us with enough hanging space for the short time we were there. Bathroom was kitted out with a shower and a seperate jacuzzi tub bath. Room was clean on arrival and nicely decorated. Bathroom could have done with an extra "going over" as we found a few rogue hairs lurking but nothing we couldn't aim the shower at. Breakfast at the hotel was good, all you can eat for $14.95 and they had a good selection of pastries, pancakes and of course the all american fry up. If you don't fancy eating in at the hotel there are loads of Starbucks and Coffee / cafe places around the area. NOTE - The New York Fire Department is on the road parallel to the hotel so be prepared to hear sirens day and night. It didn't affect us as we both wear ear plugs but you might want to consider this if staying there and wanting a full uninterrupted nights sleep. Other plus points of the hotel were the thai restaurant 2 doors away - very good, the theatre next door - if you fancied seeing a show and easy access to the City Sightseeing bus tour office which made getting around really easy. The subway station is also only a couple of blocks away. We paid $1,500 for 4 nights accommodation which in comparison to a lot of other hotels we thought was pretty good. As with most NYC hotels the hotel tax is what pushes the price up so be warned! Read the small print when booking. Hotel staff were polite and helpful. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, friendly staff, amazing value!”
Reviews.Author: WTJ2
Reviews.Content: Location was perfect! The staff was very helpful and kind. Decor was modern. The rooms were very nice. The iPod station is key! I have nothign bad to say at all!!!! Loved our stay!

Reviews.Title: “Location great, staff great, hotel great trip great”
Reviews.Author: CClifton1966
Reviews.Content: Traveled to New York City for suimmer vacation. Stayed at the Best Western President Hotel and we all had a great. Staff friendly, service good and price paid very nice, not cheap but good. The location of the hotel is perfect for the family close to everything. Enjoyed the restaraunts in NYC, the shopping and the people.

Reviews.Title: “Good night sleep, Clean, good value”
Reviews.Author: RBell14
Reviews.Content: I try and keep my expenses down while on business travel and found a great hotel with great value. The location was perfect in Midtown Manhattan. Close to both business loactions I needed to attend. The service was very good,the check in and check out very effeciant. The room very clean and the bed comfortable. The hotel was relatively new while I felt like I received a great value. would highly recommend to others.

Reviews.Title: “Poor service”
Reviews.Author: tinsle
Reviews.Content: - Checkin, the clerks didn't even acknowledge our presence, and when one finally did he was walking out and told us the other clerk will help us. This was just before 9pm. - We get to our room drop our bags and come back down to got get something to eat. The elevator is very small. But this is NYC. - We come back just before midnight, ready to have a bath, the bathtub is completely dirty. I mean dirty, no one washed it after the last guest used it, you could see the ring all around the rub. We call them and they ask why we didn't call earlier, we tell them we went out to eat after dropping our bags in our room, there's no one to clean right now so we have to weight till morning. - We have some leftover food, the refrigerator is dirty obviously it wasn't cleaned either. - Morning comes, we call to ask for someone to clean the tub, but no housekeeping until after 9a.m. We use the shower, there were no hand or face towels just bath towels. We have to rush to our tour bus leaving at 10a.m. - The desk had coffee stains, I thoroughly inspected the bedsheets and was surprised they were clean. - Later that night, you remember our leftovers, we request for a microwave or microwave service, the clerk at the desk says they don't have access to any in the hotel. My husband doesn't believe this and calls them again 5 minutes later, .... miraculously there is a microwave downstairs where breakfast is served, but they will have to do it for us. - I head on downstairs with the leftovers and lo and behold you can use the microwave its right there. Of course it was a dirty microwave with no turntable even though it needed one. - There is parking across the street for about $36 a day, anywhere cheaper? oh we have a deal with the other one about a block from here for $30 a day. - I would not recommend this hotel to anyone because of poor service and the blatant lack of cleanliness, the price notwithstanding.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: mdmilburne
Reviews.Content: Great location in Time Square. Hotel and hotel room was clean, Staff was friendly and helpful. Great pricing for the location.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Cookaja38
Reviews.Content: If you want to be in Times Square this is great. All the fun of the area, the variety of restaurants and excitement until the early hours are all here. From our room we could see the Hershey's sign but we didnt experience any undue noise from outside. The room definately is decorated in a "style" that may not be to everyone's taste, but for the price it was good value. The room is very small as is the bathroom but our only complaint was that the airconditioners are ancient and cannot keep up with the NY summer. We messed around a lot with it and eventually got the temperature to OK, but never really comfortable. Still, very good value for the location.

Reviews.Title: “Will always stay here in NYC”
Reviews.Author: Grandmaat40
Reviews.Content: My husband & I stayed here in 2002 and the hotel has updated since then. It is great! Our room was large in NYC terms. We were there during 90+ degree weather so we would retire to the hotel hot, sore and tired. The beds were amazing. We both woke up refreshed and pain free. The location can't be beat! A half block to Times Square or 8th Ave. We found plenty of places to eat nearby at great prices. The subway lines were close by as well. The staff was great. We had no problems checking in or out. There was hallway noise but you couldn't hear the room next door at all while in your room. This will be our NYC hotel of choice from now on.

Reviews.Title: “Hustle and Bustle Best Western place to be!”
Reviews.Author: Path2010
Reviews.Content: Was very happy with my selection. The hotel is a wonderful place beautifully decorated. The lobby is very soothing. Bed very comfortable. The price is right. I wouldn't go anyplace else. The location is fantastic just around the corner form Times Square. I had a meeting on Broadway and walked thier easily. Concierge and Front Desk staff very nice. Maid service good room very very clean. Don't hesitate to stay. Plenty of restaraunts in the area. Enjoy

Reviews.Title: “100% satisfied will be back to NYC”
Reviews.Author: friendAustralia10
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel after reading the favorable reviews on Trip Advisor. My nights at this hotel was 100% consistant with those favorable Trip Advisor reviews. The room we had included a balcony overlooking the the manhattan skyline. The hotel staff were exceptionally friendly/helpful. The price was a good bargain compared to other hotels that I saw when searching for a hotel. I liked everything about my stay especially the location...If you are going to a Broadway Show try and get the half price Tickets around the corner at TKTS. Near the subway and surrounded by all types of restaraunts. Enjoy

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Preta_10
Reviews.Content: Hello, I'm Brazilian and I went to the Best Western on days 14.7 to 18.7. I got there and was very well received, the hotel is very nice, had no problem, hot water, air conditioning, internet ... I had what I complain ... Very well located, I felt very good, always go back to NY I will come back to this hotel and indicate it to all employees ... very nice ... I loved it ... I think those people who complained about the Best Western President Hotel is very boring, or too boo. The hotel served me perfectly. The manager is very attentive ... and staff as well. Note 10!!

Reviews.Title: “Won't stay again.”
Reviews.Author: LeesaSoulodre
Reviews.Content: I had to travel to NY for work for 3 days and had a colleague joining me for the last day. My flight was delayed and I didn't manage to check into the hotel until 9pm. My father has just passed away from lung cancer and I specifically asked for a non-smoking room on both my booking and the front desk. I was handed the keys to what was a very small but decent room. On entering it smelled musty and old, but to be honest I was so exhausted from the 9 hour flight and still had a presentation to prepare, so I just had a shower and climbed into bed with my laptop. Wifi worked - thank goodness. With a warm day just gone, the ventilator was freezing cold and on calling reception a maintenance man kindly came to my room and showed me where the buttons were to reduce the chill. Only one cup of coffee in the coffee percolator, and the head of the front desk is as tough as they come. There was no breakfast included in our room which again was part of the request. Early that morning, as I left for my meetings, I put the sign on the door to ask them to clean it, hoping it would take away the smell - but on returning late that evening, the smell remained. I had locked my door key in the room and had to request another from the reception. It failed to work after he programmed it and I had to travel down the 14 floors to ask him to do it all over again. The night before when I arrived, I had heard a guest complaining of the same thing. Wifi worked but they were unable to offer any additional business services. Their business centre equated to sticking 5 dollars in a machine to secure a print job. Not ideal for the delivery of an important presentation. However, a great location as I was very close to all my business clients and very close to Times Square. Great recommendation for sushi around the corner at Bluefin from the front desk. The room was at least clean and the bed comfortable despite the fact that I felt like I was breathing in half an old ashtray. Great shower. 3 stars out of 10.

Reviews.Title: “Adequate but not great”
Reviews.Author: YonyYamathon
Reviews.Content: The location is central to say the least. The rooms have been nicely decorated, though even our 'queen' room was a little small. Still, this is central NY so perhaps to be expected. The manner of the staff is brief, bordering on rude. The hotel is also slightly grubby and smelly and the cleaning staff need to brush up on their toilet-cleaning abilities. This hotel is adequate but I'm not sure I'd do back without looking hard for a similar-priced alternative.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: jimjam14
Reviews.Content: The President Hotel is certainly in a great location just a couple of minutes walk from Times Square. There was a group of us scattered in various hotels through the city but ours had to be 'the best location'! The hotel itself is very boutique looking and modernly styled, however public areas were very small. To our knowledge there was just the main reception come bar come seating come tv area all in one. We weren't expecting the rooms to be huge and they weren't, however we did get an upgrade to a King Room and the bed was extremely comfortable and the rooms clean. A few issues came up: Showere Curtain was really smelly, put up with a few days but had to ask the maid to change - a real strong damp smell that hit you as soon as you entered : and also the water pipes were really loud when showering and you felt as though they were going to burst the noise was that loud. The guy who checked us in wasn't that helpful. He simply asked our name, took a credit card and told us our room number - no mention of anything to do with hotel, how to get to room, local area, if we needed help, etc. Not very pleasant, but we did witness other staff doing these things with other guests. We would likely stay here again due to location and price but with NY being so big it would be rude not to try other places!

Reviews.Title: “What an Improvement!!!”
Reviews.Author: eprVancouver
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel several times because of its wonderful location. Two years ago, the lack of service and cleanliness prompted me to stay elsewhere. However I recently noticed that the hotel had undergone major renovations. What a difference!! The rooms were clean, bright, modern and the front desk was very helpful. The bed was one of the nicest I have ever slept on. The only reason I am not giving it five stars is the size of the room is a little small. I would not hesitate to stay there again in future trips.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant !”
Reviews.Author: petersuk2011
Reviews.Content: Brilliant ! Stayed at the hotel for 5 days in July. I would like to say a big thank you to all, the very friendly staff made my holiday absolutely brilliant they were all very helpful nothing was too much trouble, my wife and I had a fantastic time. The room was very spacious and airy and the maid service was excellent. This hotel was close enough to the shops but far enough away from night time noise of Times Square. I would recommend this hotel to anyone it is simply brilliant . We are excited about returning next year to the President Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Will NEVER return!”
Reviews.Author: Kellyomaha
Reviews.Content: I would never recommend this hotel to anyone. From the minute we walked in until we left our stay sucked! We had to wait until 3 to check in which surprises me as we made our reservations 6 weeks out. Then the hotel air conditioner wasn't working and the city was in a heat wave. There was not air conditioning in the hallways nor the elevators which is no fun when it is July in New York . The female concierge at the hotel was rude and I was afraid to ask her any questions regarding what to do or where to go. I have never been to a hotel where I have to call for my reservations! Then to top it off she would give information on a piece of scratch paper. So we quit asking her questions. We had to have our toilet plunged at least three times while we were there. We NEVER had a hot shower once. Couldn't wait to get home to take a hot shower! Our sheets were stained and nasty. The hotel had a nasty smell to it the whole time we were there. The ONE positive thing I can say is the maids were very friendly. Never stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Suited everyone great choice”
Reviews.Author: mofcorkireland
Reviews.Content: 6 of us spent 10 great days here we shared a suite with our 2 teenagers. It was roomy spotless, and very comfortable. I chose this hotel over many others, all of our party were delighted much to my relief. Jay (Tom)the manager couldnt have been more helpfull, Im going back and wouldnt stay anywhere else

Reviews.Title: “Satisfied Customer”
Reviews.Author: awaywego129
Reviews.Content: - wasn't my first choice, but was plesently surprised (I mean, you hear BEST WESTERN and it doesn't exactly scream NEW YORK.) - somewhat surly front desk staff, but that's to be expected (it is NEW YORK). Helpful enough. - extended my stay by a day (which I had intended, but it says alot for the hotel that I didn't switch hotels for that one extra day)

Reviews.Title: “We were made so welcome”
Reviews.Author: jonward098765
Reviews.Content: We arrived early and were made welcome by the Receiptionist Suny. Nothing was too much bother. The Hotel was very convenient to Time Square and being just off the beaten track was as quiet and any hotel in New York. We moved over to 8th for dinner and found some great places to eat. The staff made our stay at the President great.

Reviews.Title: “Great Find in NYC”
Reviews.Author: PsiCopB5
Reviews.Content: The BW President is in Times Square, making it easy to get from there to almost any other point in the city. My room was clean and well-appointed, and very comfortably sized for a NYC hotel room. The staff was friendly and helpful, for instance allowing me to check in about an hour early. The price was excellent compared to other NYC/Times Square hotels of comparable quality. I will be back here, to be sure!

Reviews.Title: “Best Western President Hotel New York City”
Reviews.Author: busyguy44
Reviews.Content: Traveled to a conference last week to NYC. Spent the night at the Best Western President Hotel. The hotel was within my companies budget. The location was close to midtown. Room was clean and comfotable. Staff was pleasant and knowledgable. I would recommend this hotel to not only business travelers but to anyone. I took the train to the city and found it easy to get a cab over to the hotel. Lots of restaraunts in the area. The fitness center was also very up to date. enjoyed my stay

Reviews.Title: “Very conveniently located at really good rate”
Reviews.Author: theyoungindian
Reviews.Content: The hotel is travelliers delight....located bang on times square....this hotel has good ambience.....at really good rates as per manhattan hotel standards.......connecting to wifi can be a hassle at times.....bt the otherwise the hotel is too gooooood...........

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel Excellent Value Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: abab123
Reviews.Content: When traveling recently to New York I found this great value in central NYC. Registration was friendly, they accommodated my early check-in 11am, the room was fresh and clean. The shower was good and overall the room was very comfortable. The location was perfect near my business and close to several restaurants. At night plenty of bars in the area to relax. Taxis to airport right outside the hotel. I received a great value and would recommend to others.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here.”
Reviews.Author: annsmom
Reviews.Content: Looking for a hotel close to Times Square and I found the Best Western President. Everything I read made it sound like a good place, but we were not happy from beginning to end. It is 1 block off of Times Square, right in the middle of the Theater district which was good for us. But that was about it. When we checked in there was a long line and one clerk. After she would check people in she would stop and call housekeeping to let them which room she had checked people in to. This was a little after 4 in the afternoon. Someone finally came to help her, but as soon as they started, the original desk clerk left, so there was still only one check in clerk. We finally got checked in, got to our room and found our it wasn't cleaned yet. My husband called to let them know but it was still about an hour before it was ready. The decor was hideous, we felt like we were in a brothel. The knobs on one of the air conditioning units were broken and not fixed the two days we were there. Light bulb in the bathroom was out but they did replace it. Sheets on the beds felt like they were maybe 50 thread count if that's possible. They were stiff and felt like they had been starched. To small for the beds so they continually came untucked. One tiny closet, no drawer space at all. Windows looked out over a trash filled alley. The hallway from the elevator to our room was lined with cleaning carts, cleaning supplies and dirty linen when we checked in. It was all still there when we checked out 2 days later, nothing had been moved. Hallways were dark and unairconditioned. Elevators were tiny and slow. Good things, the bell men were very helpful and friendly, with lots of good advice and directions. Chinese restaurant was excellent. I got a survey request from the management after we left and filled it out with everything in this review. I did get a response from them apologizing. Hopefully they will correct things.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect, central base for solo travel”
Reviews.Author: sarahsmurf1
Reviews.Content: I had a few days R&R from work, so took a flight to NYC for a weekend break; my first time in the city. I had been in contact with the staff there before arrival who were incredibly helpful and reassuring. On arrival, check in was one of the most straightforward I've had taking only moments. The reception staff were all pleasant and welcoming. I didn't spend much time in the hotel itself, but it's a lovely location for a pre dinner glass of wine, or a little night-cap before bed. The room was small but perfectly formed. As it was just me, I only requested a single room and this was perfect, had everything. It was beautifully decorated, with soft lighting, flat screen tv, ipod dock, clean bathroom with a powerful shower. But the bed. The bed was the cherry on top. It was the perfect level of softness - the perfect cosy respite on a weekend escape. The location of the hotel is great if you want o explore - just off of Times Square it holds the balance of location and calm (the noise didn't drift over), and you're seconds from some of the biggest shows on Broadway. Couple of blocks' walk south brings you to Macy's, Penn Station (from where I arrived) and a host of other stores. Equally you can stroll up either Broadway or 7th Avenue up to Central Park to wander around. 5th Avenue with Saks, Bloomingdale's and the shops of 57th street are all an easy walk away, as are the Rockefeller Centre, Radio City, Empire State, MoMA. If, like me, it's your first visit, then there are a range of buses (public and private) to explore the city in all directions. Everything is within your reach here. After a late night up in Yorkville (upper east side) it was only $8 to get a cab back to your door. And for when you're leaving, the reception staff will get you a cab or give you any advice in terms or directions and timings for your flight and airport. All questions answered! As many colleagues take weekend breaks to New York, I'll certainly be recommending this as a wonderful base. Thanks a lot to the hotel for helping me have a nice, relaxing, hassle-free weekend!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location for a newyly renovated hotel, pleasant and most helpful staff.”
Reviews.Author: Kasi24
Reviews.Content: The hotel is tastefully upgraded, excellent location for sightseeing with a pleasant and helpful staff. Highly recommended for a base to see Manhattan. Not a lot of amenities but good value.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't be more pleased!”
Reviews.Author: OlderTouristCouple
Reviews.Content: The location is great: a block or two from Chinatown, with it's awesome Eastern foods and Little Italy, with a flavor of NYC. Again, within a block or so is the train to take you to Midtown and all the fun sights and sounds of Times Sq., etc. The staff: The front desk provide quick, efficient check-in and are very polite and friendly (quiet different from the usual NYC reception). Special mention of Sayed must be made: he went above and beyond to accommodate us; he pays careful attention to cultural differences and will make you feel at home. The housekeeping staff was thorough, timely, and also very polite. Hotel Services: breakfast was great; I am tired of eggs in a bottle and was happy to find real eggs (hardboiled). The rest of the spread is good too.

Reviews.Title: “It was a great place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: grandatty
Reviews.Content: The service was excellent from check-in to check out. The room was perfect for my needs, in excellent condition and well serviced by the hotel staff. The location was perfect for my visit to New York City with many amenities and attractions in the area. I liked best the treatment I received from the staff. Really no bad part of the experience.

Reviews.Title: “Location excellent....rooms, small but clean....service hit & miss”
Reviews.Author: pjheywood
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is simply excellent, right in the heart of Times Sq and every bit of Manhattan is easily accessible. It's right next door to a fantastic bar, Hurley's, and on the same street as two Broadway theatre's, where we stumbled upon an autograph signing with Kelsey Grammer at the end of a show. The area felt very safe and there's plenty of bars, restaurants and shops nearby and away from Time Sq, if you want to head in the opposite direction to the crowds. The hotel is contemporary styled for a Best Western and the lobby interior has a cool designer's touch to it. Unfortunately, the staff at reception didn't always match the bright and friendly feel of the decor. We arrived to another guest complaining (unecessarily so) about the room he'd been allocated and whilst the receptionist was firm but respectable to him, we felt we bore the brunt of her anoyance as the next guests in line to check in, her frustration was obvious and she was a bit rude, although check in was quick (probably so she could go punch a wall or something). There were also two receptionists checking people in originally but the second must have been clocking off her shift as she did that frustrating thing where you're wating to be served but she just shuffled paper before wandering off, leaving a line of guests waiting to check in. This may have been an isolated welcome though, and in no way reflects the attitude of all of the staff. We forgot our room safe code late at night and the male receptionist was really helpful and sorted us out extremely quickly. The bell boy service was also excellent. There is breakfast served in the lobby each morning and a restaurant attached for lunch and dinner but we didn't use either service, there was too much choice elsewhere. There is a small lobby bar open in the evening but the prices are pretty steep....three bottles of beer and a JD & coke came to $35. The room we stayed in (1329) was small, the bed pretty cramped for American & UK standards and the bathroom was tiny but it was all very clean and room service came daily. We had a 32" wall mounted LCD TV, with lots of channels and the room had an iron/ironing board. I think there should have been tea & coffe making facilities, as friends of ours had this in their room but ours was without. We got woken during the night once by an almighty row going on next door with some other guests, which lasted some time and the room was shaking with the noise of foul language and running about the floor. Although this was annoying it didn't reflect the normal standard of guests and I don't want to give the impression that this is a hotel with a problem crowd, as we didn't see any other examples of bad behaviour. Any other noise was minimal, apart from the odd siren and car horn, which was surprising seeing as we were so close to the hustle and bustle of Times Sq. Our room was also next to a lift and we didn't hear anything in the way of mechanical or people noise. The air conditioner is window mounted and a bit blowy but hardly a sleep-breaker. Overall and mainly for the location, we definitely would stay here again, although I'd pay more for a bigger room and bed.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet in Times Square”
Reviews.Author: raffael_10
Reviews.Content: I stayed for 9 days in your hotel and the room was suprisingly quiet. The staff has been very helpful and always gentle. I could recommend it for anybody that wants to feel the pulse of NYC without the noise and for a very affordable price.

Reviews.Title: “Courteous & Clean”
Reviews.Author: khrisa709
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel because of location and price. I was a bit hesitant about booking this hotel because there were bad yet okay reviews. I emailed the general manager about my concerns and I received a quick response. The service was great for the price I paid. The only issue I had was that there was no ice bucket in my room and the 10th Fl. ice machine did not work. Otherwise, I enjoyed my stay and I'd book this hotel in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Greatest night sleep in the middle of NYC!!!”
Reviews.Author: hdhd1945
Reviews.Content: I couldn't believe the value I recieved at this first class hotel. I arrived in a cab and the bellman quickly took my luggage. Walked into a beautiful lobby had a good registraiton expeience. The room was fresh and clean. Shower was very good bed/sleep was even better. Didnt try the restaraunt. I ate nearby at a very nice pub, next door. IN fact I saw two movie stars while I was eating. Made my way around Manhattan with ease since I was right in the middle of the action. I would highly recommned this hotel to all business travelers. I recieved a very nice value and will return. Do not hesitate to book there, felt very safe in this part of Manhattan. ohh the Lobby Bar was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Location/ Renovation/ Service Outstanding!!!”
Reviews.Author: oceanvw42
Reviews.Content: Location, Location in the middle of Times Square.. my partner & I (soon to be engaged) enjoyed the atmospere the second we arrived at the Best Western President Hotel, New York...We stayed in our upscale renovated room the entire day!! Mature staff very hospitable..& polite...I compared this hotel to the Le Merdian 5th Ave ($400 per night)...I was impressed the cost & service.. step out the door your in the Theater Dist. Tour Buses, Time Sq. & great everything... Manager William Bornheimer..thanks a million for sending me my original Driver's Licences that lost in your lobby. Yes Sir I recommend the Hotel to Dr. Trump, Beyonce, and myself just to name a few.. God Bless keep up the great service.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location - not 4 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: dressagenorway
Reviews.Content: We arrived in New York in a blizzard on february 25. Booked Best Western President hotel after reading reviews on TA. Hotel is located between Broadway and 8th avenue on 48 street. Location is great, with all the main theatres within 10 minutes walk. The only ticket office for discounted tickets (half off) for tonights shows is located on Times Square and only 2 minutes from the hotel. You can walk to Empire state building (15 min) , Top of the Rocks(Rockefeller building) (8 min) Central Park is 20 min away. So location is very good. As to the hotel it self it is a bit worn down, despite beeing redecorated recently. It seems they modernized it by tapestry, furniture and paint only. The elevators are small and slow, and was out of function now and then. The aircondition is horrible, loud and ineffective. We ordered the Deluxe room with Queen bed, and when we arrived the room was so small we could not believe it, and the smell in the room was awful. Contacted the reception an was given a standard room for the night. The next day we were given a bigger room, deluxe with king bed, big and nice, but still with a nonfunctioning aircondition. This was february/march - I would not like to stay there during summer. Over all I would say the service was good, as they attended to our complaints immediately, and the location is very good. Would I go back? To New Yord - YESS!! to Best Western President - dont think so. A

Reviews.Title: “Great location, affortable, small rooms, good value”
Reviews.Author: devexit
Reviews.Content: Great location, close to Time Square, but still as quiet as you can get at Manhattan. The room was very small but clean and the same applies to the bathroom. Our room was located at the end of corridor, this was probably why there was not too much noise coming from the hallway either. The doors would not have prevented sounds coming through. From our experience, it is hard to find reasonable hotel with budget rate in New York. President hotel has come closest, what we have experienced. Our friends had a "suite" at the same time. They had the same experience. The suite was larger room with added very little "living room".

Reviews.Title: “Great location at the Best Western President Hotel in NYC”
Reviews.Author: rustysmom
Reviews.Content: We stayed Saturday night at the Best Western on 48th Street right outside Times Square and near Broadway in Manhattan so that we could see "Fences" at the Cort Theatre. The hotel lobby was very funky with these large white pillars that looked that lamp shades that escaped from some Alice in Wonderland set. The lobby was small but adequate. The bellman held our luggage since we arrived early. When we returned to the hotel in the late afternoon our room on the 12th floor was ready. It was tiny by most standards, but again adequate. It was clean and the bed was comfortable. The best thing about the hotel is the location. It is very convenient to everything...right outside Times Sq., a happening place, and convenient to all the theaters. We were able to walk back and forth to the show, could have eaten at any one of a number of places including those on restaurant row, and walked to and from Penn station to get to the hotel. Very handy. It was NOT cheap (rate of approx.$224, $260 with taxes), but not expensive either by NYC standards. Although I would probably look for a nicer/larger place to stay if we do it again, I would also stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Awsome time great Value super location”
Reviews.Author: roadwarrior2011a
Reviews.Content: It was quite busy time . Overall an excellent property that has been completely renovated over the last couple of years. The specifics: Check-In: Desk clerk was friendly and identified the reservation easilyBest Western Rewards member and recieved a free upgrade. Rate was as advertised. Staff very knowledgable of the area helped with reservations and directions The Room: Typical King room with beautiful marble in laid table, free wireless Very comfortable mattress and pillows. Free Wifi in lobby Flat screen TV with many channels. I would recommend this hotel to business travelers and families. Great Location and friendly staff. The room was very clean and hallways very nice decor.

Reviews.Title: “The worst hotel experience in years”
Reviews.Author: Gabsiati
Reviews.Content: The room I stayed in, 211 had an air conditioning unit just outside the window that was so loud that - not only that I couldn't sleep because of the noise - but you couldn't even hear the TV. I went to the reception and asked to be moved. They said that they were completely booked for the night. I asked to be moved to another hotel (I couldn't just get up and leave as I had already paid for the room at the time of the booking - non-refundible offer. Now I know why). They appeared to be making a few phone calls and said that everything was booked. The night receptionist was nice enough, it wasn't his fault I guess, he was only working there. He gave me ear plugs and that was that. Ohh, did I mention the ants in the room and the bed? Also, the old bathroom and shower that looked like they've seen better days. All in all, the worst hotel experience I've had in a long time. And I travel a lot. I would not recomend this hotel to anybody.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great value for what i paid. Will return”
Reviews.Author: cougar00
Reviews.Content: I don't know about the other people who have bad reviewed the hotel, but I think when you're in new york city, you dont really spend much time in your room. We went to sleep and rested during the day for a couple of hours. THe location is absolutely amazing. The Ritz is right across the street and the hilton around the corner, so it is definitely in a great area. THere were a few maintenance issues, but you get that anywhere you go, especially when most of new york city buildings are pretty old. For what we paid, it was a great deal. THe price you pay is for location and you can get a taxi right outside the hotel. Just walk out and you'll get one. The internet worked pretty good in our room and my inlaw's room. The closer you were to the hallway the better the signal (obviously). The renovations are great, it looks very trendy. The two restaurants are pretty good in the hotel. Overall, great hotel and great location. I will return and will recommend to others!!

Reviews.Title: “Location is great!”
Reviews.Author: hikers51
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed for five nights. Chose this hotel because we had previously stayed there. The recent renovation has updated the hotel nicely. The location can't be beat. It is close to all subway lines, the theatre, Times Square, Rockefeller Center and a Food Emporium (for grocery items). Our room was a double but was not too crowded. The only complaint we had was the room never had enough bath linens. We always received the linens we requested after two phone calls and a wait. Will stay again our next time in New York.

Reviews.Title: “So disappointed”
Reviews.Author: Brooke626
Reviews.Content: When I arrived at the hotel I had high expectations. The decor was stylish (if a bit feminine) and the lobby was clean and welcoming. However, upon arriving in our room I saw that the shower HAD NOT been cleaned... there were several open and used bars of soap, an open shampoo bottle, and a LARGE quantity of blond hair everywhere. I called down to complain and they sent someone right up. However, when I returned to the room in the evening to sleep, and pulled back the covers, I was disgusted to see BROWN hair all over the sheets, pillows and comforter. I had to call down once again (at midnight now) ask for CLEAN sheets, and then got to strip and make the bed myself. NOT the dream NYC hotel experience I was looking forward to. I will never return.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, ok everything else”
Reviews.Author: Raeleeb
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Best Western President Hotel during my trip to New York. I know I had read lots of bad reviews about it, and nothing surprised me. There were maid carts in the hallway the ENTIRE time we were there. There was a nasty fridge in the ice room that had some sticky, smelly plastic bag hanging out of it. The water started going so crazy in the shower, it was shooting out so fast, it literally felt like little water bullets were piercing my skin. The bed was not very comfortable. Blah, blah, blah. Normally I am one of those people who will pay extra for the view and the comfort because I generally like to stay in the room a lot while I am on vacation, just relaxing, but in New York, who cares. The location was fantastic!!! It's right in Times Square, everything is at your fingertips. We loved walking around at night and never felt unsafe. We explored every part of New York and it was a great place to come back to at night. We saw a great comedy show at the Broadway Comedy Club one night, we went to a cute Mexican restaurant that was kitty corner. We got to see Katherine Zeta-Jones exit the theatre after her performance unexpectedly. The man who checked us in was very pleasant, the fitness center was nice. The decor is fun and trendy. Maybe a little too trendy? I didn't like how the lobby was constantly full of people waiting to leave the hotel after check out and I wanted to ask the door man a question. I said to him "Can I ask you a question?". I was trying to be polite. He just stared at me. So I said "So, can I ask you a question?!" " So ask!" he said so rudely. Maybe I'm a good tipper, but not after that snide comment! All in all, I don't think I would choose to stay here again, but I'm still alive and I had a great time.

Reviews.Title: “small rooms, needs maintenance”
Reviews.Author: rb-7865
Reviews.Content: Tiny room smelling of stale smoke. A/C unit wouldn't cool, only fan. Bathroom ceiling leaked severely when it rained. While the location is excellent, the lack of quality for the price makes it feel like a ripoff.

Reviews.Title: “Evaluating Bathroom”
Reviews.Author: Lorelei74
Reviews.Content: This is a beautifully renovated hotel in the heart of NYC. However, whoever did the plumbing for our bathroom was careless. The sink leaked on the floor and both faucets gave hot water instead of one hot and one cold.

Reviews.Title: “Business traveler will return”
Reviews.Author: WorldTraveler2008a
Reviews.Content: I was here on business last week for 5 days and was pleasantly surprised. The hotel was appeared to be recently refurnished. The check in was very quick, I was here on business and need a larger room… the reception suggested an upgrade to a mini-suite which I took for a few dollars more per night. I was glad I did the room was very comfortable with a view of the Hudson river!! They also provided free internet access (most hotels charge up to $15. per day) which I had no problem connecting. The room was modestly furnished with a large flat screen TV and a desk. The shower was amazingly hot. The service overall was good and the room very clean. I needed a few things printed from my laptop; the front desk didn’t hesitate to work a way for me to print them. The hotel’s location was very convenient to just about everything in midtown, the subway was close but I used a yellow cab for most of the time. Overall- a very good deal. I would definitely recommend to other business travelers not just tourists. I will be returning.

Reviews.Title: “you must be kidding”
Reviews.Author: fuffyboy
Reviews.Content: The room was very very very very small and nothing like the photos on line. Two people could not be standing up at the same time getting dressed. It's like a big closet. A bit run down looking. Housekeeping carts were ALWAYS in the hallway, blocking the narrow hallways. Cleaning woman tried to open my door at 8:30 am on a sunday morning without knocking and I was still in bed sleeping. She was rude and her only explanation was that she was looking for vacant rooms. After I got dressed, the same woman was in the hallway complaining about having to work there. The manager is named Steve and was polite but no real help. Location is good. Price is way TOO HIGH for that kind of abuse. Lots of noise in the hallways. Don't go there. Not worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Adequate”
Reviews.Author: bmore5219
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I wanted to get away for a day so we decided to go to New York for dinner and a show- the whole deal. I found the hotel through trip advisor and the price seemed reasonable enough. Firstly, the hotel is remarkably close to Penn Station. So if you’re arriving by train it’s only a 10 minute walk to the hotel- Very convenient. Secondly, the hotel is only a block or two away from Times Square and the theatre district. My girlfriend and I were seeing a show and the location was perfect for us. The show began at 8; we left the hotel at 7:15 and arrived with plenty of time to spare. The best thing about this hotel by far is its location. It seems to be right smack dab in the center of midtown Manhattan. But there is a caveat- it’s an incredibly busy area. I have stayed in New York a bunch of times but usually in the Upper-West Side, a much quieter, neighborhood type of area, but I must say the location was a refreshing change especially since our main objective was to see a show. Also, the location is perfect for getting a drink at basically any time of the night. Restaurants surround the hotel, both to the left and right, and one feels quite as ease leaving at midnight to get a drink and expect to return home safely. There’s something about the sheer number of people around that leaves you believing nothing will happen because you know no one is going to lurch out from behind some bush. As for the hotel- the entrance is beautiful. The décor is a great example of modernity. The front desk clerks who I dealt with were very nice and helpful. Checking into my room was quick and simple. The hotel only has two elevators and they seem to be extremely slow. Again, not a big deal but certainly a little annoying. The room we stayed in was extremely small. I mean open the door and the bed was right there. I wish I would have known more about the size of the room because I definitely wanted to upgrade. That being said, we were only going to be there for one night so not really a big deal. Now, the décor in the room was as crazy as anything I ever saw. The ceiling was purple and there was a picture of JFK and Jackie O on the wall. But you know what? I kind of liked it. It was different, unique, unlike anything I experienced before. As my girlfriend said, “we will never forget what this room looks like.” Is it worth staying here? I think so. It really depends on the length of your trip. We were there for one night and even still I knew that we wouldn’t be in the hotel for that long. It was perfectly adequate for what we required. That being said, I cannot fully say yes or no in regards to whether or not this hotel is a good fit for a lengthier trip because our room was so small and I didn’t get a chance to see anything bigger. But as I mentioned before, if anything, staying here might be worth it because of the location alone. So close to everything touristy- and I mean that in a good way. The iron didn’t work but then again the people at the front desk seemed nice enough that if I would have complained they probably would have replaced it. Again, it’s worth staying here if you’re in town for a few days and you don’t plan on spending your vacation in a hotel- but then again, why would you?

Reviews.Title: “First time in NY? Use this hotel! Convenient! Nice!”
Reviews.Author: KazMagee
Reviews.Content: I am a Rewards Card holder with Best Western so I picked out a BW hotel that was central to most things in NYC. This was a surprise for my husband's 30th birthday, so wanted something nice. The hotel had been newly refurbished, and when I booked it in Sept '09 I requested that we got 2 new rooms (we went with another couple). This was noted on our booking. Upon arriving at the hotel we were upgraded to the next size room. Although it was stil just a room with a bed and chair there was a bit more room to walk about. When you stay in NY you don't expect anything other than a bed and wash facilities. We had a 37" flat screen tv, an ipod dock alarm clock and a chair&footstool. This was plenty. We didn't spend much time in the room as we tried to make the most of our time in NY. We were in room 306. We had to run the hot water for 5-10mins every morning before got hot water, but that wasn't really that annoying. Gave you time to wake up. The bath didn't drain so well though which was a wee bit annoying. Our friends in 304 had hot water, but bath didn't drain that well either. When my husband looked at the hotel directory, it said they used the fitness suite across the road for $20 a day. Their website said they had their own. We should have checked this out sooner. On the 2nd last day we found that the glass elevator at the front of the hotel went down to basement where they had their internet and fitness facilities. My husband and my friend's husband would have used this in the mornings had they known. We didn't eat in the hotel so I can't comment on that, but on looks, the food looked nice. We had to ask for extra pillows and towels and they were brought to the room pretty promptly. Only thing I would say would be that having a kettle and a fridge in the room would be beneficial as not everyone likes coffee, and somewhere to keep drinks cool be great. The hotel had a central location being 1 avenue away from Times Square. Yet once in the hotel you couldn't hear a thing. It was perfect. If I wanted to go back to NY and stay centrally then I would definitely stay here and definitely recommend it to anyone else going. Just note by the way that it is much better to arrange the shuttle from hotel to airport rather than taxi and train it to airport. Was $18 per person to Newark Airport. Just leave in plenty of time so you don't get stuck in traffic (mind you our flight got cancelled due to volcano stuff in Iceland closing UK airspace-but thats a whole other story readers!)

Reviews.Title: “Okay but avoid the restaurant”
Reviews.Author: Cambridge2rist
